title: Datacenter Program Manager
desc: In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day and we need you as a Senior Program Manager. Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. By enabling data center capacity through increased Infrastructure Utilization Effectiveness (IUE) and Power Harvesting (PH), you will lead the retrofit efforts to upgrade legacy datacenters and harvest capacity in our existing fleet. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development of all employees and offers trainings and opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion trainings and events, and professional certifications. The CO+I Data Center Services (DCS) IUE / PH team is seeking a seasoned and innovative Senior Program Manager with a passion for leading vTeams within our datacenter fleet to harvest capacity, develop engineering solutions that upgrade our facilities, leading process development and improvements, data analytics, technology, and operations. You would join a team that spans multiple functional teams collaborating and partnering to increase our IUE to a world class standard. Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 200 datacenters and 1 million servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide. With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our Data Center design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that make Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider. Do you want to empower billions across the world? Come and join us in CO+I and be at the forefront of the action! Come help us build the best Cloud on the planet! no -- Principals only. title: Seeking: Fanduel Trader
desc: Job Title: Fanduel Dublin Trader Team: Global Services Reporting Line: Fanduel Dublin Trading Manager Job Location/Office: Dublin Role Overview/Purpose: This is a great opportunity for somebody who wants to work in an environment where curiosity is rewarded and people are empowered to make informed choices. The ideal candidate will have a passion for learning and a head for numbers. Successful candidates will be tasked with a range of duties aligned to offering a first-class experience for our customers. You will also have the opportunity to progress within the department or cross functionally. This is what you'll be doing: Involved in the compilation and changing of our betting odds (primarily during live games), for Events within NFL, MLB, NBA, US College Basketball, US College American Football and Ad Hoc Events for the US markets such as Nascar The monitoring of our customers' behaviour and identifying new and exciting opportunities to improve our already best-in-class experience for our customer will also be key to the role Responsibility for the commercial ownership of a selected number of Sports from the following list, including but not limited to: Soccer, Tennis, Golf, UFC/Boxing, European Basketball, European Ice Hockey, Table Tennis & Motorsport Monitor competitor pricing and product to ensure we can react to changing market dynamics Optimising strategic industry advantage such as Margin Chart differentials, establishing competitive advantages across multiple States through content optimisation and enhanced product Behavioural Competencies Customer focused - thinks about customers 24/7 and creates processes, solutions etc. which tangibly improve customer experience. Attention to detail - is able to spot anomalies in large quantities of data and has the focus to constantly improve the finer details Effective Collaborator - works with others within the team and the wider organisation, whilst communicating effectively across a range of channels and audiences. Ability to work at pace, on own initiative and learn as they go. Makes quality decisions - makes confident decisions under pressure. Problem solver - ability to use what little details may be available to produce concise steps towards incident resolution. Ability to see problems before they become impactful. Education, Qualifications & Experience Previous industry experience with close interaction with at least one US Sports or one other aforementioned Sport (Soccer, Tennis, Golf, UFC/Boxing, Euro Basketball, Euro Ice Hockey, Table Tennis & Motorsport) preferred A passion for your role and a track record of strong performance A passion for US Sports is a must, College US Sports knowledge (in particular College Football) is an advantage High computer literacy with a strong standard of Excel Excellent numerical ability no -- Principals only. title: Senior Manager, Quality Operations, Drug Product, EMEA and …
desc: At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference. Bristol Myers Squibb Ireland Bristol Myers Squibb has been in operation in Ireland since 1964, employing over 650 people across a range of activities and business units. Ireland is home to External manufacturing’s global headquarters, the business unit responsible for the management of manufacturing contract operations (CMO’s) and ensuring reliable supply of product to patients across the Bristol Myers Squibb global network. This includes management of, and working in conjunction with, third party contract manufacturers and internal manufacturing sites. In Ireland, External Manufacturing has two sites; Global Headquarters based in Dublin 15 and a distribution centre in Shannon, Co Clare . For more information about Bristol Myers Squibb, visit us at BMS.com/ie The Role BMS External Manufacturing is looking to recruit a permanent Senior Manager, Quality Operations, Drug Product, EMEA and Asia Pacific . Senior Manager, Quality Operations, Drug Product, EMEA and Asia Pacific will p rovide quality and compliance oversight management to third party manufacturers engaged by External Manufacturing within a cross functional team . This position is eligible for hybrid working. Key Duties and Responsibilities: Proactively manage Third Party Manufacturer and Alliance Partnership relationships from a quality and compliance perspective Develop and manage the quality events, change control and market complaints programs in respect of Third Party Manufacturer and Alliance Partnership relationships Actively support the BMS Fact Finding (FF) and Product Review Committee (PRC) processes for major investigations involving Third Party products. Prepare and present the information to senior management in support of the FF/PRC processes Provide quality/compliance subject matter expertise to the wider Supplier Relationship Management, Global Procurement, Supply Chain and MT teams in support of new projects, technical transfers programs, supplier selection programs, investigations, validation programs etc. Provide the requisite quality support to Global BMS functional groups such as Global Regulatory/CMC and the local country based regulatory managers in support of regulatory filings, product renewals, regulatory agency questions etc. Manage the quality metrics programs in relation to Third Party performance Serve as the Quality Operations leader in Technical Transfer projects and Manufacturing Launch Teams (MLTs) relating to Third Parties Prepare, negotiate and approve Quality Agreements with the Third Party Manufacturers and Alliance Partners Review and approve the Annual Product Reviews submitted by the Third Party Manufacturers Support the Global BMS external auditing program by participation in audits of Third Parties as requested Qualifications, Knowledge and Skills Required: The successful candidate will hold a BSc or equivalent in scientific discipline Extensive experience in the pharmaceutical industry, preferably in Quality, Manufacturing Technology, Regulatory or a position within a Health Authority Agency Direct experience with tablet manufacture is highly desirable Direct experience interacting with Health Authorities and managing Health Authority inspections, specifically FDA and/or EMA Direct experience in interacting with external manufacturers and managing quality at external manufacturing sites Extensive experience and technical knowledge in chemical, biological and /or pharmaceutical operations which enables first-hand knowledge of manufacturing, quality control, quality assurance, regulatory affairs / sciences and interface with research & development In depth knowledge of cGMP regulations pertinent to the USA, EU and other international markets Ability to assess the right balance between business targets and scientific and quality decisions Ability to build relationships, partnerships and influence and/or enforce quality decisions at external manufacturers Strong negotiation, communication and presentation skills across all levels both internal and external to BMS. Strong analytical and problem solving skills What’s important to us Employees are expected to display the BMS Values, which move us toward our mission to discover, develop and deliver innovative medicines that help patients prevail over serious diseases: Passion : Our dedication to learning and excellence helps us to deliver exceptional results. Innovation : We pursue disruptive and bold solutions for patients. Urgency : We move together with speed and quality because patients are waiting. Accountability : We all own BMS’ success and strive to be transparent and deliver on our commitments. Integrity: We demonstrate ethics, integrity and quality in everything we do for patients, customers and colleagues. Inclusion : We embrace diversity and foster an environment where we can all work together at our full potential. We have a passion for tackling the toughest diseases, which inspires innovation and speed in our daily work and a sense of accountability to the patients we serve. Why you should apply You will help patients in their fight against serious diseases You will be part of a company that encourages excellence and innovation, respects diversity, develops leaders and values its employees. You’ll get a competitive salary and a great benefits package including, but not only, an annual bonus, pension contribution, family health insurance, 23.5 days annual leave plus 3 Company days, access to BMS Cruiserath on-site gym, life assurance and gain-sharing bonus. Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues. Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. no -- Principals only. title: Food and Beverage Supervisor
desc: Food and Beverage Supervisor – the gibson hotel We have a fantastic new vacancy for a Food and Beverage Supervisor in the excellent gibson hotel. Objective of the Role Reporting to the Food & Beverage Manager, the F&B Supervisor will provide a friendly and efficient service to the hotel guests. Key Duties and Responsibilities Regular guests are known and greeted accordingly using their name. Ensure a good working knowledge of food and wine. Be able to make recommendations. Be friendly, courteous and professional at all times. Up-sell and maximise sales revenue whenever and wherever possible. Requirements: Previous hotel experience in a 3/4 star hotel property is desired but not essential. Previous experience in a high volume/ fast paced environment. Fluent English and excellent communication skills. Micros Experience would be preferable. About our culture: Dalata Hotel Group – Ireland ’s largest hotel group has a number of exciting positions on the horizon. As Dalata continues to grow and expand in Ireland and the UK it’s more important than ever to have the right team alongside us, in the near future we will be opening the doors of new hotels creating many jobs and investing millions in the Irish and UK economy. We lead through our Dalata values of “Our People, Our Fairness, Our Service and Our Individuality”. If you have the right attitude and energy you will have great opportunities to progress within the group. Our company is a place where you can do great things – individually and as a team. You will have the opportunity to develop your talent, be recognised and rewarded for your commitment and pursue a fulfilling career. We also have a number of unique and recognised training programmes to aid your professional and personal development and pride ourselves on creating an objective, supportive and fair working environment for our employees. Dalata Hotel Group Plc is an Equal Opportunities Employer. no -- Principals only. title: QC Compliance Specialist
desc: QC Compliance Specialist - 12-month contract - Ireland QC Compliance Optimisation Specialist opportunity to work with a Global Bio-Pharmaceutical Organisation at their Manufacturing facility in County Westmeath , Ireland. Working hours: 40 hours per week Working from home: Mixture of remote/ on site. You will need to come to site to get familiar with the lab and facility but then there would be flexibility to work from home on an ongoing basis. Ireland is a hive of activity for the Life Sciences Sector at present, with Global Players investing heavily in manufacturing facilities here. An excellent opportunity has arisen for an experienced QC Compliance Specialist to join a Global Bio-Pharma facility in County Westmeath. In the role you will be responsible for actively identifying opportunities for process and compliance improvement and translating these into practice. Principal Responsibilities to include: Support implementation of effective shift handover/QC internal communication Identify and implement improvements to Lab Processes, Layout/flow and 6S type activities Training: design of induction training to lab, up to area SME level; define the training requirements and implement simplified training program Planning, scheduling and facilitating continuous improvement workshops and translation of the output to procedural/process updates. Documentation flow and paperwork practices: Improving Right First Time and reducing GDP errors within QC and implementing processes to track and trend performance against target Develop simplified and effective scheduling for routine/non routine activities to maximise available resource Implementation of real time review and real time trending of all QC data Support Implementation of in-house microbial identification using the Vitek including the design of process, documentation and training program Maintain regular and proactive communication with all stakeholders. Desired Experience: Strong experience working in a GMP Quality Control Laboratory Knowledge and understanding of GMP/GDP standard Strong problem solving and leadership experience Experience in workshop facilitation Experienced in leading and executing continuous improvement initiatives Experience of SOP authoring and document management processes Experience of provision training to other Good working knowledge of QC Microbiology and Chemistry instrumentation and methods Interested in hearing more? Apply today to be considered for this position! The candidate must have the rights to work in the location stated in the job advert. Please note, Quanta part of QCS Staffing does not sponsor Visa applications. title: Business Program Manager
desc: Do you want to play a significant role in Microsoft’s success in transforming itself into a cloud first technology leader? title: DUBLIN NORTH, IRELAND – AIR FREIGHT COORDINATOR EXPORT/IMPORT
desc: DUBLIN NORTH, IRELAND – AIR FREIGHT COORDINATOR EXPORT/IMPORT DUBLIN Posted 3 months ago For our branch in DUBLIN NORTH, Ireland, we are selecting an AIR FREIGHT COORDINATOR EXPORT/IMPORT DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Ensure all export/import shipments are expedited in a professional and timely manner. Updating and maintaining logs / systems. Log, investigate and resolve customer queries in a timely manner. Ensure All C.O. D’s are collected before shipping any shipments concerned Liaise with airlines in a professional manner in order to meet operational requirements and to maintain up-to-date schedule information and shipment status reports. Day to day operations to include dealing with customers/customs clearance/ airlines & other reports and administration duties. Ensure all quality controls procedures are updated and adhered to. REQUIRED SKILLS, EXPERIENCES AND KNOWLEDGE: Must have minimum of 1+ years relevant air freight experience within a freight forwarding company ideally within an export/import desk Possess a positive customer focus. Good organizational skills with the ability to work under pressure Knowledge of customs procedures, as400/Customs matters is a bonus Must be flexible and have the ability to work on his/her own initiative We are looking for a dynamic person, available for time flexibility and possible work-related travel, with excellent attitude towards for learning and able to effectively manage tight deadlines. TERMS & PACKAGE Full time, permanent. TBD, Pension, Health Insurance, Travel Insurance, 25 Days Annual Leave. AT FERRARI GROUP, WE BUILD RELATIONSHIPS Ferrari Group is an equal opportunity employer. Ferrari Group does not discriminate on the basis of race/colour/religion/sex/national/ origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law. Ferrari Group is a market leader in international freight forwarding and logistics solutions for jewelry and luxury goods, with operations in over 50 countries. Ferrari Group firmly believes that the key to winning the hearts of clients lies in “adding value”: the company places a very strong emphasis on high service quality, flexibility, timeliness, responsiveness and accurate solutions to customers’ needs. If you have the top skills we require and are interested in discovering why Ferrari Group really stands out from the rest, we look forward to receiving your application. Apply Online Attach Resume * (Please include your cover letter in the same file) Privacy Policy * Please scroll down and read the text Privacy to the end to activate the Submit button Ferrari SPA , with registered office in Via San Giovanni Bosco, 10 15121 Alessandria (hereinafter, for the sake of brevity, "Company"), in the person of the pro-tempore Legal Representative and the companies belonging to Ferrari Group as indicated in this website , in their quality of data controller, wishes to inform you, pursuant to art. 13 of the European Regulation 679/2016 concerning the protection of personal data ("Regulation") and the national legislation, including the individual provisions of the Control Authority (Guarantor for the protection of personal data), where applicable, that personal data from You provided through the transmission of your spontaneous application through the website will be processed in compliance with the legislative and contractual provisions in force for the purposes and in the manner indicated below.It is possible to contact the Data Controllers or to know the complete list of Data Processors designated by them by writing to the following email address . Type of personal data being processed The Company mainly processes the following categories of personal data: identification and contact details (such as, for example, name, surname, date of birth, fiscal code, address, telephone contact, residence, domicile); data relating to previous work experience (such as, for example, positions held, date of hiring, corporate role, remuneration and benefits, periodic evaluations, other data relating to work experience), professional qualifications and professional information published by the candidate ; tax and income data (such as, by way of example, tax code, previous salary); data suitable to reveal the state of health (documentation relating to a situation of disability or belonging to a protected category); any other data provided by sending the curriculum vitae (such as, for example, images on the bank); other data sent by the applicant.. Purpose of the processing and legal basis of the processing The purposes for which the personal data supplied by you and indicated in your curriculum vitae are collected and processed relate to the establishment of a database from which the Company can select potential candidates for any future recruitment; the same data, therefore, will be processed by the Data Controller exclusively for purposes related to personnel selection procedures, for the possible execution of preliminary activities to the stipulation of an employment contract and to fulfill any law, contract or regulation.In any case, the processing will be carried out, using IT tools, by the data controller and by any appointed managers and appointees, in compliance with any precautionary measure that guarantees the data security and confidentiality pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions set forth in art. 32 of the Regulation.According to art. 6.1 letter b) and f) of the Regulation, the provision of your data for the purposes indicated above does not require your consent.The conferment of the aforementioned data is necessary to carry out the activities connected to the search and selection of personnel, and failure to provide such data makes it impossible for the Company to consider your application in the context of a selection process. Methods of processing Personal data will be processed by the Company and its representatives using IT systems (and manual systems) according to provisions of law and protecting the privacy of the data subject and their rights, by adopting appropriate technical and organizational measures to guarantee an adequate level of security. As part of the selection activity, the Company may carry out verification activities of the information provided (e.g. academic qualifications and previous employers) only for selection purposes. Data retention Your personal data will be processed and stored for the time necessary to pursue the purposes for which they were acquired.All the aforementioned data will be kept as necessary for the management of the selection process and the internal verification processes, in any case not beyond 1 year of their collection except for the possible establishment of the employment and/or collaboration relationship.We will keep the data for this period also to be able to demonstrate, in case of dispute, that we have conducted the selection and recruiting processes without discrimination, in a correct and transparent manner.The personal data functional to the fulfillment of civil and fiscal obligations will be retained even later, in compliance with said obligations, according to the retention timeline established by the applicable norms.After these terms the data will be deleted and / or destroyed. Communication, disclosure and transfer of data Your data may be shared with specific categories of recipients, such as individuals who can access data by virtue of legal provisions, regulations or EU legislation, within the limits set by these rules.Your data may be communicated to other companies belonging to the Ferrari Group, in Italy and abroad, for the purpose of managing the personnel selection process. In this case, adequate levels of protection and safeguard are guaranteed according to the applicable rules. Rights of the interested party The data subject may exercise, in relation to the processing of data described therein, the rights provided for by the Regulation (art. 15-21), including: Right to receive confirmation of the existence of your personal data and access their content (access rights); Right to update, modify and/or correct your personal data (right of rectification); Right to request the deletion or limitation of the processing of data processed in violation of the law, including those that do not need to be kept for the purposes for which the data were collected or otherwise processed (right to be forgotten and right to limitation); Right to oppose the treatment (right of opposition); Right to revoke the consent, where given, without prejudice to the lawfulness of the treatment based on the consent given prior to the revocation; Right to propose a complaint to the Supervisory Authority in case of violation of the regulations regarding the protection of personal data; Right to receive a copy of the data in electronic format concerning the data subject rendered in the context of the employment contract, and request that such data be transmitted to another data controller (right to data portability). To exercise these rights, you can contact the Data Protection Officer (hereinafter only "Data Protection Officer" or, in short, "DPO") by sending an e-mail to Changes and updates to the Information Even in consideration of future changes that may affect the applicable privacy legislation, this Information Notice may be integrated and / or updated, in whole or in part. The changes will be published in a timely manner. no -- Principals only. title: Credentialing Program Manager
desc: We are more than a health system. We are a belief system. We believe wellness and sickness are both part of a lifelong partnership, and that everyone could use an expert guide. We work hard, care deeply and reach further to help people uncover their own power to be healthy. We inspire hope. We learn, grow, and achieve more – in our careers and in our communities. Job Description Summary: The Program Manager ensures that practitioners (physicians, podiatrists, dentists and psychologists and allied practitioners) are properly credentialed in order to comply with applicable legal, professional and regulatory requirements. The Program Manager is responsible for managing the credentialing process for all applicants to the Medical Staff/ and/or Allied Practitioner Staff as well as those seeking an extension of their clinical privileges. This individual is responsible for reporting to the Credentials Committee and/or Allied Practitioner Committee and to the Medical Executive Committee on a monthly basis. The Program Manager also collaborates with Vice Presidents, Accountable Executives and the Director of Medical Education in the development of new clinical and educational programs. SCOPE OF POSITION This position reports to the Director of Medical Staff Administration and the Medical Director Medical Staff Operations. This position is accountable to the Executive Leadership of the Hospital for credentials matters that relate to clinical program development and educational program development. The Program Manager is responsible for the supervision of credentialing support staff. The Program Manager is responsible for managing all aspects of the credentialing process. This position is also responsible for managing the development of criteria for delineated clinical privileges, as well as oversight of Physician and/or Allied Practitioner proctoring requirements per policy The Program Manager will conduct research around credentialing criteria for new procedures and will collaborate with leadership in the development of new clinical programs. The Program Manager will collaborate with leadership in the development of educational programs designed to train physicians in new technologies, to re-educate Physicians and/or Allied Practitioners in new technologies, to re-educate Physicians and/or Allied Practitioners returning to the workplace and to train Regional Physicians and/or Allied Practitioners employed by the Medical Specialty Foundation in advanced techniques. The Program Manager serves as the Medical Staff Services lead for on-boarding all Physicians and/or Allied Practitioners new to Riverside. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree (Required) Minimum of two years hospital, medical staff and or Allied Practitioner work Experience . Understanding of TJC requirements as they relate to Physician and or Allied Practitioner credentialing privileging. Advanced knowledge of credentialing software, databases, Excel and Word. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Excellent organizational skills and ability to work independently. Work Shift: Day Scheduled Weekly Hours : 40 Department Medical Staff Services Join us! ... if your passion is to work in a caring environment ... if you believe that learning is a life-long process ... if you strive for excellence and want to be among the best in the healthcare industry Equal Employment Opportunity OhioHealth is an equal opportunity employer and fully supports and maintains compliance with all state, federal, and local regulations. OhioHealth does not discriminate against associates or applicants because of race, color, genetic information, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, ancestry, national origin, veteran status, military status, pregnancy, disability, marital status, familial status, or other characteristics protected by law. Equal employment is extended to all person in all aspects of the associate-employer relationship including recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, compensation, discipline, reduction in staff, termination, assignment of benefits, and any other term or condition of employment WE Are Inspired to Do Our Best. OhioHealth is a nationally recognized, innovative healthcare system delivering world-class patient care in a supportive, professional environment filled with limitless opportunities to learn and grow. We are a unique organization in the healthcare field. Our model system of facilities encompasses a wide scope of expertise and care. For professionals, we are a place where people committed to doing their best are given the tools and resources to accomplish our mission every single day. OhioHealth is recognized as a Great Place to Work CertifiedTM organization. The Great Place to Work® is a global authority on high-trust, high-performance workplace cultures. This recognition is one measure of our success in achieving a part of our vision ̶ to be an organization "where people want to work." Apply now and work together with us to improve the health of those we serve. NOTICE: COVID-19 vaccines are required for all OhioHealth associates (including remote workers, volunteers, medical staff and other independent clinical staff, travelers, clinical contractors, vendors, and students). The deadline to be fully vaccinated is April 12, 2022 or have an approved exemption to begin work. Medical and religious exemptions may be requested during the application process. no -- Principals only. title: Senior Planning Manager (P6) - Dublin
desc: The opportunity Mace are looking to employ a P6 Planner for a large scale rail infrastructure projec. Previous experience of Planning within the rail sector is essential Project: This is a large scale rail infrastructure project due to start Q2 in 2022. About us: Mace provide PMO services (project controls, planning and scheduling, risk and change management) to a client who operates within the rail / transport sector. Projects can vary from construction through to infrastructure work. Projects can be any type of civil engineering works including utilities, roads, walkways, bridges, tunnelling through electrification, signalling and other works. We may also be involved in refurbishment and new build construction work. Often Mace are managing multiple projects at any one time with values ranging from hundreds of thousands of pounds to multi million pound projects. Identifying, evaluating, and providing solutions to time-related issues and providing quality checks on the scheduling data. Assisting in the trend and change process, including analysis of schedule impact, generating performance indicators, and providing feedback on areas of risk and opportunities. Providing fully resource programmes, produce resource histograms, resource level programmes, understand and communicate the effect on programme schedules to the project team. Producing and maintaining project baselines and execute the change control process as appropriate. Producing project reports or data directly from the planning software arranging the data to align with the company accounting software. title: Associate Product Manager
desc: Here at Sojern, we are on a mission to empower travel marketers to move travelers from dream to destination. Powered by machine learning and travel data, Sojern is quickly becoming the #1 travel marketing platform serving thousands of hotels, attractions, airlines and destinations worldwide. We made Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500 list 6 years in a row, were recognized on the Top Company Cultures list by Entrepreneur Magazine, and were named a Best Place to Work by AdAge. We are headquartered in San Francisco with teams based in Dubai, Dublin, London, Paris, Omaha and Singapore. Our team is passionate about travel and the core values that define our culture: Win as a team, Embrace Inclusion, Be Genuine, Deliver Wow, and Center Around the Customer. Who are you? You are passionate about product management as the next step in your career and have deep knowledge of ad tech, analytics, and/or performance marketing in online travel. You are technical, if not an engineer. You are highly passionate about data and love problem-solving, have a core desire to develop fantastic user experiences, and can design innovative solutions working with a cross-functional team of sellers, operations, designers, analysts, engineers and data scientists. You have around 2-4 years of recent experience in the digital advertising or the online travel sector. More likely than not, you graduated from a rigorous undergraduate academic program. What will you be doing? Collaborate closely with teams across the company to develop a strategy and roadmap for advancing our customer experience. Partner with engineering , data science, sales and operations to help prioritize product development priorities for customer insights/analytics capabilities and other self- service tools. Gather and document product requirements to communicate product features and decisions clearly to all stakeholders. Coordinate with engineering to prioritize backlogs, manage sprints, and deliver product features in an agile environment. Your end-to-end product lifecycle management responsibilities will include: ideation, stakeholder management, customer feedback, product development, rollout strategy, and ongoing, continuous innovation for your product(s) You will be: Excited about growing the capabilities for B2B web-based applications. Data-driven and results-oriented with a strong background in data analysis and gleaming insights. Willing to roll up your sleeves and prototype solutions in partnership with designers, engineers, analysts and data scientists. Excited to operate within agile development methodologies. Self-motivated; exhibiting strong self-management and a sense of urgency. Able to manage multiple projects and collaborate effectively with other people and departments in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. An exceptionally strong writer and presenter and are able to communicate insights through storytelling. Able to get things done amid tight time constraints. Flexible and able to switch directions quickly when necessary. You will have: A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university. Strong preference given for computer science (CS), Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, or other quantitative fields. A master’s degree is also highly desirable. 2-4 years of relevant experience, with at least 1-2 years in product management Samples of product requirements that you can share, or the ability to otherwise demonstrate personal excellence in this area Familiarity with Attribution, Analytics and A/B Testing A strong technical acumen (explicit engineering background not required). You will get Bonus Points for: Previous engineering experience or demonstrable computer science background Recent experience in ad tech with strong knowledge of programmatic advertising knowledge and big data Solid SQL skills with the ability to write your own queries to get the relevant data Opportunities: Be part of a growing team with training and support to help you grow Ownership: Lead creative and challenging projects Give Back: We give 40 hours a year to volunteer and organize office volunteer programs with local organizations Culture: Strong core business values, focus on teamwork, vibrant, social and fun environment Recognition: Bonusly program Wellbeing programs : Wellness Coach, Spring Health, Employee Assistant Programs Medical & Dental insurance Life Insurance Company Pension Group Income Protection Annual holidays of 25 days Season Ticket Loan Bike to Work scheme Our Commitment to Diversity Equity and Inclusion: At Sojern, we work to create a brave space that seeks out, embraces, and promotes diverse thoughts, beliefs, and experiences of Sojernistas globally. We are building a workforce that represents the customer base we are serving and the world we live in. A diversified workforce is an innovative workforce. Just as there is no one archetype traveler, there is no one archetype employee. We foster diversity and inclusion across the company, actively seeking to amplify underrepresented voices and apply diverse perspectives to ensure products, policies, and programs are relevant for our employees and clients alike. Embracing our differences and celebrating them moves us towards our goal of making travel inclusive of all. Sojern has over 15 employee-led Affinity Groups, including Embrace Inclusion, So-Proud, Sojern Women's Group, Sojern Gives Back, and more, which are the core of our culture, fostering belonging, inspiring learning, and creating opportunities for all Sojernistas across the globe. At Sojern, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender orientation, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status . no -- Principals only. title: Empower 3 Specialist
desc: Our breakthroughs would not make it to the hands of patients without our pharmaceutical manufacturing team. We rely on a team of dedicated and agile members, who understand the importance and impact of their role in Pfizer’s mission. Patients need colleagues like you who take pride in their work and always look to improve outcomes. You will help to ensure that patients and physicians have the medicines they need, when they need them. About the Role A 12 month assignment opportunity has arisen for the position of Empower 3 Specialist in the Quality Operations Systems (QOS) Department in Ringaskiddy. The QOS team supports the QC and QA departments in the adoption and integration of both new equipment and new software systems with particular focus on data integrity. QOS are looking for a new team member to work as part of Empower 3 team, supporting the set up and testing of Empower 3 and then supporting the training rollout. The new Empower 3 FR4 application will be implemented across all QC teams in Ringaskiddy site, transitioning our chromatography analysis to a fully electronic process. The key responsibilities of this role will include Working with the Empower 3 CORE and Site teams in defining and documenting the Empower 3 data elements as part of the master catalogue. Supporting the building, testing & validation of Empower 3 FR4 Master data Providing training and hyper care for the deployment activity. The ideal candidate will: Have excellent personal, interpersonal and analytical skills Have a strong ability to work on own initiative Be able to engage with stakeholders at all levels across Quality Operations and CORE. Where possible have experience in Empower 3, knowledge of Custom Field Calculations and the ability to trouble shoot day to day activity related to data acquisition, processing and reporting. Additional Information In order to be considered for this position in Ireland you need to be legally eligible to work in Ireland. Please note there is no relocation support available for this position ​ How to apply Make a difference today, all suitable candidates should apply with CV below. We are looking forward to hearing from you! ​ Purpose Breakthroughs that change patients' lives ... At Pfizer we are a patient centric company, guided by our four values: courage, joy, equity and excellence. Our breakthrough culture lends itself to our dedication to transforming millions of lives. One bold way we are achieving our purpose is through our company wide digital transformation strategy. We are leading the way in adopting new data, modelling and automated solutions to further digitize and accelerate drug discovery and development with the aim of enhancing health outcomes and the patient experience. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce is crucial to building a successful business. As an employer, Pfizer is committed to celebrating this, in all its forms – allowing for us to be as diverse as the patients and communities we serve. Together, we continue to build a culture that encourages, supports and empowers our employees. Manufacturing Pfizer careers are like no other. In our culture of individual ownership, we believe in our ability to improve future healthcare, and potential to transform millions of lives. We’re looking for new talent to join our global community, to unearth new innovative therapies that make the world a healthier place. no -- Principals only. title: Digital Content Manager
desc: Base Location: Flexible Ireland | We're proud to offer a Flexible First approach to work, and this role is no exception. We will, however need your base 'home' location to be one of our SSE offices or depots around Ireland. Salary: Up to €75,000 + performance-related bonus + a range of other benefits to support your family, finances and wellbeing. Working Pattern: Permanent | Full Time | Flexible First options available What is the Role? As our Digital Content Manager you will: - encompass a range of responsibilities including contentment management, designing analysis and testing support. You will create, edit and post content on SSE Airtricity’s retail websites and email campaign platform. - maintain best practice for online communication including SEO, adhering to our policies and procedures. You will maintain language standards and work closely with the UX and Graphic design team to ensure change requests are in line with brand and best user experience guidelines. - lead the implementation of continuous improvement on sseairtricity.com based on user experience analysis and assist with analysis, design and planning as part of a cross-functional agile team. - collaboratively develop content strategy and execution approaches aligned with short-term and long-term marketing targets. You will work with marketing and design teams to plan and develop site content, style and layout, creating and publishing engaging content. - edit, proofread and improve writers’ posts. Identify appropriate content domain owners and facilitate their work to product value adding areas of content. Liaise with content writers to ensure brand consistency. What do I need? To be considered for this role, we would love you to have: - proven work experience as a Content Manager, Content Administrator or Content Publisher, with a basic technical knowledge of HTML and web publishing - knowledge of SEO and web traffic metrics and a familiarity with social media - excellent communication skills, particularly when dealing with non-technical people, with the ability to write clear and comprehensive documentation where required - a strong understanding of web reporting and analysis, with a focus on accuracy, quality and attention to detail - good organizational and time-management skills, who can remain calm under pressure and is comfortable working with tight deadlines About our Business SSE Airtricity is Ireland's second largest and fastest growing energy provider, supplying around 800,000 domestic and commercial gas, electricity and home energy services customers in the Republic and Northern Ireland. At SSE Airtricity we believe in making energy better. Around 40% of the electricity SSE Airtricity supplies to its customers on an island basis is generated from renewable sources - the greenest energy supply of any provider on the island and over three times the average on an all-island basis. What’s in it for you? An excellent package with 34 days holiday entitlement (including public holidays), enhanced maternity/paternity leave, discounted healthcare and much more, view our full benefits package on our careers site. As an equal opportunity employer we encourage diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We actively encourage applicants from all protected characteristics and commit to providing any reasonable adjustments required during the application, assessment and upon joining SSE. Search for ‘Inclusion & Diversity at SSE’ to find out more. Next Steps All applications should be submitted online, and I'll be back in touch after the vacancy closing date to let you know the outcome. If you would like to discuss any working differently requirements or adjustments you may require throughout the recruitment and selection process, please contact Andy on or 01738 340826. Before commencing employment with SSE, you'll be required to fully complete our pre-employment screening process consisting of a basic criminal records and credit check. no -- Principals only. title: Mid Level Digital Project Manager
desc: We are Dept, one of Europe’s biggest digital agencies, creating beautiful and immersive digital experiences for some of the world’s best known brands. We’re looking for an enthusiastic project manager who loves their craft. The ideal candidate is passionate about delivering high quality, innovative projects, enjoys being part of a team, and is confident leading large scale projects. We are eager to find talented experts for our team. but we are also looking for a perfect Dept-fit. Someone who is eager to learn, inspires, strives towards a better world, takes the stage, is a futurist at heart, and someone who loves to get the best out of everything. By all means, we are looking for unique individuals who are able to strengthen our collective. YOU’LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR Delivery of key Digital Projects Scoping project requirements and preparing budgets Development of support documentation including risk logs and requirement specifications Management of stakeholders and their expectations during the project life cycle Maximising client satisfaction with the project outcomes Working in a collaborative environment within the business and with client stakeholders Establishing and using “best web practices” to ensure the delivery of high quality projects Highlighting potential project risks and acting proactively to resolve issues Being an active member of the project team, supporting colleagues and peers to help achieve overall digital goals YOU SHOULD HAVE Minimum 2 years proven work experience as a Digital Project Manager building things like corporate websites, apps, online account management and other online systems. Additional previous project management and/or other digital experience is a plus. Highly organised and motivated project manager with an aptitude for understanding and solving problems A positive outlook and strong interpersonal relationship building skills Demonstrated ability to manage cross-discipline teams Demonstrated ability to manage projects under challenging and pressurised scenarios A hands-on project manager who can effectively suggest, drive and challenge new ideas Strong sense of ownership and accountability with a strong ‘customer oriented’ ethos Vendor management experience would be a plus Excellent verbal, written communication and presentation skills Understanding and experience of agile methodologies WE OFFER An open company culture Opportunities for advancement Training opportunities A legendary annual company festival in Amsterdam The opportunity to do what you do best and become even better Develop yourself at one of the fastest growing digital agencies in Europe, from our beautiful office in Dublin (very flexible on remote working) WHO ARE WE We are Dept, one of Europe’s biggest and fastest growing digital agencies. From our offices across Europe and the US, more than 2000 of the most talented and experienced people in our industry combine creativity, technology and data to deliver digital products and services that build brands, grow businesses and make people’s lives easier. Dept is built on a diverse mix of personalities. Working together, testing ourselves, getting better every day. Working at Dept is about giving you the space to do what you're good at, and giving you the room to get ever better. Dept loves people that take responsibility, not orders. We nurture raw talent, support each other and coach you to be the best you can be. We are very proud to be B corp certified, carbon neutral and an encourager to help our employees prosper and grow. Go check our social channels for more info. But enough about us. Get in touch, tell us about yourself and why you’re the perfect fit for our team! An assessment can be part of the application procedure. no -- Principals only. title: Head Data Science & AI (Commercial Innovation Execution)
desc: 21st Century evolution and innovation in digital technologies, data and advanced analytics is rapidly evolving the healthcare environment! Novartis has embraced a bold strategy to drive a company-wide digital transformation. This includes the development and implementation of enterprise-wide Data Science & AI strategies that leverages data and digital to develop and lead a strategic digital portfolio that delivers commercial value to Novartis within 3 years. This will drive deployment of digital and data technologies and ways of working to achieve enterprise-wide strategic objectives. The purpose of the Head DSAI Commercial Innovation Execution of Novartis is to lead the execution of novel data science programs across the enterprise in collaboration with the sponsoring executive(s) in respective businesses and divisions. Define strategy and devise both vertical (specific to a particular business) and horizontal (across a number of businesses) programs that bring data science and artificial intelligence to advance Novartis’ agenda regarding impactful adoption of advanced analytics tools and resulting insights. Oversee or lead multiple, cross-functional DSAI programs in line with Novartis’ digital strategy and ensuring rapid results generation of respective initiatives while enabling Novartis’s functions to sustainably own and embed DSAI innovations. • Set the DSAI Innovation aspirations for Novartis and translate that into a tangible roadmap for the next 3-5 years and beyond • Closely collaborate with Novartis Commercial divisions at senior stakeholder level to identify synergies and opportunities along DSAI products and solutions • Provide visionary leadership in the development and management of DSAI innovations • Drive the implementation across functions and geographies in Novartis and track the success • Work with key stakeholders in Novartis Executive Committee to enable their “DSAI readiness” and informed decision making • Represent DSAI team in the leadership teams of BU (i.e. Global Product Strategy, Global commercial execution, Franchise LT etc.) • Respond to or identify business challenges within Novartis Commercial which could be resolved by DSAI innovative solutions and coordinate the solution • Translate BU needs/ opportunities into analytics challenges and ensure that the DSAI execution teams is able to translate the analytics outcomes into business relevant actions and impact • Provide direct and indirect leadership to the projects teams that comprises of members from multiple cross functional teams in Novartis • Embed operational excellence and customer centricity in the execution of the transformative projects across the enterprise • Ensure that the centralized DSAI team is collaborating with BU analytics teams and embedding functional excellence in the respective Bus • Support BU’s to set up their own advanced analytics teams within commercial function • Lead make vs buy decisions on Analytics for transformative projects. If external vendor is needed, the DSAI execution team would manage the interactions with the vendors. • Monitor changes or advancements in technology to discover ways the company can gain competitive advantage • Identify new business models in the market (products and services) that may be a model for Novartis and push their adoption in the division • Actively identify and start collaborations with external parties (e.g. start-up’s) which can also be exploratory in nature • Drive initiatives and inspire colleagues (individually or in groups) to become more digital, more agile and more customer-centric • Select and implement suitable technology to streamline all internal operations and help optimize their strategic benefits • Attract, retain and develop the best talent within and outside of the organization, build and coordinate a small capable team to develop solutions on how we innovate, sell and operate [#video# no -- Principals only. title: QA CQV Specialist
desc: QA CQV Specialist - Ireland - 18+ month contract A fantastic long-term contract opportunity focusing on delivering a new vial filling line. You'll be joining the Quality team with an overview of CQV activities. QA CQV Specialist Dublin, Ireland 18+ Month Contract Quality Assurance CQV Specialist The facility is a 35,000 + square metre aseptic drug product operations facility, specialising in secondary manufacturing activities – Formulation, Vial/Syringe Filling, Lyophilisation and Packaging. The site also includes laboratories and cold chain warehouse capabilities. There is a strong culture of continuous improvement and innovation within the facility to strive for solutions that improve health outcomes and dramatically improve people’s lives. The client is developing the capability to produce all its medicines at the site in Dublin, helping to ensure continuity of supply of our medicines as we expand internationally. The site has state of the art working facilities, including Next Generation office areas and on site GYM. In addition the client will provide flexible working conditions, including flex hours and work from home. Vial Fill line project: The client will be building a new Vial filling line including vial washer, depyrogenation tunnel, filtration skid, new Isolator, new clean room and associated upgrades / tie-ins to clean utilities Role Responsibilities: Provide QA support and oversight for CQV activities associated with the above ‘Vial fill line project’ Quality review and approval of C & Q documentation Review of Risk Assessments, DS, URS & QRAES documents Review of validation Plans, Protocols, FAT, SAT, IQ, OQ, PQ and associated validation documents Review of executed validation documents and reports Perform all activities in compliance with safety standards and SOPs Be involved in all Validation Cross Functional Teams (CFTs) at the site to ensure adherence to required policies and procedures. Support a safe working environment by complying with all pertinent environmental health/safety practice, rules and regulations. Provide Quality direction and input at Change Control and Deviation Review Boards and assume QA oversight of change control and Deviation/CAPA records; ensuring scope of record is clear and implementation activities are robust and timely. In line with business requirements, these responsibilities may expand or otherwise include additional areas of responsibility which are not described in this specification but are associated with the role Qualification Requirements: Relevant experience (7 yrs +) working in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry as a Subject Matter Expert providing quality direction of introduction of significant project such as new Fill line / Isolator University degree. Science or Engineering related discipline preferred. Ability to work independently and remotely with minimum direct supervision. Critical thinking skills. Strong organisational, communication, coordination, and meeting facilitation skills. Independent, self-motivated, organised, able to multi-task in project environments and skilled in communication and collaboration. Team player prepared to work in and embrace a team-based culture that relies on collaboration for effective decision-making. If this role interests you, apply today! The candidate must have the rights to work in the location stated in the job advert. Please note, Quanta part of QCS Staffing does not sponsor Visa applications. title: Partner Operations Manager
desc: The Partner Business Operations (PBO) team is chartered with the operational enablement of our partner ecosystem. The PBM team sits within the Microsoft Business Operation (MBO) organization and is focused on making it easier for our partners to do business with Microsoft. A key component of the organization is supporting partners with their Move to Modern and digital transformation. We do this through representing deep subject matter expertise and partner voice in design phases of launches and through delivery of change management for launches that are partner impacting. We manage our partners through a community model with a differentiation of service provided to our top partners through a specific Operations Key Account Management function. We are accountable for representing the voice of our partners and customers into launch, policy, process and platform; for landing change with partners and driving our partners to adopt new experiences/capabilities; for supporting the partner lifecycle of our partner ecosystem and ensuring that our partners are compliant. The Partner Business Operations team in EMEA has 27 employees and we align closely with our counterparts in Asia and US to deliver a globally consistent model for partners. We work very closely with the other stakeholders including key stakeholders at a corporate and regional level within Microsoft Business Operations, Global Partner Solutions, Engineering , Cloud Marketing and those that support partners in the field. Position Description: This role is an individual contributor role. The individual hired will be a senior member of the EMEA Partner Business Management Leadership Team in Operations and will build strong relationships with peers globally. The role will provide a fantastic opportunity to lead and shape next generation experiences for our partners and will be at the center of how we support partners in their transition to modern and digital transformation. You will touch our most valued customers and reach across our most important businesses to improve the partner experience. Are you ready to make an impact in this exciting and challenging role? no -- Principals only. title: Support Line Manager: 45-50k, Hybrid, Dublin City based.

Support volunteers as appropriate and monitor volunteer’s wellbeing and performance, managing such issues on an ongoing basis. Develop strategies to maintain and improve volunteer retention, performance and satisfaction. Act as a liaison between Support Line volunteers communicating with and involving them in any relevant aspects of the organisation and its work. Liaise with the Recruitment, Learning and Development department to recruit volunteers to meet the operational needs of the services, adhering to existing guidelines on suitability, selection and vetting. Schedule interviews for recruits and co-ordinate training programmes Complete extensive administration and any ad hoc duties Requirements: Must have fantastic interpersonal and communication skills and be able to work well as part of a team Must have 3+ years of experience in a similar role or managerial role Must have extensive experience working in a mental health setting or within the community and voluntary sector Must have experience preparing and managing rosters Must be able to motivate others and work on own initiative Must have exceptional organisational skills and attention to detail A fantastic opportunity to work with a Prestigious organisation Benefits package: Including Pension plan, 24 days Annual leave and more no -- Principals only. title: Head Data Science & AI (Commercial Innovation Execution)
desc: Head Data Science & AI (Commercial Innovation Execution) Job Description 21st Century evolution and innovation in digital technologies, data and advanced analytics is rapidly evolving the healthcare environment! Novartis has embraced a bold strategy to drive a company-wide digital transformation. This includes the development and implementation of enterprise-wide Data Science & AI strategies that leverages data and digital to develop and lead a strategic digital portfolio that delivers commercial value to Novartis within 3 years. This will drive deployment of digital and data technologies and ways of working to achieve enterprise-wide strategic objectives. The purpose of the Head DSAI Commercial Innovation Execution of Novartis is to lead the execution of novel data science programs across the enterprise in collaboration with the sponsoring executive(s) in respective businesses and divisions. Define strategy and devise both vertical (specific to a particular business) and horizontal (across a number of businesses) programs that bring data science and artificial intelligence to advance Novartis’ agenda regarding impactful adoption of advanced analytics tools and resulting insights. Oversee or lead multiple, cross-functional DSAI programs in line with Novartis’ digital strategy and ensuring rapid results generation of respective initiatives while enabling Novartis’s functions to sustainably own and embed DSAI innovations. • Set the DSAI Innovation aspirations for Novartis and translate that into a tangible roadmap for the next 3-5 years and beyond • Closely collaborate with Novartis Commercial divisions at senior stakeholder level to identify synergies and opportunities along DSAI products and solutions • Provide visionary leadership in the development and management of DSAI innovations • Drive the implementation across functions and geographies in Novartis and track the success • Work with key stakeholders in Novartis Executive Committee to enable their “DSAI readiness” and informed decision making • Represent DSAI team in the leadership teams of BU (i.e. Global Product Strategy, Global commercial execution, Franchise LT etc.) • Respond to or identify business challenges within Novartis Commercial which could be resolved by DSAI innovative solutions and coordinate the solution • Translate BU needs/ opportunities into analytics challenges and ensure that the DSAI execution teams is able to translate the analytics outcomes into business relevant actions and impact • Provide direct and indirect leadership to the projects teams that comprises of members from multiple cross functional teams in Novartis • Embed operational excellence and customer centricity in the execution of the transformative projects across the enterprise • Ensure that the centralized DSAI team is collaborating with BU analytics teams and embedding functional excellence in the respective Bus • Support BU’s to set up their own advanced analytics teams within commercial function • Lead make vs buy decisions on Analytics for transformative projects. If external vendor is needed, the DSAI execution team would manage the interactions with the vendors. • Monitor changes or advancements in technology to discover ways the company can gain competitive advantage • Identify new business models in the market (products and services) that may be a model for Novartis and push their adoption in the division • Actively identify and start collaborations with external parties (e.g. start-up’s) which can also be exploratory in nature • Drive initiatives and inspire colleagues (individually or in groups) to become more digital, more agile and more customer-centric • Select and implement suitable technology to streamline all internal operations and help optimize their strategic benefits • Attract, retain and develop the best talent within and outside of the organization, build and coordinate a small capable team to develop solutions on how we innovate, sell and operate Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion: Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse team’s representative of the patients and communities we serve. • Significant experience in heading innovative and forward looking department of a larger or-ganization or similar managerial role • First-hand experience in developing and delivering digital/DSAI strategies/transformations • A strong strategic and business mindset and excellent organizational and leadership skills • Passion for understanding emerging technologies with pragmatic insight into where those technologies can be integrated into business solutions • Deep industry knowledge and leadership experience in at-least two domains (commercial, de-velopment, research, manufacturing and/or business services) • Track record of setting up sizable high performance analytics organization from scratch • Track record of operational excellence, especially implementing enterprise wide analytics solu-tions in complex matrix organizations • Ability to balance requirements, manage expectations, and drive effective results using a pro-active attitude towards identifying and resolving issues • Savviness in innovative digital trends, e.g. IoT, Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Neural Net-works etc. • Tested capability to successfully lead teams and projects, often with tight time constraints • Experience of leading a substantial Advanced Analytics organization desired • Experience in global product launches, P&L Management highly desirable • Deep understanding of data sources in Pharma industry • Entrepreneurial spirit with can-do, pro-active attitude • Excellent communication and presentation skills • Recognized as analytics thought leader in at least one domain of Pharma You’ll receive: Competitive salary, annual bonus, long term incentive for select levels, health insurance, paid vacation /holidays, potential flexible working arrangements, subsidized dining facilities, employee recognition scheme. Why consider Novartis? 769 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2020. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives? We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges. Imagine what you could do at Novartis! Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion: Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration, and empowers our people to unleash their full potential. Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: no -- Principals only. title: Treasury Manager EMEA
desc: COVID-19 : Our number one priority is the health and safety of our (future) employees and customers: Review our FAQ on our hiring process and learn more about the measures Interxion are taking by clicking here Health & dental insurance, Pension plan, Career progression, Employee Performance Bonus What is required? Strong organizational skills Why Interxion? The opportunity to make an impact Highly collaborative teams that build relationships with world-class customers A high-performing international business at the heart of the digital economy If joining a rapidly growing business at the heart of an industry that’s becoming ever more attractive, where you’ll gain great experience while being part of a dynamic team where everyone’s voice is heard, sounds like your ideal next move, read on. A great mix of cash forecasting, treasury management, and liquidity management, you’ll get to manage a variety of interesting projects too. One day you might be supporting the preparation of daily or weekly cash reporting for group balances, the next, engaging with the broader treasury team for global business continuity planning or training . Reviewing cash transactions for accuracy and resolving any discrepancies, overseeing the timely settlement of intercompany balances, providing data support for journal entries relating to treasury activity, and preparing short medium-term forecasts for cash and other liquid assets and their sources – these are just some aspects of a vital role that comes with comprehensive training and support. What you’ll need Relevant treasury work experience gained within EMEA entities (ideally African countries) where you were responsible for capital markets transactions Familiarity with treasury management systems (preferably Kyriba) and online banking platforms Excellent attention to detail plus strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong organisational skills, including the ability to able to multi-task in order to meet strict deadlines Self-motivation, the confidence to work under pressure, both independently and as part of a team, and a flexible and adaptable approach to change Fluency in English, with the written and verbal communication skills it takes to engage effectively with multiple stakeholders across differing cultures Ideally, an additional European language “I really like the friendly, international atmosphere.” Martin H. Finance Assistant, Austria “I’m given a lot of trust and confidence to get on with my job and solve problems.” Robert P. Finance Business Partner, UK “I really like the friendly, international atmosphere.” Martin H. Finance Assistant, Austria “I’m given a lot of trust and confidence to get on with my job and solve problems.” Robert P. Finance Business Partner, UK “I really like the friendly, international atmosphere.” Martin H. Finance Assistant, Austria Application process 1 Application We will carefully review your application against the requirements of the position. If we have any questions, we will be in touch. 2 Interview(s) If your profile matches what we’re looking for, we will conduct a telephone screening and/or invite you for an interview. For certain positions, there will be more than one face to face interview, an opportunity for us to get to know you further and for you to learn more about us. 3 Assessment For most positions, there are role specific assessments that we ask you to complete. These help us identify behavioural styles relevent to the workplace and your ability to make excellent and thoughtful decisions. 4 Welcome to the team! If we are both keen to move forward, you’re hired! From the moment you sign your contract, you will be part of our team. Your onboarding journey will ensure you get all the information you need to be successful in your role at Interxion. Looking for a different kind of opportunity? Sign up to our Talent Community to stay connected to us and receive our opportunities tailored to your preferences! Interxion HeadQuarters B.V. Scorpius 30, 2132 LR Hoofddorp, The Netherlands. no -- Principals only. title: Deputy Operations Manager
desc: You will be reporting to the Dublin Branch Director, working closely in supporting the overall strategy and deliverables of the Dublin Branch. Your Role The overall aim of the role is to be the Branch Director's “right hand". Various tasks will be delegated to you by the Director to provide the daily push such as - identifying and removing hurdles to speed up issue resolution and providing prompts / reminders to maintain deadlines. You will add value by providing recommendations and taking side projects to help push along topics that will drive continuous improvements in the operation. Your Responsibilities Understand business processes and use knowledge to provide recommendations and co-ordinate projects to help drive continuous improvements in the Operation and in line with Customer requirements. Support in the day-to-day execution of tasks, customer escalations and other tactical demands to make sure the Branch is responding quickly and closing out effectively on actions. Escalation Management – gathering the detail / facts / assessing and putting immediate corrective steps & recommendations A clear Customer Advocate and key driver of theCARE culture & principals within the Branch. CAPAs / TIPs – follow up on overdue CAPAs / TIPs – support Managers with CAPA investigations and preparation to bring to Branch Director for final review within agreed timelines Attrition Database – support Branch Director / Managers in cleanse of database and trading customer analysis AR Investigations – support gathering necessary support info to assist swift closure on AR queries for Finance Propose and steer projects targeted at improving our Customer & Operational Processes to ensure we are adhering to our guidelines & processes and delivering efficiencies and improvements where possible based on root causes / trends identified via Customer / Operations areas above Weekly Dashboard – gather the inputs and prep a weekly Branch Dashboard tracking the key metrics for the team week to week Your Skills and Experiences Effective interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders Excellent communication skills Strong customer service focus and relationship building focus Proven problem solving ability and executing effective decisions Demonstrated experience in efficiency and process improvement, including LEAN principles Process Driven with strong (self-)organisational skills Project management mindset Operational knowledge is a strong advantage The career path at Kuehne + Nagel Ireland is fast-paced and challenging, with opportunities for growth and learning; internal advancement is encouraged throughout the organisation. We are a Great Place to Work for the 10th consecutive year, reflecting the culture amongst our amazing teams who strive to go above and beyond every day. In our benefits package : -Salary reviewed annually -Bonus / profit share -Generous Annual leave allowances -Company Pension -Illness cover -Paid family leaves -Recognition awards -Wellbeing supports -Financial advisory initiatives We asked some of our employees Ann-Marie Lyons, Overland Manager Shannon, joined 25-2-2019 – “My favourite thing about K+N is the interaction between everyone. The company gives great social experiences. My career highlight to date was receiving an award at our end of year Line Manager Meeting.“ Stephanie Ireland, Key Account Manager, Joined 1-5-2018 – “You get a family feeling from the organisation. The people are more than just colleagues, I have developed some true friendships in the past 2 years” Adam Kirkby, Warehouse Team Leader, joined 11-9-2017 – “My favorite thing about Kuehne + Nagel is definitely the camaraderie and work ethic. Excelling in my role as team lead and developing my team and seeing them progress within the company has been my biggest achievement.” Elaine Irwin – Air Logistics Customer Care Manager – 12-03-2001 – “Kuehne+Nagel has given me the opportunity to develop a career over the past 20 years. They have encouraged me to take on different roles and always challenge myself outside my comfort zone and believed in me” Good Reasons to Join Over 125 years, we have become a leading global provider in innovative supply chain solutions. We have over 1400 locations in more than 100 countries around the globe, and 76000 employees working across our global logistics network.Our company believes that real, sustainable success is only possible through valuing both our employees and our customers equally. This is because 'Your Plus Shapes our Future'. no -- Principals only. title: Digital Solution Area Specialists, Data & AI - Turkish Speaker
desc: Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission. The Small, Medium, and Corporate team helps businesses achieve their digital transformation goals by matching customer challenges with Microsoft solutions. Located in either a Digital Sales center, or a local subsidiary, you will help our managed customers across industries, company sizes and territories to identify their needs and opportunities using the latest in digital selling technology. One of the fastest growing customer segments in the industry, you will help customers get to the Microsoft Cloud across solution areas like Modern Work, Business Applications, Applications and Infrastructure, Data and AI, and Security. As an Azure Data & AI Specialist you will be a senior solution sales leader within our Small, Medium and Corporate growth business, leading a virtual team of technical, partner and consulting resources to advance the sales process and achieve/exceed quarterly Data & AI revenue and usage/consumption targets in your assigned accounts. You will be a trusted advisor and a Data & AI subject matter expert with core capability and expertise in Data Modernization, Analytics and AI. You will work with customers to leverage data to help them achieve their business priorities and help guide customer’s journey through Analytics-led Azure Data transformation. You will help customers evaluate their applications and business requirements, recommend solutions that meet their requirements and demonstrate these solutions to win the technical decision. You will need to support customers to remove roadblocks to deployment and drive customer satisfaction. You will help our customers take advantage of our unique hybrid data platform and leading Analytics & AI solutions to realize the value of digital transformation. no -- Principals only.
