title: EHS Manager
desc: 4200 Knighthurst Rd, Ennis, TX 75119, USA Full-time Company Description Associated Materials, a federally designated essential business, is the parent company for leading residential building product brands such as Alside, Gentek, Revere, Alpine and Preservation. With a legacy of over 70 years in business, we create, develop, manufacture, extrude and distribute beautiful siding, windows and more throughout our network of North American company-owned distributors. Headquartered in Cuyahoga Falls, OH, Associated Materials has over 4000 employees across its U.S. and Canadian manufacturing footprint and our extensive North American distribution center network (120+ locations!). We are a charter member of the Vinyl Siding Institute, the American Association of Architects, the National Association of Home Builders, and the National Association of the Remodeling Industry. This combination of established brand recognition, manufacturing capacity and distribution reach makes for an exciting and rewarding employment value proposition. Join us, and discover the next step in your career journey Job Description Primary Duties : Lead Maintenance department staff in ensuring operational downtime is minimized and all appropriate and required repairs to equipment are made in a timely and appropriate manner. Maintain all building facilities maintenance requirements. Plan all TPM procedures, identify timing requirements and schedule necessary repair components. Design/modify processes and equipment to realize productivity improvement, maintain quality standards, and facilitate scrap reduction in a cost effective manner and within budget. Lead/Motivate facility in all EH&S activities through work environment improvements Assess safety requirements and ensure that these are integrated into the process. Work closely with Production, Quality, Maintenance and Shipping to ensure achievement of common goals and projects. Integrate new technology and environmentally friendly practices into existing processes. Develop short and long term plan for process, equipment and methods through capital budget expenditures. Lead Plant environmental process and maintain all associated legal requirements. Execute AMI’s objectives, meet commitments, and work within the approved guidelines. Perform as a Staff Level Manager and team member to drive/execute improvement throughout the entire facility Knowledge and Skills: Strong Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) background Understanding of the required outcomes of the Extrusion/Compounding Process. Solid foundation in manufacturing equipment and process concepts. Knowledge of the product or services in the extrusion industry. Familiarity with Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), Arc Flash, Electrical safety and Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)/ (TCEQ) principles. Good analytical and problem solving skills, as well as a keen attention to detail are also essential. Project management, leadership and team work skills are important to ensure that all factors come together to complete a given assignment on time. Strong interpersonal skills, ability to communicate effectively with co-workers across all levels. Solid understanding of basic Quality standards and processes, to support establishment of Standard Work procedures. Team Building Skills. Qualifications Educational Qualifications and Experience: Bachelor's or Master's degree in a related science field is preferred, preferably mechanical or electrical engineering . Strong Maintenance/EHS background in industrial equipment and processes is highly desired. Ability to direct, and support skilled maintenance team required. Experience with vinyl extrusion a plus Qualifications Required: Three (3+) plus years related experience especially in extrusion and/or plastics industry or other manufacturing Lean Manufacturing knowledge and implementation experience Solid experience and knowledge with regard to Maintenance/EHS requirements in a manufacturing facility Sense of urgency and self-motivation; ability to work independently under pressure and meet deadlines Ability to read, analyze, and interpret blueprint and engineering documents Computer literacy with ability to learn new computer software programs Excellent written and oral communication skills; ability to discuss operational requirements with all levels of personnel Attention to detail with strong organizational skills Team Building Skills Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Recruiters: Please note that Associated Materials, Alside and any of its affiliated companies does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or offers of recruiting service associated with any published or unpublished employment opportunities. Any unsolicited information sent to AMI or any of its employees will be considered as unencumbered and free from any fee or charge whatsoever. Only members of our Human Resources Team have authority to engage or authorize recruiting services. Any questions regarding recruiting services of any kind must be sent to jobs at associatedmaterials dot com. 4200 Knighthurst Rd, Ennis, TX 75119, USA no -- Principals only. Manufacturing Engineering is a hub of expertise that is at the heart of bringing our ground-breaking innovations to life. The team enjoys a far-reaching remit – from determining and developing the operations, equipment, capacity and layout required for product assembly, through to developing automated solutions, estimating manufacturing costs and determining time standards. They plan, introduce and manage manufacturing methods, processes and operations. What’s more, these trailblazers lead on Engineering Change Management across our product life cycles. And while carrying out a host of technical and engineering-related duties, they never stop looking for ways to improve the way we manufacture products that customers around the world know and love. Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Manufacturing Engineer on our Cork Manufacturing Engineering team in Cork. What you’ll achieve As a Manufacturing Engineer, you will work with local and global cross-functional and engineering teams to develop and support manufacturing in Cork Manufacturing Operations. You will: Support, develop and deliver processes, equipment, capacity & layout for New Product Introduction, as well as Steady State manufacturing support. RESPONSIBILITIES : Ensure all maintenance activities and documentation is to GMP standards. Engage in mechanical / electrical / electronic/process troubleshooting, and in resolving hardware /software interfacing problems on the production floor, in collaboration with facilities functions. Develop a technical knowledge of next generation equipment, working with team to ensure all technical issues are identified and eliminated at the earliest opportunity. Liaise with support functions to develop their knowledge of the equipment and ensure a system of continuous, shared learning is in place. Diagnose malfunctioning systems to identify hazards, defects and the need for adjustment or repair. Actively interface with cross-functional team members and 3rd party Vendors, always practicing good team work in support of day to day operating requirements. Identifying and assisting the business with the implementation of technical improvements. Ensure compliance to site and divisional maintenance procedures. All other duties as required. Business understanding of operations and there impacts essential. High level of PC Skills required. Flexibility essential. Strong communication skills with both Internal and external agents. title: Manufacturing Engineer
desc: At Dell Technologies, ground-breaking products are built to the highest design and quality standards. Manufacturing Engineering is a hub of expertise that is at the heart of bringing our ground-breaking innovations to life. The team enjoys a far-reaching remit – from determining and developing the operations, equipment, capacity and layout required for product assembly, through to developing automated solutions, estimating manufacturing costs and determining time standards. They plan, introduce and manage manufacturing methods, processes and operations. What’s more, these trailblazers lead on Engineering Change Management across our product life cycles. And while carrying out a host of technical and engineering-related duties, they never stop looking for ways to improve the way we manufacture products that customers around the world know and love. Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Manufacturing Engineer on our Cork Manufacturing Engineering team in Cork. What you’ll achieve As a Manufacturing Engineer, you will work with local and global cross-functional and engineering teams to develop and support manufacturing in Cork Manufacturing Operations. You will: Support, develop and deliver processes, equipment, capacity & layout for New Product Introduction, as well as Steady State manufacturing support. Use problem solving tools, quality tools, manufacturing methodology and project management methodology to identify and implement Lean and continuous improvement projects in the areas of industrial, manufacturing, productivity, and automation. Other engineering duties as required and assigned. Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements Bachelors Degree (Level 8) in Mechanical, Manufacturing, Industrial Engineering, Electrical/Electronic, or similar Strong communication and influencing skills Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills Fluency in English is essential, with strong written and verbal skills. 2+ years manufacturing engineering experience, or similar Here’s our story; now tell us yours Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today. You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here . Application closing date: 12 March 2022 Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service , family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. title: Premier Life Planner
desc: Bank of Ireland offers a broad range of financial products and services to all major sectors of the Irish economy. Through our network of branches in over 250 locations across the Republic of Ireland, we are the largest provider of financial services in the country. Our branches, embedded in local communities across Ireland, are complemented by our online, mobile and phone banking services. We believe in building positive relationships with our customers and investing in a leading multi-channel distribution platform to serve our customers' needs in order to ensure market leading positions in consumer, wealth management and business segments Bank of Ireland Group is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to encouraging an inclusive work environment which values and benefits from the diversity of our workforce. Description of business unit In Distribution Channels, our purpose is to enable our Customers, Colleagues and Communities to thrive. We do this by drawing on our professionalism, determination, innovation and the passion we have for making a difference in customers' lives. Bank of Ireland offers an enhanced banking service and wealth proposition designed to make life easier for our most valued Customers. Our ethos is to put the Customer at the centre of everything we do. We strive to consistently deliver this ethos through an unstinting focus on relationship management and delivery of an integrated enhanced customer offering through our Premier Advisors. Purpose of the Role The Premier, Life Planner role is key in contributing to the team's success by supporting the development of the Premier customer base through the Life planning experience. Life planning is multi product focused and aligned to the short, medium and long term requirements of the customer. The focus of this role is on managing customers through the Life Planning process and working collaboratively with the Premier Relationship Advisor and Premier Mortgage Specialist to proactively grow BOI's 'wallet' share of its existing customers; with a particular focus on delivering mortgage and wealth growth which are key priorities for our business. This role is also focussed on proactively growing market share in the personal segments by increasing our volume of new to bank premier customers. Key Accountabilities Business Performance - Activity Become an ambassador for the Life Planning process. Collaborate with the Premier Relationship Advisor and Premier Mortgage Specialist to meet suggested activity standards and seamlessly manage customer handovers. Conduct Life Planning meetings ensuring creation of detailed plan for each customer Identify Wealth, Mortgage and other product opportunities through the delivery of quality needs based life planning meetings. Strong communication skills with a focus on accurate recording of customer engagements via CRM and the life planning Voyant system. Promote an Omni channel Customer experience but with a digital first preference. Champion Life Planning offering both internally and externally. Deliver an engaging and worthwhile customer experience via the Life planning conduit. Build a strong pipeline of business opportunities from engagement with Premier customer base Strong diary management with rigorous focus on proactive customer engagement. Proactively identifies referral opportunities for Product Business Partners. Relationship - Customer & Community Provide an exceptional customer experience with each interaction and embrace the "Be the Difference" mind-set. Actively participate in Business Development Forums where appropriate for role. Active involvement in networking events to generate new quality connections and business. Ensure Premier customers are aware of the tailored service and benefits available to them. Develop strong relationships with key intermediaries & influencers. Credible, knowledgeable and being an expert in your field. Proactively update CRM. Adhere to compliance, risk and regulatory procedures. Meet existing and future F&P conditions suitable to role. Meet existing and future QA controls. Capability & People Work collaboratively with the Premier Relationship Advisor and Premier Mortgage Specialist. Support front-line staff to identify & generate referrals for life planning. Help foster team engagement through congenial communication with team members and members of the wider Premier team. Work collaboratively within your county team, actively contributing to achieve county targets. What is the opportunity This is an excellent career development opportunity to guide and develop the performance of a phenomenal team in an exciting market place and also to work in a fast paced and multifaceted business environment Essential Qualifications QFA Life Planning Certified (or complete training to achieve certification within the first three months in role) A proven track record in delivering commercial success from business development, effective needs' analysis, sales delivery, risk management activities. Trusted financial advisor with track record in delivering quality customer meetings and best in class financial wellbeing advice Customer centricity and ability to engage customer. Champion the Bank's core values and purpose. Credible, knowledgeable and being an expert in your field. Excellent attention to detail in creating Life Plans on Voyant. Adhere to compliance, risk and regulatory procedures across sectors. Desirable Qualifications, Skills & Experience Excellent communication and influencing skills, with a proven ability to develop networks and relationships across BOI Group and in the local business community. A strong wealth focus and a key understanding of markets and pensions. A commitment to using emerging technologies to develop and service prospective and existing customers. Strong Customer focus and proven commitment to enhancing Customer Experience and delivery of initiatives. Customer Focused - Self One Group, one team - Self Accountable - Self Agile - Self Where Agency assistance is required Bank of Ireland Recruitment Team will engage directly with suppliers. Unsolicited CVs / profiles supplied to Bank of Ireland by Recruitment Agencies will not be accepted for this role. Bank of Ireland Group is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace which values and benefits from the diversity of our workforce. no -- Principals only. title: SW Engineer
desc: Job DescriptionIntel is seeking a SW Engineer experienced with large scale environments to work in the Software Engineering team. This position will be part of a Global Engineering organization supporting next generation engineering innovations delivering predictable, scalable and high - quality E2E platform stacks for critical data center workloads comprising Xeon platforms and other adjacencies on the Intel Data Center roadmap. In this role, you will analyze existing SW services and workloads to determine technical and business pain points, technical requirements and potential solutions, and drive resolution working across teams and organizations, as necessary. If you enjoy innovation, navigating complex solutions, and working with partners to deliver advanced software and services, this is the role for you. The ideal candidate will possess experience delivering cloud solutions and effectively translating complex business and technical challenges into technical solutions. You are a hands - on technical expert who can architect, incubate, implement and deploy holistic solutions harnessing both hardware and software ingredients solving real world customer problems. You are capable of a system - wide view of complete solutions, which is critical to be successful in this position. You leverage and enhance existing architectures and solutions as well as fill in gaps, to stand up end - to - end software solutions. This role includes architectural planning and design, integration, debugging, performance optimizations, benchmarking, publishing collaterals for SW services and solutions, including assisting in the coordination of various teams testing and evaluation and implementing system automation as required for better efficiency. QualificationsBachelor's degree or higher in Electrical or Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Physics, or related field. Demonstrated practical experience architecting, engineering, and operating large scale cloud native computing services with domain expertise in one, or more, of these key areas: data services, scale out distributed workloads, low latency SW design, scale out storage containers and microservices, CI CD orchestration, scheduling distributed systems APIs. Experience utilizing new programming languages, design patterns, APIs, or tool sets. 3 plus years of experience in the following areas: - Proficient in one or more of the following programming languages (C/C++, Java, Go, Python) - Hands - on experience developing and optimizing system firmware, BIOS, kernel, drivers, open source software is a big plus. - Scripting building tools and automation to manage data center software. - Virtualized and containerized environments in a largescale environment. - Design deployment and manageability of SW services. - SW engineering for continuous delivery using agile development methodologies. - Design for Failure SW principles, Eventual Consistency, and geo distributed SW. - Strong Team player, collaborative, and thrives in a fast - paced, dynamic environment. no -- Principals only. title: Operations Manager (Agriculture)
desc: Operations Manager Paddock Wood, Kent Full-time, permanent Monday to Friday 8.30am - 5.30pm We are working in collaboration with an established supply chain specialist of agricultural products across the globe, who due to high attrition have a rare opportunity to hire an experienced supply chain and logistics professional to manage the day-to-day operations of this growing business. This role will be operating across 7 different small companies internationally that supply a wide range of agricultural products to their customers across the globe. Any agricultural experience will be a bonus; however regardless of the products, national and international shipping requirements are very similar, therefore an excellent understanding of shipping is the most important. To do the job well, you will need to understand the complexities of incoterms, customs, import and export requirements with a good understanding of freight movement and day to day requirements of a trading company with a wide range of movement types. This role will suit someone who is able to make decisions, supervise others, with good attention to detail, strong customer service , and can take full responsibility for the efficient running of the daily processes. Someone able to see ways in which things can be improved can see how to do things to prevent problems from arising. The Operations Manager will take on all the existing day to day operations, with the assistance of the office-based processing team. Daily operations will include: - Processing sales orders and purchase orders, from receipt of a customer orders through to invoicing completed shipments - Dealing directly with customers, product suppliers and service suppliers such as freight companies - Negotiating best pricing for all freight - Implementing any changes required to achieve minimum freight cost - Arranging shipments of goods to fulfil orders, ranging from small parcels to multiple FCL - Making full use of the ERP system, ensuring good maintenance of data, and assisting with ERP development - Applying pricelists and other data to the ERP system to ensure accurate processing of orders - Setting up Office Procedures/Processes for all activities and ensuring they are followed - Maintain Quality Control certification - Oversee all stockholding in your own and 3rd party warehouses - Establishing stock keeping records within ERP and re-stocking processes to maintain stock levels - Oversee and organise all packaging - Maintain all the correct insurances - Be involved with the day to day aspects of adding new business, such as assisting with sourcing new products or packing materials - Excellent IT abilities - Managing a small team To be considered please apply today! At KHR we take care to ensure that you are represented as well as possible so it is worth checking your CV for layout, spelling and grammar as well as making sure it is up to date before you submit. If you feel you need to highlight particular qualifications, skills or relevant experience with regards to a specific role then please add a cover letter or a preface page. This does not need to be formatted in the same manner. In addition, if your CV is heavy with graphics etc, please could you also submit a "clean" copy in Word. Thank you. title: HS&E Manager
desc: HS&E Manager Newmarket £50,000 - £60,000 + Overtime + Bonus +Training + Holiday + Pension + Healthcare + Flexible shift hours and no weekend work. Excellent opportunity to join a well-established company that have grown year on year and will offer you the chance to stamp your authority and make positive improvements within a business. On offer is the chance to take a lead role where you will be in a pivotal position to the business and given the chance to continue to develop and progress your career. This family run company is a leading steel stockholder and operate in multiple sites across the UK. They have ambitious plans to keep growing and expanding over the coming years and as such are looking to add a new Health and Safety Manager to their ranks. In this role you will, you will manage a team and ensure that the company is up to date with all legislative requirements. You will also develop and carry out training courses and look to make improvements in the business. The ideal candidate will have experience working in a health and safety role and come from either a manufacturing, construction or heavy plant industry. You will hold a NEBOSH Diploma and have experience working to ISO standards. This is an exciting opportunity to drive forwards your career in a leading role within a business where you'll be able to directly impact the business. The Role: *Leading a team *Updating policies *Developing and carrying out training The Person: *NEBOSH General certificate *ISO experience *IOSH *Manufacturing, Construction or Heavy Plant background BBBH(phone number removed) This vacancy is being advertised by Rise Technical Recruitment Ltd. title: Commodity Manager
desc: Since 2004, Mandiant has been a trusted partner to security-conscious organizations. Effective security is based on the right combination of expertise, intelligence, and adaptive technology, and the Mandiant Advantage SaaS platform scales decades of frontline experience and industry-leading threat intelligence to deliver a range of dynamic cyber defense solutions. Mandiant’s approach helps organizations develop more effective and efficient cyber security programs and instills confidence in their readiness to defend against and respond to cyber threats. Job Description What You Will Do: Responsible for overall supply management of assigned commodities.to ensure effective cost, quality and timely delivery of materials and services in support of FireEye’s internal needs. These commodities are at times complex in nature and require substantive level of commodity knowledge and experience. Develop and implement the strategic roadmap for assigned commodities. Lead commodity team to identify and deploy cost reduction initiatives. Collaborate with FireEye’s internal customers and evaluate potential suppliers. Negotiate contracts and master agreements. Ensure contract negotiations are inclusive of company-wide leverage and address full range of issues/items in the negotiations, including Price and performance requirements Management of changes & closures; and Auditing of contracts and master agreements. Work with FireEye’s internal customers and stakeholders to drive continuous pursuit and identification of new, alternate sources of supply to help drive cost reductions, improve quality, service and delivery. Manage strategic sourcing and purchasing activities for set of related commodities and/or services. This includes cost analysis and volume planning, monitoring the costs, schedule and scope of assigned contracts to negotiate highest quality at best value. Find new supply sources where vendors and suppliers are no longer competitive. Manage RF(X) process and negotiate purchase contracts including performance metrics with suppliers utilizing standard purchase agreements. Analyze supplier and commodity spend and forecast. Conduct supplier business reviews, monitor performance, Normally receives little instructions on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments. Leads cross-functional projects and often acts as a facilitator and team leader. Acts independently to determine methods and procedures on new or special assignments. Responsible for commodity spend analysis worldwide. Document justification of supplier selection. Audits contracts and master agreements. Qualifications 10-15 years Commodity Management experience with BA/BS or equivalent. MBA preferred. Commodity experience with subject matter expertise in a broad range of areas (e.g., IT hardware and software, telecom equipment and services, marketing services, real estate, facilities/construction, professional services, risk management, etc.). Demonstrated success in sourcing and negotiating with new and alternative cost-effective suppliers. Proven track record of developing and implementing cost-effective sourcing strategies; effective and creative problem-solving skills are key to success. Effective and versatile interpersonal and communication skills - must be able to partner effectively with internal customers, Legal, Finance and current/prospective suppliers. Strong analytically oriented problem-solving skills that lead to optimal data-based results. Proficient in Microsoft Office products and Oracle Procurement. Solid project management skills. Sustained track record of successfully managing multiple programs/projects concurrently. Strong communication, interpersonal, organizational, productivity and time management skills, including accurate attention to detail. Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in fast-paced environment no -- Principals only. title: Export Coordinator Team Leader
desc: Export Coordinator Team Lead required for an expanding multinational Pharmaceutical company . As the Supply Chain Export Team Lead, you will lead a team of Export Co-Ordinators with responsibility for preparing and creating all export documentation for all deliveries ex-Cork plant. Work closely with Customer Service , Planning and Manufacturing to respond swiftly to customers regarding queries on expected ship dates and delivery dates. Responsibilities – Lead the Team in the following activities and be a point of Escalation for the following. • Advance booking of space/equipment with Freight Forwarders to maximise weekly shipment plan. • Communicate shipment delivery requirements to Freight Forwarders and track progress to these commitments. • Preparation and management of export shipping documentation in line with country-specific guidelines – Commercial invoices, Packing lists, Export certs, Letters of Credit, Legalisation and Certs of Origin. • Ensure all processes and documentation are in accordance with company & ITC (International Trade Control) compliance requirements. • Be the Primary contact for Customer Service, Supply Planning and Demand Management in reference to the Order to Receipt Process • Liaise with Internal Departments to ensure on time batch release of product for Shipments. • Work with Global Departments on reports and filing of Customs Documentation, ITC Reports • Maintain Standard Operating Procedures and customer profiles including key contacts, special requirements, contract rates and preferred routings/services/carriers. • Participate in projects and assignments for continuous improvements within the supply chain function. • Continually evaluate operational practices to ensure optimum utilisation of resources. Experience Qualifications and experience • Substantial experience working in Logistics/Distribution role in a pharma/regulated environment with significant experience in a lead role. • Degree qualified in a relevant field. • 3-5 Years of Leadership Experience is Essential. • Demonstrate, analytical skills, problem-solving and decision skills in multi-functional settings. • Experience in a GMP environment is desirable. You will manage the procurement of MRO (Maintenance, Repair and Operations) materials (both direct purchase and for Maintenance spare parts Inventory) and provides MRO Materials procurement support to Capital Projects. title: Transport Manager

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a business with an outstanding reputation in the city. Duties to include Working closely with the Despatch Manager and Production teams to ensure that products are in the right place, at the right time across all sites Manage total transport operations Manage and oversee route planning operations Work with senior management to implement cost saving and process improvement strategies Manage deliveries in and out of the site Full responsibility of recruitment and training of the transport team Monitoring the progress of the daily operation, taking into account all the legal requirements and those of the customer, to achieve the most cost-effective route and utilisation of vehicles and staff Ensure Health & Safety and legal requirements are being followed Attend meetings with stakeholders as required by the business Depot management including keeping on top of inventories Investigating any service or operational failures to ensure they are understood and prevented in the future. title: Factory Operative
desc: Do you want an early finish on Friday's? Would you like to work in a warm, bright factory with a friendly team who encourage training and development? A Factory operative for this company is going to be someone who enjoys doing different things each day and works well within a team. You may have done this type of role before which is always an added benefit but if you haven't don't worry. If you have a strong work ethic and the willingness to learn, you can find yourself working for a company who takes pride in putting its employees first. From assembling to brazing, from operating machines to general warehouse duties you will play a key part in the day to day operations of the business. Location: Newmarket, Suffolk Hourly Rate: £9.80 an hour + holiday pay Hours: 07:30-4:30 Mon-Thurs, 07:30-12:30 Friday Duration: Temporary - Permanent This is the perfect opportunity for someone that is looking to progress their skills and experience. Duties: - Some Assembly of large components - Brazing, spot welding - Operating various factory machinery - Keeping the factory tidy and clean - Adhere to all health & safety policies Skills and Experience Required: - Holding a "can do" attitude - Strong work ethic - Able to work in a busy and fast paced environment - Willing to work and progress in the growing Company and learn different department jobs and different skills if required - Positive attitude towards work and colleagues If you have not received a response within 3-5 working days, unfortunately your application has been unsuccessful. title: Supplier Quality Specialist
desc: Kenny-Whelan (a specialist division of the CPL group) are hiring a Quality and Compliance Specialist (Supplier Quality) to support 2 sites for one of our Global Pharma/Biopharma clients in Cork. Contact Jenn Dinan on 0860466583 or email Quality Specialist – Supplier Quality To cover Barnahely & Little Island Quality and Compliance specialist ensuring quality standards are achieved and maintained at suppliers through supporting management, and oversight on Quality Operations functions for external business partners. This support includes ensuring continuous compliance with relevant regulatory health authority requirements, effective risk management, strategy development and execution, and effective collaboration between R&D, Operations, Procurement, TechOps, Regulatory Affairs and other technical disciplines (EHS). Functions and activities include quality assurance review functions (such as Change Control, Quality Issue Management, compliance audit activities, supporting creation and management of risk mitigation plans for suppliers. Quality Specialist supports ensuring business, quality and compliance goals adhere to J&J policies, enterprise standards and government-issued environmental, health, safety, quality and regulatory policies and guidelines. Represents the JNJ credo and quality values in contact with the suppliers and will comply with the JNJ regulations for ethic and business conduct in order to strengthen the reputation of J&J. This position requires the ability of building collaboration and teamwork across the local and global JSC organization, and it interfaces JSC ESI Quality with the quality unit of suppliers. This position acts as a supporting role, supporting single point of contact support to JSC LM sites. RELATED EXPERIENCE: 3 years of experience in quality management, production, quality control, or R&D in a pharmaceutical and/or biotechnology environment Familiar with GMP – and International Conference on Harmonization ( ICH ) – regulation Trackwise and SAP experience would be desirable Exposure to regulatory authorities’ inspections LIST JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES/SKILLS REQUIRED: Support of planning, execution, and documentation of the qualification and monitoring for suppliers who are sourcing APIs, API materials or DP materials such as excipients, raw or packaging materials, to the Janssen Supply Chain for the manufacture of Intermediates, APIs, or drug products respectively Support Surveillance on the quality and compliance status for all suppliers of raw materials, packaging materials, intermediates, excipients, and APIs. Support of Management of Change related to supplier (change assessor, action executioner,) Assessment of deviations, corrective and preventative actions (CAPAs), and complaints concerning materials received from suppliers Provision of all information needed for the release/reject of suppliers in SAP (SAP master data) and SAP Material approval /AML updates for LM. Support Establishment of Quality requirements and Quality agreements and periodic review of Quality Agreements Support account owners for initial assessment and qualification of suppliers for new product introductions, and establishment of initial Qualification Statements Support Periodic performance measurement for suppliers Provide support to JSC local Site during Customer and HA inspections as needed Support supplier Specification agreement and approval management In conjunction with Account owners he/she collaborates with internal operating companies and R&D partners on a wide variety of product, process, project and compliance related issues. Interfaces with internal JSC functional groups to broker the necessary technical support for external partners. Interactions are required with Tech Ops, PDMS, Procurement, EHS, Planning, the different JSC manufacturing sites, but also with the other quality groups within JSC and on enterprise level, such as Compliance, Quality unit API manufacturing, Quality systems and the different Qualified persons. All application will be treated with the strictest of confidence. Contact Jenn Dinan on 0860466583 no -- Principals only. title: QA Associate
desc: BioMarin is the world leader in delivering therapeutics that provide meaningful advances to patients who live with serious and life-threatening rare genetic diseases. We target diseases that lack effective therapies and affect relatively small numbers of patients, many of whom are children. These conditions are often inherited, difficult to diagnose, progressively debilitating and have few, if any, treatment options. BioMarin will continue to focus on advancing therapies that are the first or best of their kind. BioMarin’s Technical Operations group is responsible for creating our drugs for use in clinical trials and for scaling production of those drugs for the commercial market. These engineers, technicians, scientists and support staff build and maintain BioMarin’s cutting-edge manufacturing processes and sites, provide quality assurance and quality control to ensure we meet regulatory standards, and procure the needed goods and services to support manufacturing and coordinating the worldwide movement of our drugs to patients. Come join our team and make a meaningful impact on patients’ lives. QA Associate - Drug Substance Note: shift role. (6 week cycle including 1 week of earlies and 1 week of lates with 4 weeks of days.) Earlies - 6.30am-2.30pm, lates - 2.30pm-10.30pm). KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Provide QA support to the site for drug substance GMP operations (Warehouse/material operations, Upstream/Downstream and Support Services manufacturing, Automation and Process Engineering , MES, QA Validation and Capital Projects) Participate within inter-departmental and cross-functional teams to immediately address issues in real time Exercise judgment to determine appropriate action, ensuring proper escalation when issues are identified as per applicable procedures for compliance, escalation and corrections Review of MES Exceptions Support lot release activities/schedule including preparation of BDS/FBDS lot files and BDS disposition Daily presence and support in the process teams and on the manufacturing floor including walk-through of process issues and RCAR support Release of Raw Materials for drug substance production Review and approve Trackwise deviation and QC LIR reports to ensure that root causes have been identified, appropriate corrective actions have been implemented and appropriate impact assessments are complete Review and approve Change Control documents pertaining to Warehouse/material operations, Upstream/Downstream and Support Services manufacturing, QC In process/Micro, Automation and Process Engineering, QA Validation, IT/CSV and Capital Projects to ensure changes are appropriately assessed and all required actions are identified and implemented Review and approval of process and equipment validation/qualification protocols/reports. Review and approval of master batch records on MES Write, review and approve SOPs, Work Instructions, Quality Technical Agreements, Specifications, Quality Risk Assessments, PDD, PCRA and other GMP documentation in accordance with BioMarin Policies. Conduct Periodic Review of QA SOPs Review and approval of Supplier Change Notifications Assist with preparation of Annual Product Review documents (APRs) Support cross-training of team members Support quality systems on site. Support site inspection readiness activities and provide assist with audits and regulatory inspections, as required Support and drive Continuous Improvement/Lean initiatives on site Compile and present metrics as required Other duties as assigned QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE - KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIREMENTS Minimum 3-5 years relevant experience in a cGMP regulated manufacturing environment, with exhibited knowledge and proficiency in Quality Assurance and Regulatory Compliance. Experience and ability to work cross functionally. Demonstrated experience in supporting manufacturing operations, batch record review, MES and deviation/CAPA is highly desirable. Demonstrated ability to work independently and fully realize improvement initiatives with a moderate level of guidance. Demonstrated ability in problem solving and experience in managing Root Cause Analysis / Non-Conformance /Deviation investigations. Ability to coach junior QA staff Strong ability to communicate, make decisions, present data, and defend approaches in front of audiences and inspectors. Ability to comprehend technical information related to equipment, processes, and regulatory expectations. Understanding and familiarity with FDA & European regulatory requirements, guidelines, and expectations. EDUCATION Bachelor of Sciences (BSc) degree, or equivalent, in a technical discipline (physical, engineering, chemical or biological sciences, pharmacy) is required. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. no -- Principals only. title: Site PPI & Engagement Lead (Operational Excellence)
desc: Job ID - 196668BR Job Role - Site PPI & Engagement Lead (Operational Excellence) Location - Cork, Ireland When you’re part of Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do challenging work, and join a team that values performance, quality and innovation. As part of a successful, growing global organization you will be encouraged to perform at your best. With revenues of more than $40 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and chances to create significant contributions to the world. ABOUT OUR SITE: The Cork site manufactures a number of established commercial products and is actively engaged in New Product Introductions from various clients. Operating for over 40 years, the Cork site is proud to manufacture and supply Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (API) to our customers for use in clinical trials and approved medicines for commercial supply - medicines to treat Cancer, Parkinson’s Disease, Depression, HIV, Congestive Heart Failure, Diabetes and Respiratory diseases, along with raw material for consumer healthcare products. YOUR ROLE: This role is responsible for providing guidance, strategic vision and leadership to maximise staff engagement, by building effective channels and CI capability across the site. The role has a high impact on the Business Objectives of the Site. The deployment of continuous improvement and excellent site engagement will enable to accelerated business results (financial and non- financial). KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Leadership As a member of the site leadership team, you will play a key role in shaping and delivering the overall site strategy, supporting, challenging and co-driving with SLT peers. Continuous Improvement Deployment of the site’s continuous improvement (PPI) culture which includes the overall deployment of PPI training, problem solving, facilitation of Kaizens, management of Site PPI KPIs Development and deployment of Site Strategy Champion for PPI on site to ensure that the site delivers the companies PPI ambition Managing and building the capability of the PPI team to support the activities above Mentoring and coaching PPI Practitioners and their SMEs partners to deliver Site Strategic Projects Management of the monthly governance for SLT Business Review and Site PPI Forum Partnership with Finance for PPI Hard metrics reporting and supporting capability build for cost control and productivity initiatives Leadership and facilitation of SLT top issues (e.g. Facilitation for Site Change Projects, Productivity Assessments). Represent the site at API PPI Forum, collaborate, participate on cross site initiative and share learnings Engagement Development and execution of the Site Communication & Engagement strategy ensuring alignment with goals and objectives. Content creation and co-ordination of engagement events Cork Communications, ELT Engagements, Townhalls, support for BCP communications and ad hoc site communications. Support for GM in preparation for Site VIP visits – logistics and content creation Management of relationships with external service providers (Comms, PR, Media consultants), providing direction and input to ensure that the site goals are translated and delivered via a cohesive plan Leading communications and branding projects to support site needs (e.g. Creating a Cork Brand for CDMO) Interface with above site communication group as the need arises. People Management People Management of a team of PPI Practitioners and Liaison colleagues Management of Contract / Consultant resource to support team goals Interpersonal Skills Leadership, Influencing, change management and negotiating skills Willingness and ability to take initiative and eagerness for change and new experiences “Do it, try it, fix it” mentality Willingness to set, accept & drive stretch targets Able to demonstrate coaching skills to coach, empower, train and mentor others Demonstrated ability to effectively lead change projects and staff Ability to communicate and work effectively in a cross functional environment and across functional boundaries. Good Communication and Interpersonal Skills Good facilitation and presentation Skills Progressively working towards accreditation in the various PPI training programmes EXPERIENCE WE'RE LOOKING FOR: Educated to degree level or equivalent Prior experience in a manufacturing environment, covering a broad range of activities and operations (e.g. Production, Engineering , Quality Assurance/Logistics and /or Safety). Strong proven leadership experience Understands and uses Lean / Sigma concept in way of working Previous demonstrated activity in the delivery of improvement initiatives and/or culture change year on year, resulting in both financial and non financial benefit, and behavioural change. Excellent networking, influencing, interpersonal and communication skills. Demonstrated significant leadership of improvement initiatives and/or culture change resulting in both financial benefit and behavioural change. Continuous Improvement technical and change management skills essential. Problem solving skills in accordance with site goals People change management concepts and practice Enthusiastic about training and coaching with a hands on approach Confidence working alongside senior stakeholders (SLT peers) and influencing those at Director and General Manager level Accreditation in Green or Black belt would be an advantage but not essential WHAT BENEFITS DO WE OFFER? The benefits package for this role includes (but not limited to) a competitive annual salary reflective of experience, company bonus scheme, contributory pension, life assurance, private medical insurance and share purchase scheme to name a few! no -- Principals only. title: Trial Capabilities Associate Russia
desc: Want to receive job alerts for similar jobs ? Trial Capabilities Associate Russia Company : Eli Lilly Job Type : Full Time Cork, County Cork Apply Now Advertisement Job Description At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 35,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world. At Lilly, we make a difference for people the world over by discovering, developing and delivering medicines that help people live longer, healthier and more active lives. Central to all that we do are our talented and motivated professionals, circa 850 of whom are based at our Global Business Solutions Centre in Little Island, Cork. There we boast a vibrant workforce made up of over 38 nationalities, speaking over 27 languages. Established in 2010 to gain efficiencies in areas such as General Accounting, Purchase to Pay and Order to Cash, the GBS Cork quickly excelled in its financial mandate, allowing the Cork leadership to ask, how can we apply these processes to other areas of the business? And so the GBS we have today was born, still leading in finance, but also evolving and expanding into diverse Business Service functions including Customer Care, Global HR Data Management, Clinical Trial Management and Scientific Communications, and more to come on stream across 2020. This, along with the recent physical expansion of the Little Island campus, means there has never been a more exciting time to be part of the GBS story! Mirroring the existing Island House building, the new Island Hall facility extends our overall capacity where Lilly offers a premium workspace across both buildings, complete with flexible working options, healthcare, pension and life assurance benefits, subsidised canteen, wellbeing facilities, travel subsidies, on-site parking and much more. At the GBS, it’s not just about what we do today, but how we can continuously improve and innovate for present and future operations. We view the development of our highly skilled workforce in much the same way and want to grow your role into an empowering and fulfilling career here at Lilly. Therefore, with the sole purpose of employee progression, weekly Manager 1:1s, a dedicated Learning & Development service and Educational Assistance schemes all await you. Above all, it’s about being part of an open, welcoming and inclusive culture, one that is further enhanced by the dedication of our committees – Team Lilly Culture, Diversity & Inclusion, Corporate Social Responsibility and Health Safety & Environment. “We see Cork as an integral part of our productivity agenda. If you are excited by new opportunity and new scope, you are working at the right place.” – Dave Ricks, CEO Lilly. Clinical Trial Responsibilities: Initiate investigator site activities, including collection and submission of regulatory documents, customization and negotiation of informed consent documents, serve as the point of contact for a site’s ERB and Competent Authority (CA)(where applicable), communicate and negotiate budgets with site personnel and internal teams, negotiate and obtain fully-executed contract, track and ensure site compliance to required training, and effectively drive timelines aligned with company priorities Communicate directly with sites to enable start-up and maintain an active collaboration with sites during maintenance and close-out Identify, communicate, and resolve issues Ensure country specific regulatory and data privacy requirements are incorporated into submission documents and any other documents/systems Leverage previous site / review board engagements to efficiently drive new work Populate internal systems to ensure accuracy of trial / site performance Understand and comply with procurements, legal and financial requirements and procedures Populate Trial Master Files and libraries for future reference Provide feedback and shared learning for continuous improvement Leverage trial prioritization Anticipate and monitor dynamically changing priorities. title: Manager, QA Validation Projects
desc: Manager QA Validation (QAV) Projects SUMMARY DESCRIPTION BioMarin are a high-performing, team-based organization, where colleagues are flexible, multi-skilled and empowered to make decisions. The QA Validation team support validation activities across drug substance, drug product and secondary packaging operations. This position is responsible for establishing & maintaining the validated state of GMP systems and processes at the BioMarin Shanbally site throughout the entire Validation Lifecycle, by ensuring that current regulations are adhered to and activities are conducted in line with company policies and procedures. The manager will coordinate and manage validation projects related to the implementation of new equipment/ processes and changes to existing equipment/processes. The manager of QAV Projects will have people management responsibilities for a team of validation engineers. The candidate will have excellent project and people management skills. RESPONSIBILITIES Lead a team in the implementation of projects within drug substance, drug product and secondary packaging operations. Team will have responsibility for quality oversight or execution management dependant on the validation phase. Liaise with global support team to share learnings and implement improvements at a company wide scale. Assist with preparation of regulatory filings, with answering questions from regulatory agencies, and with presentations of materials during regulatory inspections/partner audits. Provide guidance on compliance and regulations and build competency within the team. Lead and / or represent quality / QAV in multi-departmental meetings & project teams. Develop effective working relationships with key stakeholders including Engineering , Manufacturing Sciences and Operations. Responsible for talent management within the QAV team including recruitment, performance management and continued professional development. Author or support the development of strategic validation documents including validation plans, validation master plans and global policy documents. Maintain current knowledge of industry standards and regulatory requirements for products developed or manufactured by BioMarin, validation techniques/approaches and systems utilized at BioMarin. Active participation in the change control program for modifications to qualified systems. Utilise risk assessment and problem-solving tools in approach to validation strategy, investigations, and continuous improvement initiatives. Other duties as assigned EDUCATION Bachelor of Sciences degree, or higher, in a technical discipline (physical, engineering, chemical or biological sciences) is required. Training in project management is a benefit. EXPERIENCE 8+ years’ experience in a cGMP regulated manufacturing environment, with exhibited knowledge or proficiency in equipment and facility qualification; cleaning and steaming validation; and computer systems validation. Demonstrated organizational and people management skills to co-ordinate multi-discipline team & project groups ensuring high-performance throughout. Ability to present data and defend approaches in front of audiences and inspectors. Ability to comprehend technical information related to equipment, processes, and regulatory expectations. Understanding and familiarity with FDA & European regulatory requirements, guidelines, and recommendations for process validation expectations. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. no -- Principals only. title: Substation Electrical Project Manager - Cork
desc: As part of the growing Substation Electrical Team here at TLI Group we are seeking a Substation Electrical Project Manager to join the team to work on recently awarded works associated with a number of Substation Electrical projects. The successful candidate will be Site based for the majority of the time. Offices are available in either our Cork, Tralee or Limerick . Main Responsibilities The post holder for this role is responsible for the safe delivery of TLI Group Substations Build strategy in line with the company mission, vision and values. Operational Responsibilities Ensure client orders are managed, prioritised and actioned in an efficient manner Oversee the allocation of resources to ensure completion of all relevant works and liaise with relevant managers to expedite works where necessary Set accurate client expectations in relation to orders and turnaround times, ensuring excellent levels of communication with the client at all times Management of KPIs and the associated reporting metrics. Reviewing of all current trends and implementing any adjustments/process changes where required Communicate and Liaise with additional key stakeholders inclusive of local councils and ESB in order to attain ROL’s/assistance/permits where required to ensure completion works Oversee the consent/wayleave process and ensure all relevant consent is in place prior to commencement of works, while also setting the process expectations with the premise owners Management of overheads/order costings to ensure all works are financially viable Oversee forecasting requirements together with delivery area calendar allocation and develop an ongoing work programme based on both Monitor crew and sub contractors allocations and ensure leave, absence or training requirements are included Keep up to date with all upcoming ESB handover numbers to identify upcoming demand levels Oversee the development of the Substation element of our inhouse IT system which will be designed to support all processes within the project, inclusive of job import, scheduling, crew allocation, BOM management and KPI reporting. To be developed further upon completion of initial trial period Management of minimum stock levels and development of stock management system/process Management of overheads/order costings to ensure all works are financially viable Focus on continuous improvement to ensure the highest levels of efficiency and productivity throughout the project, with a key focus on lessons learnt etc. Performance management of crews and wider Construction team. Crew Management Responsibilities Mentor; Lead; Coach; Grow and develop your direct Teams Management of Sub-Contractor and Direct Crews ensuring continual improvement Sickness reporting, behaviour, holiday capture and absence management Ensure TLI Group crews have approved Permit to work on all the relevant infrastructure Resource allocation and tracking of hours worked, bill of materials and resource allocation to assist with project management and commercial decisions Carry out performance management appraisals for all direct reports Ensure accidents and incidents are investigated and reported in a timely manner Ensuring that delegated work is correctly planned, resourced, executed in accordance with client specifications standards, agreed work methodology, relevant legislation, technical, safety and environmental standards. Quality Management Responsibilities Completing Quality Audits and proving forms back to the Quality, Environmental & Customer Complaints Coordinator Developing and ensuring Standard Operating Procedures (SOP’s) are in place and up to date Develop job aids identify minimum requirements for work types and materials on site Identify reoccurring issues/deviations from site works to enable further development of project processes with an overall view to continuous improvement Manage relevant client KPIs, generate reports and ensure all client targets are reached and surpassed on an ongoing basis. General Responsibilities Implementation of the TLI Safety Charter and Life Saving Rules Implementation of the Quality and Environmental Project Plan Demonstrate active listening skills with customers and internal teams Show personal accountability and result oriented behaviour always Develop an understanding of fibre network architectures & network topology and adherence to standards, processes and procedures for all relevant policies Liaising with customers & the ability to gain confidence with the customer & Client Actively builds and maintains a wide contact network with customers, suppliers, competitors and colleagues Build a competent team for project delivery Nurture, develop and mentor team on the principles for project success Work closely with the wider team to coordinate all required deliverables – Communication and coordination. The Ideal Candidate Qualifications Recognised academic training such as an Degree or Trade Qualifications Knowledge > 5 Years’ experience managing substation electrical Installations from MV-110 kV. > 5 Years’ experience working in a utility environment Knowledge of HV Safety Rules Knowledge of PSDP/PSCS Evidence of several consistent successes within the utilities sector. Experience within the role of Document Controller Proficient in MS Project Proficient use and knowledge of software such as MS Word, Excel, Outlook and Project Skills Experience in people and line leadership Developed client facing skills with a client orientated approach Commercially astute Ability to work with minimum supervision & Ability to work within a team Excellent Communication, Interpersonal, Organisational & Planning Skills Able to balance competing priorities and meet personal targets within a fluctuating & demanding workload Attention to Detail, Communication & Social Skills Problem assessment, Creative problem solving, Interpersonal skills, Leadership abilities, Teambuilding and supervision, Oral and written communication skills Report and document preparation, Records management, Inventory management, Time management, Scheduling, Decision making, Prioritisation, Planning, Detail oriented no -- Principals only. title: Commodity Manager
desc: Since 2004, Mandiant has been a trusted partner to security-conscious organizations. Effective security is based on the right combination of expertise, intelligence, and adaptive technology, and the Mandiant Advantage SaaS platform scales decades of frontline experience and industry-leading threat intelligence to deliver a range of dynamic cyber defense solutions. Mandiant’s approach helps organizations develop more effective and efficient cyber security programs and instills confidence in their readiness to defend against and respond to cyber threats. Job Description What You Will Do: Responsible for overall supply management of assigned commodities.to ensure effective cost, quality and timely delivery of materials and services in support of FireEye’s internal needs. These commodities are at times complex in nature and require substantive level of commodity knowledge and experience. Develop and implement the strategic roadmap for assigned commodities. Lead commodity team to identify and deploy cost reduction initiatives. Collaborate with FireEye’s internal customers and evaluate potential suppliers. Negotiate contracts and master agreements. Ensure contract negotiations are inclusive of company-wide leverage and address full range of issues/items in the negotiations, including Price and performance requirements Management of changes & closures; and Auditing of contracts and master agreements. Work with FireEye’s internal customers and stakeholders to drive continuous pursuit and identification of new, alternate sources of supply to help drive cost reductions, improve quality, service and delivery. Manage strategic sourcing and purchasing activities for set of related commodities and/or services. This includes cost analysis and volume planning, monitoring the costs, schedule and scope of assigned contracts to negotiate highest quality at best value. Find new supply sources where vendors and suppliers are no longer competitive. Manage RF(X) process and negotiate purchase contracts including performance metrics with suppliers utilizing standard purchase agreements. Analyze supplier and commodity spend and forecast. Conduct supplier business reviews, monitor performance, Normally receives little instructions on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments. Leads cross-functional projects and often acts as a facilitator and team leader. Acts independently to determine methods and procedures on new or special assignments. Responsible for commodity spend analysis worldwide. Document justification of supplier selection. Audits contracts and master agreements. Qualifications 10-15 years Commodity Management experience with BA/BS or equivalent. MBA preferred. Commodity experience with subject matter expertise in a broad range of areas (e.g., IT hardware and software, telecom equipment and services, marketing services, real estate, facilities/construction, professional services, risk management, etc.). Demonstrated success in sourcing and negotiating with new and alternative cost-effective suppliers. Proven track record of developing and implementing cost-effective sourcing strategies; effective and creative problem-solving skills are key to success. Effective and versatile interpersonal and communication skills - must be able to partner effectively with internal customers, Legal, Finance and current/prospective suppliers. Strong analytically oriented problem-solving skills that lead to optimal data-based results. Proficient in Microsoft Office products and Oracle Procurement. Solid project management skills. Sustained track record of successfully managing multiple programs/projects concurrently. Strong communication, interpersonal, organizational, productivity and time management skills, including accurate attention to detail. Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in fast-paced environment no -- Principals only. title: Client Strategist
desc: Are you a professional relationship manager, with experience of consulting with multinational brands and are you looking to work with an industry leader, developing strategy for a number of their biggest clients? Are you keen to develop your career further in a company where you will bring expertise, insight and support in developing clients’ strategies, working in a high-profile position within an established and continuously growing global and market-leading organisation? The company offer a full range of benefits including: An award-winning workplace culture Hybrid working Bi-annual bonus Private healthcare, private dental and pension 25 days annual leave You will ensure that there is a strategic approach in understanding and providing innovative business solutions to address client challenges, as well as ensuring that their long-term business objectives and goals are achieved, as well as increasing discovery activity within international Enterprise business targets. You will need to be an energetic, professional and commercially-minded individual, who can build deep-rooted relationships in order to achieve ROI for your clients and, in turn, long-term account expansion and retention. This is a new role due to company growth, therefore you will be able to shape and develop this role as it evolves. Duties include: Being personally accountable for the relationship, retention, and success of the company’s largest clients Thoroughly understanding client’s business, external environments and the issues that affect individual clients Understanding the client’s goals and driving them to success in order to show the client value in their investment and help the account reach its potential Working with the Client Success and Business Development teams to understand the operational health, experience, and opportunities within their existing solutions, as well as highlighting new Enterprise clients to target Providing clients a variety of insights, advising them on best practices and trends, providing expertise and recommendations to drive usage of products and services purchased Providing exceptional technology expertise across a suite of products Working as part of a team to ensure ongoing contract compliance and negotiation of key contract terms and extensions Making key decisions about the management and success of a client's program to improve the partnership Leading meaningful strategy discussions, presenting ideas and solutions in order to drive action Provide regular status reports to internal and external stakeholders and assess risk for retention or renewal, creating action plans Establishing and maintaining a target list, using business intel, research, industry profiling and other insight to ensure that early pre-opportunity efforts are maximised, including competitor insight Some supporting activity during the sales process itself, or during the solution design process If you have a background in advising large Enterprise clients within a technology-orientated environment and enjoy building existing client relationships with the aim of achieving high ROI for them, call us or apply today! no -- Principals only.
