title: Senior Electronic Engineer
desc: Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products. Job Description The Microchip High-Reliability Integrated Power Solutions Centre, based in Ennis, is a R&D and production facility supporting the design, development, manufacturing and test of Integrated Power SolutionsTM (IPS) for high reliability applications. As the transportation sector continues to demand higher levels of power electronics reliability and integration in order to realise goals such as the more electric aircraft (MEA), Microchip’s IPS Centre of Excellence plays a critical role in supporting these objectives. Products from this centre include the Power Core Module (PCM) for Commercial Aircraft and Thrust Vector Control module for Space Launchers. The centre is now expanding and is seeking applicants to assist in the development of leading-edge new products. Job Responsibilities: The successful individuals will perform electronic design and process development for a new range of integrated power solutions using advanced methods, technologies and materials. These products include silicon-carbide power MOSFETs and diodes, analogue circuits, digital control, monitoring and communication circuitry. They have a power capability in excess of 5 kVA and are developed and manufactured for use in various high-reliability application areas, particularly in various forms of transportation. Senior-level personnel will also have lead engineer and mentoring responsibilities. These positions are based in Ennis and will involve interaction with other Microchip groups in France and USA. Job Requirements Experience in power module design and assembly (preferred) or power semiconductor packaging is desirable Experience in motor control applications is an advantage Proficient in the use of electrical design analysis and Microsoft Office software Experience in a high-reliability product development and manufacturing environment is an advantage Good organisation, teamwork, communication and interpersonal skills Great analytical and problem-solving skills and motivation to learn Strong time management skills, self-direction, and the desire to excel Education and Qualifications Honours Bachelor/Masters degree in Electronic/Electrical Engineering . What we offer Our global team is growing, and we are looking for collaborative, creative team members to help us lead the industry transformation to build an adaptable intelligent world Working in an environment encouraging you to grow your professional skills with specific training Working on next generation power and semiconductor devices such as silicon-carbide. Opportunity to work on new technologies with domain world leaders Competitive benefits such as: Pension, Healthcare, Stock Options etc. Microchip provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees around the world. We respect and value the diverse experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives of our employees and are committed to providing all employees with continuous opportunities for growth and professional development. Microchip is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer of Disabled/Veterans/Minorities/Women. We provide equal employment and affirmative action opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected under applicable federal, state or local laws. For more information on applicable equal employment regulations, please refer to the EEO is the Law Poster and the EEO is the Law Poster Supplement . Please also refer to the Pay Transparency Policy Statement . no -- Principals only. title: Senior Manufacturing Engineer (Mechanical)
desc: Senior Manufacturing Engineer (Mechanical) Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products. Job Description Microchip Ennis operates within Microchip’s High Reliability Discrete Solutions Group (HRDS) which offers one of the industry's most comprehensive power, module and signal discrete semiconductor product portfolios. Markets that the HRDS group address include alternative energy, industrial, medical, defense, commercial aviation, communications, embedded systems, motor control, and power solutions. As a Senior Manufacturing Engineer you will be a key member of the engineering team at Microchip, responsible for ensuring that our products meet customer needs and have the highest quality. Through part requirement analysis, definition and selection, ensure product is correctly processed through screening and sampling operations as required by governing bodies and internal requirements. Create and maintain Process and Product definition with associated process controls and automation initiatives ensuring continuous operational and business improvement. The Manufacturing Engineering team in Ennis are comprised of two main areas: electrical and mechanical. This position will focus on the mechanical support for the site. Role focus Combining mechanical, electrical, and software principles and their application; identify, develop, and drive continuous improvement programs to further automation within the facility. Guide and drive on-site equipment appraisal initiatives for process standardization, quality improvement, and H&S developments where identified. Understand product marking equipment and provide pass/fail decisions on part visual inspection. Data analysis with a view to continuous improvement Ensure compliance with DLA test methods. Main Duties & Responsibilities Understanding of reliability theory and principles and application to Microchip products and processes. Consult with international Microchip Divisions and test equipment suppliers to ensure best practices in the use of test and screening equipment. Understand Government Specifications as they apply to assigned product and processes. Implement Lean and support continuous improvement programmes. Support in-house training programmes as required. Ensure effective and professional communication with Microchip divisions, customers and vendors. Take on other engineering duties as required and assigned. Responsible for analysis and performance improvement of key metric (yield, scrap, etc.) for assigned processes and/or products. Create and update internal product and process documents, in accordance with product requirements Support Tactical Marketing, Planning and Engineering departments for new and existing product queries and determine alternative product selection where required. Be aware of latest technology for area of discipline and, as a minimum, ensure compliance with requirements Originate and develop technical advancements and novel solutions to technical issues, maintaining Microchip as leaders in our industry. Mentor engineering and other departments as required on area of technical specialization. Understand and implement Microchip Quality Policies and related in-house procedures as they apply to assigned processes and new products. Other duties as assigned. Demonstrate and adhere to the Microchip values. Job Requirements Education and Qualifications Level 8 Degree in Engineering with 2-3 years experience in a manufacturing role. Experience preferably in a component manufacturing, medical device or other highly regulated environment. User knowledge of LabVIEW and Minitab, JMP, Python, SolidWorks, CAD and AUTOCAD software packages. Knowledge of DLA and/or ISO standards is an advantage. Qualifications in, or previous exposure to Lean, Six Sigma, 5S, DOE, DMAICs or FMEAs is an advantage. Experience in equipment appraisal towards CE compliance is an advantage. Strong electronic and mechanical fundamentals aptitude, with good hands on approach. Demonstrable ability to learn and retain product details. Robust communications skills, fluent English is essential, with strong writing, editing, clarity and negotiation skills. Must have a strong attention to detail, problem solving skills, and demonstration of logic. Strong, demonstrable project management skills with an ability to respond/adapt to change. Candidates will have the ability to work in collaboration with others on a project team and independently on tasks. Good PC skills with proficiency in Microsoft Office packages. The candidate should be self-motivated and eager to learn new skills, they need to be flexible, excellent team player and demonstrate the Microchip values. title: Quality Engineer
desc: One of the leading companies in the Medical Device sector Lots of upskilling and development opportunities Largest life sciences employer in Ireland , employing more than 6,000 people at its sites About Your New Job As a Quality Engineer, you will be responsible for the supervision of Quality Technicians. Driving and implementing process improvements to ensure predictable processes across all product lines (e.g. Risk Reduction, Yield improvements, Customer complaint reduction, Error proofing, Cost Reduction initiatives, Process Automation activities). Providing effective and responsive QA support to Operations to meet their area’s objectives of quality, cost, and output. Ensuring all process variables and their interactions are adequately defined. Ensuring all failure modes in the process have been identified and addressed (e.g. Use of DOE studies, FMEA’s). Driving and implementing plant-wide quality system improvements. Ensuring Regulatory compliance in the area of responsibility to cGMP’s of all medical device regulatory agencies (e.g. FDA and TUV). Providing functional expertise to other support functions on quality-related issues (e.g. regulatory requirements, statistical techniques, sampling principles). Identifying and implementing appropriate statistical techniques to monitor process performance (e.g. SPC, CpK analysis, sampling techniques). Approval of change requests for product, process and quality system changes. Customer complaints : Analysis of returns, approval of analysis reports and analysis of complaint trends. Validation : Define process, product, and test method validation requirements, preparation and approval of Master Validation Plans, protocols, and reports approval. Compilation of required Regulatory documentation (e.g.Technical files, Design Dossiers, Product transfer files, Essential requirements). MRB : Review of MRB trends and identification of appropriate corrective actions when required. Performing internal quality audits. Supporting the implementation of Lean Manufacturing across the site. Transferring and implementing products and processes from development or from another manufacturing facility. What Skills You Need Minimum of Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering /Technology 2/3 years experience in a manufacturing environment or equivalent with direct experience in a Quality Assurance environment (preferably GMP regulated). Experience in the medical device industry is an advantage. Experience on an automated/high volume line is an advantage. What’s on Offer €40,000 - 55,000, along with an attractive benefits package. ​ What’s Next​ Apply now by clicking the “Apply Now" button or call me, Barbara Szatkowska on +353 86 796 1534 or if the job isn’t quite right but you are looking for something similar, please get in touch! title: Materials Management Lead (Warehouse)
desc: Materials Management Lead – WarehousePPG are proud to announce our new manufacturing site in Shannon, Ireland , for the production of UDC’s highly efficient, high-performing UniversalPHOLED® materials. The new facility is designed to double the production capacity and diversify the manufacturing base for UDC’s phosphorescent emitters, and we are looking to recruit exceptional talent to help us make it happen, as we continue to both protect and beautify the world. As the Materials Management Lead, you will supervise all materials coordination on site whilst providing support to all departments to meet the overall needs of the production schedule on plant. This role will be instrumental in the set up and activation of the warehousing department here in Shannon, and will be heavily involved in the process of implementing the new SAP system on site. Key Responsibilities, you will:- Strategically manage the local warehouse function in compliance with PPGs policies and vision, whilst working to ensure productivity targets are achieved and that all warehouse processes are running efficiently and promptly. Ensure that direct receiving, warehousing and distribution operations take place on time and as required, overseeing the efficient receipt, storage, value-adding servicing and dispatch of both raw materials and finished goods. Ensure timely and accurate response to the material requirements, by ensuring the availability of required materials to the manufacturing unit and accurate stock management reports to the production planning and procurement functions as required. Manage raw material capacity and present to the team scenario planning if capacity becomes constrained. Supervise the flow of both raw materials and finished goods across the plant, including stock control and material reconciliation where required. Work with suppliers to understand shipping terms, material cost, quoted delivery times and to improve delivery lead times. Develop and manage critical metrics specific to the warehouse function and where appropriate implement timely corrective and improvement actions to achieve the targets. Qualifications Degree or other relevant qualification is preferred, ideally in a supply chain related field. Significant experience in a material management role, ideally in a chemical or pharmaceutical industry. Knowledge of regulatory and legislative requirements (environmental, health and safety, and quality and employment law). High level computer proficient for example, MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, with significant experience of SAP! ABOUT US: Here at PPG we make it happen, and we seek candidates of the highest integrity and professionalism who share our values, with the commitment and drive to strive today to do better than yesterday – everyday. PPG: WE PROTECT AND BEAUTIFY THE WORLD™ Through leadership in innovation, sustainability and color, PPG helps customers in industrial, transportation, consumer products, and construction markets and aftermarkets to enhance more surfaces in more ways than does any other company. To learn more, visit and follow @ PPG on Twitter. The PPG Way Every single day at PPG: We partner with customers to create mutual value. We are insightful, dedicated and proactive. We have intimate knowledge of the market and our customers. We focus on practical solutions that make a difference. We are “One PPG” to the world. We are better and stronger together. We leverage our scale to reach new markets and introduce innovative technologies as we differentiate and disrupt our markets. We trust our people every day, in every way. We enable and empower our people to make the right decisions. We are inclusive, transparent and respectful. Our feedback is clear and actionable. We make it happen. We have a passion for winning. We achieve. We deliver with discipline and integrity. We bring our best energy to our work. We decide and act intelligently and quickly. We run it like we own it. We respect one another by being responsible and accountable. We always act in the best interest of our company, customers, shareholders and our communities. We do better today than yesterday – everyday. We continuously learn. We develop our people to grow our businesses. PPG Way: (Click here to learn more about the PPG Way) PPG vision: We are One PPG: PPG provides equal opportunity to all candidates and employees. We offer an opportunity to grow and develop your career in an environment that provides a fulfilling workplace for employees, creates an environment for continuous learning, and embraces the ideas and diversity of others. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, pregnancy, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression. no -- Principals only. title: Plant Coordinator
desc: Why work for us? At Saint-Gobain, our employees have pride in belonging to an organization whose culture is made up of these core values: Trust, Empowerment, & Collaboration. Our company encourages diversity and inclusion in all its forms while making the world a more beautiful and sustainable home. New hires who are vaccinated against COVID-19 earn $500 bonus! What’s the Job? The Plant Coordinator will be responsible for performing functions/tasks associated with shipping, receiving, tracking, and payment of goods, raw materials and services within the Ennis, Texas facility. The Plant Coordinator will also perform a multitude of Human Resources tasks, including payroll, employee communication, benefits administration/activities, special projects and other general administrative programs as instructed by the plant Sr. Human Resources Coordinator. This person will be responsible for providing administrative services of a highly responsible and confidential nature. Diplomacy in personal, telephone, and written contacts with all levels of personnel is necessary. This position reports to the Plant Manager and is a member of the site Leadership Team. Support Sr Plant HR Coordinator with various HR administrative functions. Process hourly weekly payroll using the Kronos Timekeeper System, verify punch detail, perform attendance tracking and schedule verifications, including the interfacing of hours to be processed into the payroll system. Support the Plant leadership team, including with organizing activities for community involvement, training/developing opportunities. Coordinate and administer various plant programs such as office supplies, safety wear, SGC Community Plant Gifts. Partner with finance and purchasing to assist with audits and raw material counts, truck logs, packi slips, etc. Maintain tracking for production, shipments, and customer orders in addition to maintaining raw material and vendor files. Reports to: Plant Manager Direct Reports: None Travel: None no -- Principals only. title: Senior Manufacturing Engineer (Electrical/Electronic)
desc: Senior Manufacturing Engineer (Electrical/Electronic) Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products. Job Description Microchip Ennis operates within Microchip’s High Reliability Discrete Solutions Group (HRDS) which offers one of the industry's most comprehensive power, module and signal discrete semiconductor product portfolios. Markets that the HRDS group address include alternative energy, industrial, medical, defense, commercial aviation, communications, embedded systems, motor control, and power solutions. As a Senior Manufacturing Engineer, you will be a key member of the engineering team at Microchip, responsible for ensuring that our products meet customer needs and have the highest quality. Through part requirement analysis, definition, and selection, ensure product is correctly processed through screening and sampling operations as required by governing bodies and internal requirements. Create and maintain Process and Product definition with associated process controls and automation initiatives ensuring continuous operational and business improvement. The Manufacturing Engineering team in Ennis are comprised of two main areas: electrical and mechanical. This position will focus on the electrical support for the site. Role focus Combining mechanical, electrical, and software principles and their application; identify, develop, and drive continuous improvement programmes to further automation within the facility. Guide and drive on-site equipment appraisal initiatives for process standardization, quality improvement, and H&S developments where identified. Understand HTRB and Burn-in screening principles, our products and processes to ensure compliance and maximum yield. Understand DC and AC test principles, our products, related equipment, and processes to ensure compliance and maximum yield. Ensure compliance with DLA test methods. Main Duties & Responsibilities Understanding of reliability theory and principles and application to Microchip products and processes. Consult with international Microchip Divisions and test equipment suppliers to ensure best practices in the use of test and screening equipment. Understand Government Specifications as they apply to assigned product and processes. Implement Lean and support continuous improvement programmes. Support in-house training programmes as required. Ensure effective and professional communication with Microchip divisions, customers and vendors. Take on other engineering duties as required and assigned. Responsible for analysis and performance improvement of key metric (yield, scrap, etc.) for assigned processes and/or products. Create and update internal product and process documents, in accordance with product requirements Support Tactical Marketing, Planning and Engineering departments for new and existing product queries and determine alternative product selection where required. Be aware of latest technology for area of discipline and, as a minimum, ensure compliance with requirements Originate and develop technical advancements and novel solutions to technical issues, maintaining Microchip as leaders in our industry. Mentor engineering and other departments as required on area of technical specialization. Understand and implement Microchip Quality Policies and related in-house procedures as they apply to assigned processes and new products. Other duties as assigned. Demonstrate and adhere to the Microchip values. Job Requirements Qualifications / Experience required Level 8 Degree in Engineering (preferably Electronic Engineering) or Level 8 Degree in Physics. Experience preferably in a component manufacturing, medical device or other highly regulated environment. User knowledge of LabVIEW and Minitab, JMP, Python, SolidWorks, CAD and AUTOCAD software packages. Knowledge of DLA and/or ISO standards is an advantage. Qualifications in, or previous exposure to Lean, Six Sigma, 5S, DOE, DMAICs or FMEAs is an advantage. Experience in equipment appraisal towards CE compliance is an advantage. Strong electronic and mechanical fundamentals aptitude, with good hands on approach. Demonstrable ability to learn and retain product details. Robust communications skills, fluent English is essential, with strong writing, editing, clarity and negotiation skills. Must have a strong attention to detail, problem solving skills, and demonstration of logic. Strong, demonstrable project management skills with an ability to respond/adapt to change. Candidates will have the ability to work in collaboration with others on a project team and independently on tasks. Good PC skills with proficiency in Microsoft Office packages. The candidate should be self-motivated and eager to learn new skills, they need to be flexible, excellent team player and demonstrate the Microchip values. title: Senior Principal Engineer, VxRail CSE Cork/ Ireland Remote
desc: Senior Principal Engineer, VxRail CSE Cork/ Ireland Remote Dell Technologies recognizes that the technology landscape is constantly changing. From applied research to advanced engineering , the Engineering Technologist team has the expertise to shape ground-breaking products, material and processes. It’s a fascinating field of work. We’re involved in assessing the competition, developing technology and product strategies and generating intellectual property. We lead technology investigations, analyze industry capabilities and recommend potential acquisitions or vendor partner opportunities. Our insights influence product architecture and definitions. And we work with colleagues across the business to ensure our products always lead the way. Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Senior Principal Engineer on our CSE team in VxRail. What you’ll achieve: As a Senior Principal Engineer , you will be responsible for all aspects of the VxRail product. The VxRail CSE team works with internal groups such as core development, product management, field services as well as external customers. Corporate Systems Engineers are highly technical and versatile, providing advanced engineering to the overall business. Common responsibilities include proof of concepts, customer qualification investigations, new feature validation and formal knowledge transfer. You will: Participate in formal knowledge transfer presentations covering new release features and functions Maintain key product collateral and demonstrations Validate customer requests for qualifications (RPQ) of non-standard configurations Assist strategic customers as necessary, ensuring positive outcomes Provide key field feedback into product management and development Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements Minimum 10 years hands with VMware vSphere in enterprise environments Excellent written and verbal skills Competency in L2/L3 networking Experience with VSAN or comparable SDS Working knowledge of HCI based solutions Experience with VMware Cloud Foundations & Software development experience Working knowledge of VMware NSX Here’s our story; now tell us yours Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. title: Project Manager, Sign and Cycle
desc: Deaf Enterprises is recruiting a manager for its Sign & Cycle project in conjunction with Cork Community Bikes. Position Information: Basic Details Deaf Enterprises was established over 30 years ago to encourage, promote, develop and foster the employment of deaf people and also to provide education, environmental, recreational and cultural opportunities for deaf people by direct and indirect actions which should be conducive to the attainment of the common good. It currently employs more than 30 people in Re-upholstery, Sewing, French Polishing and Furniture Manufacturing and restoration. Cork Community Bikes was founded in 2005 by a group of people who realised there was great potential in the idea of a community workshop based on the recycling and reuse of bicycles that would otherwise end up being scrapped. Community bicycle workshops are a well established idea elsewhere in Europe where they have proved to have significant social, environmental and cultural benefits for the local area. CCB has education as its main focus, with currently around 20 volunteers involved. Activities include Fix Your Bike public sessions weekly, bike maintenance courses and various events. Bikes donated to CCB are fixed by volunteers for sale or onward donation. Sign and Cycle is a partnership between the two organisations, which will be running this project at least until 2024 as a pilot, enabling deaf and hard of hearing trainees to become bicycle mechanics, making bikes more accessible and diverting hundreds of bikes that are currently going for scrap metal. Position Title: Project Manager, Sign and Cycle Department: Sign and Cycle programme Location: Ballinlough, Cork City Position Type: Contract Full-time/Part-Time: Full-time Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) % (1.0=100%): 1.0: 39 hours per week Appointment Term: Annually renewable Pay Type (Salary or Hourly) *subject to Salary: €40,000 determination by HR Position Summary Information: Essential Duties and Requirement Details To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Job Description Summary Responsible for the day to day management of the business unit (Sign and Cycle) (other duties may be assigned) Management of the Sign and Cycle team (initially 3 Full-Time Equivalent operatives) Create a harmonious working environment, train and mentor staff and motivate all team members to perform efficiently. Ensure that the specific needs of the staff are supported Perform efficient finance management, ensuring that spending is within budget, considering project funding and other sources of income. Build strong relationships with customers in order to maintain good revenue growth Incorporate company procedures and policies in operations of business unit. Monitor and review project activities and ensure its completion within scheduled time and budget. Manage business activities focusing on financial and strategic growth of organisation. Manage supply of bikes and supply of equipment for programme Be the main point of contact for the steering group and for partners. Co-ordinate, plan and oversee Sign & Cycle operations in cooperation with the Steering Group. Responsible for raising the profile of Sign & Cycle through participating in local and national networking activities. Ensure with the Steering Group that Sign & Cycle functions in an efficient, fair and transparent manner. Work in partnership with Deaf Enterprises, Cork Community Bikes and external groups such as Cork City Council. Strive to ensure a culture of respect and co-operation for staff and customers. Ensure that Sign and Cycle meets all conditions of funding and with statutory and compliance requirements. Required Experience Management of a team and/or projects for a minimum of 1 year. Support or work with individuals with disabilities Desirable Education and/or Experience: Proficiency in Irish Sign Language Bicycle repair Experience within Social Enterprise sector A relevant professional qualification or third level qualification Required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Excellent organisation, communication and and/or interpersonal skills; Ability to work and prioritise under pressure and tight schedule Use of practical skills and ability to resolve practical challenges. Creative thinking – The Manager should possess the ability to develop and create new ideas, systems, and relationships for the success of the project. Decision making skills: He/she should have the ability to analyse information and evaluate results in order to make the best decision in solving problems Planning skills: – The manager should have the ability to develop specific plans and goals to help in accomplishing tasks efficiently Ability to deal with complaints and resolve disputes and conflicts Motivating skills: The Manager should be able to self-motivate and to encourage and build team spirit among staff, bringing about mutual respect and cooperation He/she must have pleasant personality and display managerial and leadership abilities Ability to identify new opportunities and exploit them to the benefit of the project He/she should have strong marketing skills Computer literate with a strong knowledge of Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Full driving licence and/or Abilities Work Environment and/or Physical Demands Some lifting and moving of bicycles and equipment of similar weight. Registered Charity Number: 20040963 CHY Number: 13288 Company Number: 302282 no -- Principals only. title: Lead Engagement Insights and Campaign Planning
desc: Bring your possibility to life! Define your career with us With over 100 years of rich history and strongly positioned as a local bank with regional and international expertise, a career with our family offers the opportunity to be part of this exciting growth journey, to reset our future and shape our destiny as a proudly African group. Job Summary To develop and implement Advanced Analytical Models within Campaign Analytics, to grow production in the product houses while balancing contact governance. Leading a cross-functional team to use test, learn and agile methodologies to inform our engagement strategy, ensuring we engage customers with the most relevant offers and channels at the right time. Ensure best practices are adopted across RBB and build an agile environment for integration of data and offers. Job Description To develop and implement Advanced Analytical Models within Campaign Analytics, to grow production in the product houses while balancing contact governance. Leading a cross-functional team to use test, learn and agile methodologies to inform our engagement strategy, ensuring we engage customers with the most relevant offers and channels at the right time. Ensure best practices are adopted across RBB and build an agile environment for integration of data and offers. Key accountabilities Accountability: Engagement Insights Collaborate with strategic marketing and product areas to determine optimal campaign plan Develop targets for desired outcome for all campaigns Set up campaign cadence and tracking mechanisms to manage and ensure campaigns are tracked consistently across RBB – language, format, value to customers, targets etc. Determine framework for collaborating with key functions Risk, Audit, Compliance, HR to deliver a Sales strategy for the delivery of an efficient leads processes to support current campaign and sales plans as well as future sales planning needs Set up cross-functional campaign squads with agile ways of work (including business and channel) to deliver campaign use cases Ensure all learning from campaigns are captured and implemented Develop and implement appropriate tools to track campaign responses – digital interaction heat map, customer profitability Engage with customer experience and design team to develop and implement multichannel mapping of sales journey (acquisition, ECM and retention) Ensure potential customer touchpoints relating to ECM and sales are centrally coordinated Ensure meta-analysis are conducted to enable big data campaign insights into customer engagement behaviours and drive decision making Develop new segmentation from campaign insights Drive big data model development with the advanced analytics team to determine required customer traits Produce sales value chain analysis across sales and ECM funnel to determine initiatives required for driving uplift Ensure relevant operating requirements are met e.g., communication and training to channel on matters with customer impact has been clearly communicated. Develop and enhance customer relationship management capability across the business through design sales Processes and orchestrate change management processes to promote utilization Keep abreast of industry best sales practice and share with sales and sales support teams and incorporate into Support strategic marketing team and design team in improving language, style and digital identity standard Accountability: Risk Management Ensure that processes, control requirements and risk management frameworks that have been designed for the area are understood by all members of the team. For audit findings that have an impact on the area, work with the Head of Business Development to understand what actions are required to close out findings. Implement required actions. During scheduled audits and management assurance reviews, ensure that all information required by the auditors are provided timeously. Log all Risk and Loss events as a result of error or fraud highlighted in the department. Ensure that the issues are thoroughly investigated and closed or escalated as per policy. Ensure that the team understands all compliance requirements and highlight gaps to the Head of Business Development. Monitor compliance training undertaken by team members and ensure that they complete the required training within prescribed timelines. Ensure that all regulatory requirements are adhered to. Ensure that the Business Continuity Tool is updated regularly. Arrange for team members to participate in BCM tests at the required intervals and document test results. Work with other managers in the area to implement corrective measures in case of test fails. Ensure that all team leaders and members understand the control requirements related to physical and systems access control and information security requirements. Collect access cards from employees leaving the department or the bank and send instructions to IT and HR to remove their systems access. Accountability: People Management Oversee the activities of the team to ensure effective delivery Develop a high performing team by embedding formal performance development and informal coaching. Encourage frequent knowledge sharing between team members. Determine and analyse development needs for the team and ensure that identified training requirements are budgeted for and executed. Establish and maintain a succession plan for the team. Interview and recruit new members of the team, including determining appropriate compensation levels with input from Human Resources. Create effective workforce and recruitment demand plans to ensure that current and future business requirements can be met. Plans should be revised at least twice a year. Review and update the department’s organisation structure and role description on at least an annual basis to ensure that they are fit for purpose and contain all the accountabilities of each team member. Approve leave requests for team members and create leave plans to ensure adequate coverage. When required, initiate disciplinary processes for team members calling on support from Human Resources when required. Resolve grievances raised by team members and escalate only if required. Address poor performance of any team member through the formal Performance Motivate team members and ensure that their efforts are recognised. Role/Person specification Education and experience required B Degree in Commerce or equivalent NQF 7 level qualification MBA / Similar Masters would be an advantage Certified scrum master / agile training and/or experience setting up and operating and agile team would be an advantage Minimum of 8-10 years retail banking & Sales and Marketing Experience Experience in leading sales on a national level in a managerial capacity Knowledge and skills: Business Planning Financial Management Capacity Planning Regulatory (including all Customer / Non-Customer Regulation impacting banking e.g. FAIS, NCA, BASEL, Twin Peaks, TCF, KYC etc. Digital Capability Risk Management (Legal, reputational, operational, etc.) Agile / Scrum methodology Competencies: Strategic Capability Business Acumen Customer Focus Results Orientation Innovation Leadership Problem Solving Leadership Inspirational People Leadership Collaboration and Influencing Education Bachelor`s Degrees and Advanced Diplomas: Business, Commerce and Management Studies (Required) Absa Bank Limited is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. In compliance with the Employment Equity Act 55 of 1998, preference will be given to suitable candidates from designated groups whose appointments will contribute towards achievement of equitable demographic representation of our workforce profile and add to the diversity of the Bank. Absa Bank Limited reserves the right not to make an appointment to the post as advertised no -- Principals only. title: Shipper‐Receiver‐Inventory Transaction Specialist, Ireland
desc: Casa Systems, Inc. (Nasdaq: CASA) is 5G, delivering physical, virtual and cloud - native 5G infrastructure and customer premise networking for high - speed data and multi - service communications networks. Our core and edge convergence technology enables public and private networks for both communications service providers and enterprises. Casa Systems™ products deliver higher performance, improved network flexibility and scalability, increased operational efficiency and lower total cost of ownership (TCO). Commercially deployed in more than 70 countries, Casa serves over 475 Tier 1 and regional service providers worldwide. At Casa Systems, our mission is to deliver ultra - broadband solutions that keep families, communities and the world connected. We harness our passion for innovation to drive technological solutions that allow service providers to do amazing things that improve the way we live. Casa Communications Ltd., a division of Casa Systems, Inc., is seeking to hire a Shipping - Receiving - Inventory Transaction Specialist to join its operations based in Limerick , Ireland . The Shipper - Receiver - Inventory Transaction Specialist will impact the organization by ensuring the timely movement of goods in and out of the company and keeping accurate records of inventory in accordance with company policies and practices. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Generate customs documents for shipping equipment globally. Understands customs formalities & procedures (Import/Export).Maintain inventory accuracy above 99.7%.Verify and maintain records of all types of inventory transactions, including cycle counting, receiving, bin‐to‐bin transfers, and outgoing shipments. Prepares items for shipment; including assembling order contents, addressing, and arranging for the transportation of products; both physical and system transaction processing. Move material between the dock, stockrooms, and the manufacturing floor and processing all material movement transfer transactions accurately. Arrange collection from global suppliers and communicate with supply chain on delivery. Receiving: Unpack, inspect, and verify incoming shipments as well as reject damaged packages, shortages and work with various departments to correct issues. Research problems and tracks orders. Provide statistical reports on inventory, logistics and RMA. Communicate effectively with the management team. QUALIFICATIONS: High School Diploma or equivalent.5+ years of Logistics & inventory control experience in an electronic product environment. Has active driver’s license and is able and willing to drive own automobile to carry out tasks, as needed. Able to lift to 10kgs without assistance and greater than 20kgs. with assistance (2‐person lift).Experience with ERP/MRP system for inventory transaction processing including completion of work orders and use of cycle count applications. Microsoft Great Plains/Dynamics experience preferred. Knowledge of material handling procedures for electronic devices; ESD handling procedures. Computer literate: Windows, Outlook, Microsoft Word, Excel. Use a hand truck or pallet jack to move material to and from dock to storage. Ability to work extended hours when needed. Perform all tasks with a very high degree of accuracy and quality. Personable and enjoys interacting with employees across the organization. Able to communicate clearly both written and orally. Energetic, assertive, self‐starter, and well organized. #LI - AM1 no -- Principals only. title: Lifecycle Specialist, Time & Attendance
desc: Remote is solving global remote organizations’ biggest challenge: employing anyone anywhere compliantly. We make it possible for businesses big and small to employ a global team by handling global payroll, benefits, taxes, and compliance (learn more about how it works ). We're backed by A+ investors and our team is world-class, literally and figuratively, as we're all scattered around the world. Please check out our public handbook to learn more about our culture. We encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age and abilities to apply. You can also check out independent reviews left by other candidates and our employees on Glassdoor. If this job description resonates with you, we want to hear from you! All of our positions are fully remote. You do not have to relocate to join us! How we work We love working async and this means you get to do your own schedule. We empower ownership and proactivity and when in doubt default to action instead of waiting. The position This is an exciting time to join Remote and make a personal difference in the global employment space as a Lifecycle Specialist, Time & Attendance, joining our Employee Lifecycle team. The Time & Attendance Specialist will ensure all Time & Attendance related activities for Remote’s external employees and clients are performed with focus on legal compliance and superior employee experience without compromising on speed. You will be reporting to the Time & Attendance Manager. Requirements Demonstrable experience in People or HR with a focus on HR Operations, specifically managing Time & Attendance tasks. Operational HR experience across multiple countries. Good analytical, problem solving and strong execution skills. Strong team player with ability to anticipate, work independently and demonstrate ownership. Keen interest in documentation and asynchronous working. Familiar with communication, documentation, and project management tools such as Asana, Notion, Slack, Zendesk and G-suite. Experience working in a remote setting, hyper-growth start-up culture is a plus. Writes and speaks fluent English. Additional languages are a bonus. Key responsibilities Own and drive Employee Lifecycle standard operating procedures for Time & Attendance. Engage with and support external employees and vendors as necessary. Manage employee data, ensuring information is current, kept safe and confidential. Build strong partnerships with internal teams with a customer-first approach. Identify and implement improvements to the employee journey and experience. Be an internal and external champion of Remote's values and Lifecycle team's goals. Identify automation and process improvement opportunities. Remote Compensation Philosophy Remote’s Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair unbiased compensation and fair pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap- labour practices and therefore pay a minimum annual salary of USD 40,000 per year, in all locations throughout the world. Actual compensation may vary based upon geographical location, experience, and/or skill level. However, it will never be below our minimum global compensation mentioned. You'll report to: Manager, Time & Attendance, Lifecycle no -- Principals only. title: Compliance Manager
desc: WHAT IS THE FUNCTION OF THIS ROLE? As a senior member of the Compliance Team, you will ensure that the business site operations comply with legal, regulatory and other requirements including the company’s Integrated Management System, Environmental Permits, ABHA approvals and PAS 110/100 accreditation, through the regular auditing and monitoring of operational sites and the company Head Office. You will lead a team of Compliance Delivery Officers located across the business’ operational areas and a Compliance Administrative Assistant in their duties. ROLE SUMMARY: This full-time roles’ core responsibilities are to ensure compliance documentation is current and fully maintained, that STGP staff training records are in date, ensure site protocols are followed and audit trails are complete. As the Compliance Manager you will oversee regular assurance reviews of all aspects of regulatory compliance and health and safety requirements, reporting findings and outcomes. You will ensure any outstanding requirements and actions are followed up and support the delivery of activities to ensure compliance is maintained. You will support the preparation of external audit activity by industry regulators and close-out actions. REMUNERATION & BENEFITS: * * Competitive Salary * Car Allowance * PMI * 25 days holiday + 8 Bank holidays with the option to purchase additional leave * Annual company bonus scheme (linked to key performance indicators) * Company pension scheme * Occupational health cover * Comprehensive flexible benefits scheme including Gymflex, Electric car salary sacrifice scheme, Dental and Critical Illness Insurance and our Technology Scheme where you can spread payment for a variety of Technology purchases * Sharesave scheme - A chance to save up to £500 per month for three or five years, with the option to buy Severn Trent Plc shares at a discounted rate What does success look like? STPG sites and Head Office operates safe and compliant working practices that are fully auditable. STGP fulfils its regulatory quality, environmental and health & safety requirements and STGP has a fully auditable IMS, which is promoted across operational sites and Head Office and is adhered to. KEY ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES: As a key point of contact between Compliance to Site Operational teams, you will build an effective working knowledge of industry regulations, including but not limited to DSEAR, Animal By-Product Regulation, PAS 100/110, Environmental Protection Act, Health and Safety legislation and GDPR Regulatory Compliance/Assurance/Audit Work closely with operational teams to ensure the company’s compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, including Environmental Permits, APHA, PAS 100/110, GDPR, Operator’s Licence and STGP’s Integrated Management System. Manage regulatory compliance assurance plan, audit and assurance activities, driving compliance requirements on all operational sites, timely report on findings and document and track any required follow-up actions. Support Compliance Delivery Officers to work with Operational Site Leads to deliver assurance/audit activities, share the compliance outcomes and deliver action plans to drive compliant outcomes. Support Permit and Licence applications and regulatory returns where required. Lead external audit preparation, booking auditors in time with regulatory requirements, supporting preparation and delivery activities with operational leads. Follow-up on all internal and external audit and assurance requirements – drive action completion. Oversee assurance of operational risks and controls, reporting outcomes and supporting Site Leads with action plans to remove or reduce risks and at Head Office. Support Site Leads with implementing regulatory, H&S and procedural changes and training. Ensure onsite Compliance documentation is maintained, ensuring information is up-to-date, regulatory/control checks are carried out as required or escalate findings where not, to drive compliance. Ensure timelines for required maintenance, inspections, etc are captured, managed and ensure all required maintenance, inspection, testing and remedial work is completed and evidenced. Engage with Operational Site Leads in preparation. Work with Health, Safety & Wellbeing Team and Site Leads to ensure completion of risk assessments and method statements for Site activities are undertaken, fit for purpose and drive appropriate reviews where required. Assist the Health, Safety and Wellbeing Team and Operational Site Leads with accident and near miss investigation, where required. Keep accurate records of all Site Inspections – including outcomes and actions, working with the Compliance Governance Team to update planners and schedules. Raise to the Line Manager any changes or potential changes in legislation which may impact on the Company’s policies and procedures. Integrated Management System Promote and drive the requirements of the Integrated Management System (IMS) [ISO9001, ISO14001 and ISO45001] across all operational sites and Head Office. Work with the Compliance Governance Team to manage requirements, ensuring all documentation is relevant, up-to-date and reflective of the current business model. Active engagement in management review of STGP’s IMS and deliver required internal audits of the IMS. Team Management Provide regular reporting on business compliance performance. Manage the functionality and administration of Head Office. Work with QEHS Director in preparing and setting team targets and objectives. Regular attendance at Site locations, engaging with Compliance Delivery Officers and key Operational Site Leads. Qualifications and Experience * Working in a regulated industry * Engagement with regulators * Audit/assurance activities * Working with Integrated Management System (ISO) * Working within waste industry / knowledge of PAS100/110 (desired) * Environmental Permitting (desired) * NEBOSH General Certificate * H&S Legislation: Manual Handling, PPE, COSHH, LOLER, DSEAR (desired) * Line Management experience * Driving Licence no -- Principals only. title: Senior Incident Manager - Opportunity for Working Remotely
desc: Senior Incident Manager The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity? As a part of the Global Support (GS) Team, your work as a Support Incident Manager will help advocate for an excellent customer support experience at VMware. The role provides you a unique opportunity to interact daily with top tier and most strategic customer organizations in technology, healthcare, finance, research, and government institutions. You will build strong relationships with customer and internal teams at VMware. In this role, you will collaborate regularly with Customer Success Executives, Technical Support Engineers, and Development teams to ensure that VMware is delivering overall best in-class Support services. Every new job is an opportunity for growing your career. VMware is expanding rapidly in the virtualization, EUC and multi-cloud domains. You can be a part of our growth story as VMware is the only company perfectly positioned to provide the multi-cloud platform for all the applications our customers need to accelerate their business today, and in the future. VMware provides a long-term benefit to expand your skills with annual education reimbursements, job rotation programs, subscriptions to online training platforms and employee networking groups. What is the primary need, technical challenge, and/or problem you will be responsible for? We work a part of a team that is delivering an unparalleled support experience leveraging VMware solutions. Our customers rely on us to help them ensure their VMware environments are stable and working as they should. We will need someone that is passionate about collaboration and working with engineering , sales, partners, TSEs and product marketing teams to ensure that VMware is delivering overall superior service and support to our customers. Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing? Within the first three months, you will be comfortable maintaining an accurate record of your customers’ most important activities, have a good familiarity of the tools we use daily in Support. You may run customer first interactions like Kickoff calls, support weekly/quarterly reviews with minimal oversight. Within the first 6 months, you will regularly have a consistent control of low to medium level escalations, build trust among internal teams and customer, complete 10-hour quarterly training in time, and commit to finishing a VCTA or VCP by end of a fiscal year. Within the first 9-12 months, you will have the ability to proactively ensure that Support Requests (SRs) are driven to resolution without any gaps, independently run advanced-level escalations, work with peers for opportunities to enhance process/workflow internally, maintain customer retention rate of 90% or above, and increase customer confidence in our platform and Support delivery. The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis? Run recurring weekly/biweekly/monthly meetings with your customers to review open SRs. Run idle and custom reports for extra insights. Update Engagement records with latest customer actions, priorities, and temperature. Act as single point of contact for the management and/or escalation of all Support-related activities by partnering with GS, Customer Success, and our Product Development teams. Coordinate all remote and onsite support engagements and lead get-well plans for customers to identify negative trends and act accordingly with internal teams to improve the Support experience. Participate in Customer Success Executive Business reviews and provide details that identify issue trends, corrective actions, training opportunities based on customer SR data. Oversee and direct Support Requests to the proper resources and make use case information available to internal teams when necessary to assist with problem resolution. Document and deliver formal root cause analyses as needed for critical customer situations. What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like? My name is Richard O’Byrne and I am the hiring manager for the role. I have worked in VMware since 2007, starting off as a Technical Support Engineer, before becoming an Escalation Engineer and then making the move into the management team in 2010. I am currently the team manager in the Vmware Cloud Foundation team and we are a team of dedicated professionals across Technical Support and Account Management who are passionate about helping our customers. The team is proud of the unique model within GS that emphasizes on collaboration, transparency, and career growth. Additionally, we believe that open and respectful communication between peers and managers establishes a great culture that attracts diversity and promotes inclusion. In this role, expect to be challenged occasionally to bring your best and your efforts will be widely acknowledged and rewarded. The GS leadership actively encourages the pursuance of hobbies and activities outside of work and the importance of taking time off for an optimal work-life balance. Where is this role located? Flexible: The role is considered flexible and will be a mix of working from the Cork VMware office and remote depending on your preferences and the arrangements determined with your future manager. You will be expected to live within a reasonable non-daily commute of the office. What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware? You will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting . Employee Stock Purchase Plan Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types Generous Time Off Programs 40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.) Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes Category : Services and Consulting Subcategory: Services and Consulting Experience: Manager and Professional Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time Posted Date: 2022-03-02 VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at . Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
desc: WHAT TO EXPECT We are seeking a Senior ML Engineer for an opportunity to join a household name automotive brand that's strengthening its Engineering department in data - driven areas. You will be working on state - of - the - art machine learning projects for the stakeholders across Engineering department. You’ll be exposed to a wealth of different topics, data - types and projects as diverse as NLP, computer vision, clustering, timeseries, Explainable AI and bespoke model development. The main purpose of this role is to support the delivery of integrated sub systems elements, which may be physical components, a set of related components or software into vehicle programmes. The individual will work with lead engineers to ensure that valid content is specified, manage specific elements of the supplier delivery against this specification and arrange verification activity to support the vehicle program which meets the programme requirements for quality, cost and time. The ideal candidate knows that visualization is not pretty pictures or plotting. Instead they are well aware of what what InfoViz, SciViz and visual encoding means; have understanding of theoretical basis of information visualization and are pursuing visualization as specialization. Conceptualize, build and help maintain state - of - the - art ML/AI systems in the team Stay up - to - date with the latest trends in the field of machine learning Provide supervision, training and mentoring opportunities for less experienced team members Lead complex technical projects end - to - end Participate in outreach events across business and beyond (talks, training seminars, etc.) Engage with stakeholders and communicate complex things simply Undertake any other work as directed by their line manager in connection with their job as may be requested WHAT YOU'LL NEED Essential: Degree in a quantitative discipline (Master’s, PhD or comparable level of experiences can be an asset) Previous experience in a similar role(s) Excellent knowledge in at least one core area of expertise, good in several others and broad knowledge of key concerns in ML, AI and related areas Experience using Python (or R) and optionally another language (perhaps related to area(s) of your specialization) - high - level languages are preferred Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit - learn, caret, dask (or similar) Excellent knowledge of Linux/*nix family of OSes Experience having deployed something that is used by your customers You think, work and optimize at scale and on cloud (we use GCP and AWS, but on - prem/HPC and experiences from other cloud vendors are valued) To be comfortable with ambiguity and prepared to think and communicate at high levels of abstraction - technically and conceptually Good written and verbal communication and problem - solving capabilities Excellent ability to differentiate between the conceptual and the technical Desirable: We're an engineering department - experience / strong interest in XAI/model interpretability is valuable Experience adopting the Agile software development methodology Good knowledge of SQL for big - data applications SO WHY US?Bring all this to the home of premium innovation, and you’ll find the opportunities to further your career with a world - class team, a discounted car purchase and lease scheme for you and your family, membership of a competitive pension plan and private medical cover. All this and more makes Jaguar Land Rover the perfect place to continue your journey. Jaguar Land Rover is committed to equal opportunity for all. no -- Principals only. title: Principal Operat. Excellence Specialist
desc: Contacts Sete Casas 2674 – 506 Loures, Portugal Tel: 21 982 9000 Fax: 21 982 9368 Hiring Request Post Information* : Posted Date 4 days ago (2022/1/25 20:47) ID 2022-7954 # of Openings 1 Job Locations IE-Cork Job Family GENERAL MANAGEMENT Join a Market Leader Hovione is a Portuguese multinational company that has been operating for over 60 years. From the beginning, we have set ourselves above and apart through our innovative technological and productive capabilities, reaching a top spot in the world market as an integrated contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO) offering from drug substance to drug product intermediate to drug product. Hovione recognizes that people are the main asset for the company’s continued success, reaching over 1700 team members, from 20 different nationalities located in Portugal, US, Macao, Ireland , Hong Kong, Japan, India and Switzerland, including several production sites. Working at Hovione means reaching for innovation and excellence in everything we do: for our clients, our partners and, above all, our patients. We are recruiting for the following position at our Irish site located in Lough Beg, Cork. Principal Operational Excellence Specialist The Principal Operational Excellence Specialist will actively deliver excellence in end-to-end process improvement practices, methodologies and behaviours to achieve transversally operational and support services areas’ efficiencies. This approach requires particular leadership skills to influence the right behaviours and enable alignment of priorities across areas. You will be responsible to: Demonstrate track record in process optimization, continuous improvement and business transformation projects. Propose and lead major projects on improvements with global impact in the organization Work to establish a culture and mindset of continuous improvement across the business Highlight main capacity constraints and propose possible solutions to overcame challenges Assess the necessary requirements for the adequate execution of the Company long-term plan and provide feedback Develop tools and methodologies that support technology transfer between Company Sites and Areas Perform periodic technology gap analysis and propose new technologies introduction Participate in the bidding process and support processes/projects allocation Participate/Manage transversal strategic projects teams Solve complex problems with full autonomy Make quality and timely decisions based on multiple sources of data and regarding a wide array of subjects Manage risk and uncertainty; anticipate and address roadblocks in order to prevent deviations to the goals Coach project team members to enhance company effectiveness and promote achievement of high standards within the organization Execute professional activities in compliance with GMP and HSE guidelines, internal and external requirements as well as promote the implementation and maintenance of Hovione´s policies, systems and procedures (COPs, HBR, SOPs and others). We are looking to recruit a Candidate: A minimum of a Bachelors degree in Chemisty, Chemical Engineering or equivalent. Lean and 6 Sigma black belt. Knowledge of Process Optimization. Relevant experience having worked in continuous improvement projects. Experience in application of lean tools / methodologies such as Process Mapping, DMAIC methodology, Statistical analysis, Process Plant Support Deep specialized knowledge of Process Optimization with the ability to teach others Deep specialized knowledge of Manufacturing principles, Quality, cGMP´s, ICH/CFR guidelines, ISO Norms and Industrial Safety guidelines and Regulatory Affairs with the ability to teach others Deep specialized knowledge and application of statistical tools with the ability to teach others strong trainer skills Ability to adapt the acquired knowledge to new situations. Results driven, team player, able to deal with multiple projects/tasks. Innovative and systems thinker. Available, autonomous and able to take ownership. Hovione is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer Inclusion and diversity are key to us. At Hovione, that means a work environment where differences are valued, and everyone is treated with fairness and respect. We want all our team members worldwide to feel supported, respected, and have the opportunity to achieve their full potential, regardless of their age, gender, religion, disability, sexual orientation or ethnicity. title: Supervisor, Engineering
desc: At Stryker we are dedicated to improving lives, with a passion for researching and developing new medical device products. As an engineer at Stryker, you will be proud of the work that you will be doing, using cutting-edge technologies to make healthcare better. Here, you will work in a supportive culture with other incredibly talented and intelligent people, creating industry-leading medical technology products. You will also have growth opportunities as we have a culture that supports your personal and professional development. Every day in our Stryker Model Farm Rd site, our highly skilled and dedicated teams produce hugely innovative neurovascular devices which save our patients’ lives!! If you want to be a part of this and are a natural born people leader with a passion for innovation & engineering , then this could be the role for you. Who We Want: Sets direction. People who can effectively coordinate and focus the work of skilled employees toward an important goal, prioritizing to the right activities that lead to success. Talent developers. Growth-oriented managers who recruit and hire top-performing talent and prioritize the development of their team members. Network builders. Develops and/or identifies new work processes and the improved utilization of human and material resources within the operations function. Strong communication skills with both Internal and external agents. An ability to facilitate a team of engineers to deliver a specific objective. An above average level of emotional intelligence. title: Environmental Compliance Manager
desc: Dutton Recruitment (Sheffield Engineering ) are currently recruiting: Our well established client is looking to appoint an Environmental Compliance Manager to manage and take responsibility for the Environmental, Health, Safety and Quality at their new Facility and enact the development and upkeep of related systems. This is based in Stoke on Trent. The Compliance Manager will also support the O&M plant managers of other related waste facilities within the Company Group with compliance matters. Job Duties: Ensuring compliance with the Environmental Permit for the Facility procedures and processes, and that operational systems, reporting procedures to the EA and compliance processes are optimised. Responsible for Facility environmental data reporting systems to comply with internal and external stakeholder expectations. Reporting to and working closely with the Plant Manager in managing the QHS&E Procedures and Processes. Responsible for the maintaining and continuous improvement of ISO 14001, ISO 9001, and ISO 45001 management systems. Supporting waste and by-product compliance in accordance with designated procedures, against the reference criterion. Working with the Facility operational team to ensure understanding of the Environmental Permit requirements and promoting operational excellence. Dealing with local stakeholders and members of the public who lodge enquiries about the environmental performance of the Facility and maintaining good channels of communication. title: QA Technician
desc: Just Recruitment is working with a global organisation, with a new UK site based on the outskirts of Sudbury - looking to recruit a Quality Assurance Technician with food industry experience to oversee the day to day running of the processing production line. title: Outdoor Activities Team Member
desc: Would you like a career working for one of The Times Best Big Company in the UK? Haven are currently recruiting for Activities Team Members to join our Sports & Leisure Team. We describe our Team’s as ‘bright and breezy’ living by our values ‘dare to care’, ‘yes I can’, ‘keep it simple’, ‘make it fun’ and ‘do the right thing’ for our guests. Our mission is to give our guests a great time with memories that last a lifetime. In return, we can offer you career opportunities of a lifetime. Key responsibilities will be: • Providing an outstanding indoor and outdoor activity experience, ensuring service , quality and Consistency, within a clean and safe environment catering for all. • Instructing safe and fun off activity experiences that may include football, go karts, boat hire, bike hire, golf courses, creative activities, Segway’s, climbing walls and high ropes experiences. • Ensuring all owners and holidaymakers know who to go to and are given a warm welcome and a first class service allowing a true ‘escape from urban living’ experience. • Engaging and build relationships with owners on park, actively socialising through attendance at owners’ events and being highly visible and approachable on park. • Create and support a ‘sense of community’ – a real family spirit. • Recognise dissatisfaction and deal with complaints speedily and with empathy empowering a problem resolving team, resulting in customer satisfaction and improvement to the overall guest experience. • Ensuring a robust knowledge of all products provided, identifying all secondary spend opportunities and activity experience improvements • Ensuring all activity equipment and associated environments are maintained and inspected to a high standard (full training provided). • Making sure all the activities you deliver are fun, safe and educational. • Assist with marketing and upselling all leisure activities and events. • Provide a clean and safe environment for our guests by adhering to Cleaning and Health & Safety processes • Supporting & helping other Departments on Park when required. Business Deliver the best experience to every guest every time and highlight areas that may enhance the guest and team experience. Strive to deliver the business targets. Experience: • Previous experience of working within the leisure/customer service industry • Experience of Leisure/ Sports Activities Qualifications: This role is the perfect introduction for a long term career in outdoor activities and adventure we will provide full training and induction, ongoing mentoring, feedback and training development throughout the season and assist you to work towards National Governing Body Qualifications. Such as ERCA climbing instructor, Team Gb Archery coach, Cytech Level 2 bike mechanic. This role requires the successful candidate to undergo an enhanced DBS check. Due to the qualifications and training provided the successful candidate must be 18 years and over. The Benefits of working with us: Join us for the summer, with the potential to become permanent at the end of the year, we also have many permanent roles on offer too. Competitive rates of pay Accommodation available in many of our parks if you don’t live locally 50% off food in our restaurants and take away every shift you work Regular team incentives with great rewards Opportunity to earn £300 or more when you refer a friend to join our great team Holidays Discounts of 20% for all of your family & friends in Haven, Butlins & Warner Hotels 20% off in our shops and venues Free use of Pool, Gyms and many other Leisure facilities Funded qualification development opportunities from Level 2 to Masters Degrees for permanent team members Access to the Employee Assistance Programme including support for your wellbeing and free access to advice and expertise on financial and legal matters etc Fantastic discounts when making purchases from most major retailors and hundreds of discounts on everyday purchases Team Member of the Month Awards Instant Recognition schemes with great rewards through our busiest times Long Service awards for permanent team members Our guests and our team members are vitally important to us and we need to ensure we build effective relationships, through trust, always having an approachable, friendly and helpful attitude. This will ensure our guests feel reassured that we always have their interests at the heart of everything we do Safeguarding is one of our business priorities. Our teams are committed to providing a safe and secure environment and promoting the welfare of children and young or vulnerable adults. no -- Principals only.
