title: Operations Planning / Scheduling Lead
desc: Want to receive job alerts for similar jobs ? Operations Planning / Scheduling Lead Company : Thermo Fisher Scientific Job Type : Full Time Cork, County Cork Apply Now Advertisement Job Description Job title: Operations Planning Lead Req: 190251BR The Cork site manufactures a number of established commercial products and is actively engaged in New Product Introductions from various clients. Operating for over 40 years, the Cork site is proud to manufacture and supply Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (API) to our customers for use in clinical trials and approved medicines for commercial supply - medicines to treat Cancer, Parkinson’s Disease, Depression, HIV, Congestive Heart Failure, Diabetes and Respiratory diseases, along with raw material for consumer healthcare products. Job summary The Operations Planning Lead will work directly with the wider Operations Team to lead the end to end planning of all manufacturing processes. This position is an integral part of the production module/POD team and is also a key member of the Planning & Scheduling team which has a wider focus on Materials Management and Cost control for the Operations team with a budget of ~$65M! Purpose of the role: To develop integrated production plans that are endorsed by all the relevant teams (IPC, Quality, Operations, Product Development etc.) to ensure delivery of the key projects and production processes to plan. To lead the preparation and tracking of resource plans for the Operations team. To ensure that the execution plans for assigned projects and modules are fully integrated and facilitate seamless execution across all teams on-site. To act as a key point of contact for the Supply Chain team with responsibility for ensuring the 0-3 month time frame of the production plan is achieved. To lead and partake in the introduction and engagement with Planning innovation / automation systems to ensure easier alignment and oversight of multiple projects / modules. A day in the life: Assist in the development of the weekly / monthly / annual production execution plans & revenue phasing and will participate in decisions regarding all shift / operational issues such as rescheduling, resource requirements and production planning Work collaboratively with assigned production module teams to agree schedules and resources for clinical & commercial manufacturing campaigns. Develop strong linkages across multiple teams (Process Development, Programme Management, Quality, Supply Chain) Use and optimise Performance Boards & Electronic Information Systems (e.g. batch tracking, IP21, electronic performance boards) with appropriate tiered accountability to identify waste, to improve team engagement and to contribute to positive and integrated site planning discussions Share Planning & Scheduling best practices amongst all planners within the site Planning & Scheduling Community so that approaches are standardized across all site teams. Ensure compliance with cGMP, FDA and environmental license requirements, HSA requirements and other quality regulatory agencies. Ensure targets such as ATS, ABR, SOT, Revenue, Deviation reduction, yields, expense recovery, inventory levels and similar key performance indicators are developed and tracked to delivery by the production module team. Liaise with all the necessary internal and external functions (such as Business Management, Project Management, logistics, product/process development, financial, environmental, regulatory, etc.) to support future business. Ensure that integrated planning is fully embedded within all parts of the Operations team through communication of initiatives and GEMBA on plant. Identify potential, suitable automation and software packages that can be used to enhance integrated planning across the site and ensure that our site ways of working are evolved to keep in line. The candidate will continuously develop and upskill on Industry Best Practice planning and scheduling tools as they are deployed at site. Ensure that findings are continuously reviewed and fed back to ensure consistent improvement in the performance of all performance and scheduling activities. Use PPI Tools to solve problems and remove bureaucracy. Seek to remove barriers and ‘simplify’ our processes to ensure we deliver and execute to plans. Experience required: Previous experience in a primary pharmaceutical manufacturing environment. Strong ability to communicate, lead in a cross functional environment. An ability to challenge and influence technical discussions and decisions. Strong problem solving capability in areas of engineering , equipment and logistics Proven project management skills. Previous experience of Planning & Scheduling within Operations, Maintenance, Supply Chain or Procurement, etc.. A demonstrated commitment to Quality, EHS, PPI behaviours Ability to perform in a cross-functional environment. Comfortable working across various Planning & Project Management platforms e.g. Microsoft Project What’s in it for you? Competitive base salary Annual bonus Contributory Pension Private medical insurance Free onsite parking At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 100,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission. Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status. title: Client Manager
desc: Each one of us brings something different to Vistra, working as one team to deliver the right solution. That’s why our clients choose to work with us – the power of our combined skills makes us unstoppable. Vistra offers a unique platform for our clients and our people to seize the world of opportunities. At the heart of everything we do are our core values:Committing to clients, Working as ONE Vistra, Empowering people and Doing the Right thing. Vistra has 5000 employees in 85 offices across 45 countries and are among the top 3 Corporate Service providers globally. We have fast past, exciting and entrepreneurial culture where new ideas and new ways of doing things are actively encouraged. Our clients include Tesla, Airbnb and Zoom. Canyon CTS, part of Vistra Ireland , is a leading provider of Corporate & Trust Solutionsto clients ranging from start - up tech to mid - market private equity clients, to listed public companies and are recruiting for a Client Manager to deliver accounting and administration services to a portfolio of clients. Key Responsibilities: Assist in onboarding of new clients, including co - ordinating the incorporation of legal entities where relevant Main contact for internal and external stakeholders for client portfolio on a daily basis Ensure that client reporting deadlines are met and any ad - hoc client requests are dealt with in a prompt manner Commercial review of agreements entered into by client and determining appropriate accounting for same Accountable for review and approval of all ongoing servicing activities provided to clients, including but not limited to monthly management accounts, annual financial statements, corporate income tax and VAT returns of client Financial accounting duties for client including: Ownership of the trial balance with responsibility for ensuring all accounts are reconciled and open items cleared within agreed timelines Preparation and posting of accounting journals to reflect all accruals, prepayments, and other financial transactions in line with deadlines Preparation of management accounts Preparation of consolidated and/or entity statutory financial statements (end - to - end including active involvement in audit preparation and delivery and liaising directly with auditors and other advisors as required) Preparation of reconciliations of balance sheet accounts Reconciling and managing inventory for client companies including overseeing purchase orders, sales orders, stock levels and liaising with customers and suppliers Maintenance of fixed asset register Monitoring of clients’ debtors ledger, creditors ledger and treasury management Preparation, review and filing of client tax returns (i. e. Corporation tax, VAT and Payroll taxes) Preparation of budgets and forecasts Responsible for administration of payroll were required Responsible for the internal control of the client accounting and administration processes in use; Identifying opportunities for process improvement and efficiencies, and implementing change Organising, preparing agendas for and taking minutes of board meetings and annual general meetings (AGMs) Attendance and participation at client board meetings and AGMs where required (e. g. to present financial results), and subsequent filing of the financial statements with the CRO Liaise with the internal company secretary and compliance department, and the client in relation to corporate filings to ensure compliance with Irish law and any contractual obligations Maintain excellent working relationships with third parties such as Revenue Commissioners, Companies Registration Office, Auditors, Tax advisors, Legal advisors and banks as required Oversee preparation and filing of regulatory returns to the Central Bank of Ireland, where required, on a timely basis Co - ordination and management of the annual audit process and tax compliance work, ensuring review for all audit deliverables as required. Assess client profitability Ensure clients are billed in accordance with agreed terms Ensure achievement of targets and KPIs as agreed with the directors Escalating any issues in relation to client and/or team delivery to the directors Ad hoc duties that may be assigned from time to time. Attributes/Technical Skills Excellent communication (written and verbal) and client servicing skills Excellent attention to detail and thorough and organised approach to work Strong time management skills with a proven ability to multi - task Ability to work independently and meet deadlines, being goal and results oriented Team player with flexible and hands - on approach where required Relevant Experience Up to 2 years post qualification experience, preferably in the corporate services industry or accounting practice Experience in aviation industry a significant advantage, but not essential Education & Professional Qualifications Qualified accountant (ACCA/ACA/CIMA/CPA) Bring Your Whole Self to Work We’re passionate about Diversity and Inclusion at Vistra. We believe that everyone is equal and unique, and by embracing diversity it makes us better company. This creates an environment where anyone, from any background, can do their best work; Vistra is for the ambitious, the entrepreneurial, the bold. no -- Principals only. title: AAD System Lead
desc: WHAT TO EXPECT The role will be based within the Electrical & Vehicle Engineering (EVE) Centre Of Competence, and part of the Systems team based within the Assisted & Automated Driving (AAD) Department. The Features and system team is an exciting area, designing and delivering new AAD features through definition of the customer experiences, design of the system and validation and confirmation the design meets the customer intent. The Role is responsible to lead the definition, development and delivery of harmonized systems solutions, consisting of multiple interconnected components into Jaguar Land Rover vehicles for ADAS features. The role includes the opportunity to design and define the way in which Assisted and Automated Driving Features can support our customers in their everyday journeys, through a combination of driving aids, driving assistance and driving automation. The role will require a customer focussed individual who can provide objective analysis of the user behaviour to support the definition of functional and performance related requirements associated with the features. Key responsibilities will include: Lead the system delivery to meet gateways and deliverables working to integrate the work from all areas that contribute to the system; for example Feature Owner, V&V. Lead the technical design reviews (EBER / Design) to confirm quality of system meets the targets and lead approval at Senior levels in AAD. Validate functional and none functional system requirements and targets to ensure that system meets the customer requirements. Validate the quality of the System Engineering artifacts as defined in KWS 12.13 ahead of review and approval at EBER with the senior team WHAT YOU’LL NEED As the Assisted and Automated Driving (AAD) System Lead, you will have good relevant experience of working in a Systems Engineering environment. You will have a strong knowledge of Assisted and Automated Driving Systems. Working knowledge of model based systems engineering. You will have the ability to author and review requirements either through a model or thoughts requirements defined in a structured format such as EARS. ESSENTIAL Hold a formal qualification such as degree within, Systems Engineering, Electronics, Computer Science or another relevant subject. Working knowledge of MathWorks toolchain and the creation of modelling artifacts within the MathWorks tools. Knowledge of customer quality process and metrics The ability to log data from a vehicle network. DESIRABLE Experience in Model-based Systems Engineering (MBSE) Working experience of Agile methods Experience in IBM Rational DOORS Experience in applying Systems Engineering and in solving complex technical issues using a structured approach SO WHY US? Bring all this to the home of premium innovation, and you’ll find the opportunities to further your career with a world-class team, a discounted car purchase and lease scheme for you and your family, membership of a competitive pension plan and private medical cover. All this and more makes Jaguar Land Rover the perfect place to continue your journey. Jaguar Land Rover is committed to equal opportunity for all. no -- Principals only. title: Plant Operator - Anaerobic Digestion
desc: Plant Operator - Anaerobic Digestion Attleborough, Norfolk £30,000 to £32,000 + benefits Introduction… Astute are working with an excellent business in the renewable energy sector who're looking for a Plant Operator at their plant near Attleborough. The role will be on an Anaerobic Digestion plant and as part of a team to drive forward performance and ensure the plant is running at an optimum level. If you're strong with mechanical/electrical maintenance, are leaving the forces with an engineering background, or are a strong Plant Operator and capable of driving mobile plant, we'd especially like to hear from you. Roles & Responsibilities Reporting directly to the Plant Manager, as a Plant Operator, you will be responsible for: Day to day operations on the Anaerobic Digestion plant Running the plant via a DCS or SCADA system, ensuring the plant is running as it should via the screens Visual plant and equipment fault-finding Performing first line maintenance activities, such as isolating and changing a pump Feeding the fuel into the hoppers/plant Driving a Telehandler on site Keeping the site clean and tidy Contributing to positive site operations and looking for continuous improvement opportunities Other duties as required Skills & Qualifications We are looking for someone with the following: A qualification in an engineering discipline would be ideal (HNC / HND in mechanical or electrical engineering for example) Telehandler licence and able to drive mobile plant Anaerobic Digestion experience would be ideal, but if not, someone from a treatment plant / process plant background Ability to work long days (but be rewarded with more days off) Salary & Package What's on offer for this exciting role: Salary of £30,000 to £32,000 depending on experience Genuine opportunity to make a difference to a greener plant Holiday allowance, pension and company benefits A stable, key worker positionIf you are interested in this position, please send a CV and Cover Letter to arayner@(url removed) or ring (phone number removed) and ask to speak to Aaron Rayner who can tell you more. title: Electronic Engineer
desc: Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products. Job Description The Microchip High-Reliability Integrated Power Solutions Centre, based in Ennis, is an R&D and production facility supporting the design, development, manufacturing and test of Integrated Power SolutionsTM (IPS) for high reliability applications. As the transportation sector continues to demand higher levels of power electronics reliability and integration in order to realise goals such as the more electric aircraft (MEA), Microchip’s IPS Centre of Excellence plays a critical role in supporting these objectives. Products from this centre include the Power Core Module (PCM) for Commercial Aircraft and Thrust Vector Control module for Space Launchers. The centre is now expanding and is seeking applicants to assist in the development of leading-edge new products. The successful individual will join the R&D team and work in the areas of power electronics, FPGA/microcontroller firmware and application software development for a range of integrated power solutions. These products include silicon-carbide power MOSFETs and diodes, analogue circuits, digital control, monitoring and communication circuitry. They have a power capability in excess of 5 kVA and are developed and manufactured for use in various high-reliability application areas, particularly in transportation applications. This position is based in Ennis and will involve interaction with other Microchip groups in France and USA. Job Requirements Knowledge in power electronics fundamentals Proficient in software development and the use of electrical design analysis and Microsoft Office software Experience in a high-reliability product development and manufacturing environment is an advantage Good organisation, teamwork, communication and interpersonal skills Great analytical and problem-solving skills and motivation to learn Strong time management skills, self-direction, and the desire to excel Education and Qualifications Honours Bachelor/Masters degree in Electronic/Electrical Engineering . What we offer Our global team is growing, and we are looking for collaborative, creative team members to help us lead the industry transformation to build an adaptable intelligent world Working in an environment encouraging you to grow your professional skills with specific training Working on next generation power and semiconductor devices such as silicon-carbide. Opportunity to work on new technologies with domain world leaders Competitive benefits such as: Pension, Healthcare, Stock Options etc. Microchip provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees around the world. We respect and value the diverse experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives of our employees and are committed to providing all employees with continuous opportunities for growth and professional development. title: General Operative

title: AAD System Lead
desc: Job Description REQ ID: 66522 JOB TITLE: AAD System Lead SALARY: Competitive LOCATION: Shannon, Ireland Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We - re already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand - new technology and techniques. We - re doing more than dream, we - re creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come. WHAT TO EXPECT The role will be based within the Electrical & Vehicle Engineering (EVE) Centre Of Competence, and part of the Systems team based within the Assisted & Automated Driving (AAD) Department. The Features and system team is an exciting area, designing and delivering new AAD features through definition of the customer experiences, design of the system and validation and confirmation the design meets the customer intent. The Role is responsible to lead the definition, development and delivery of harmonized systems solutions, consisting of multiple interconnected components into Jaguar Land Rover vehicles for ADAS features. The role includes the opportunity to design and define the way in which Assisted and Automated Driving Features can support our customers in their everyday journeys, through a combination of driving aids, driving assistance and driving automation. The role will require a customer focussed individual who can provide objective analysis of the user behaviour to support the definition of functional and performance related requirements associated with the features. Key responsibilities will include: Lead the system delivery to meet gateways and deliverables working to integrate the work from all areas that contribute to the system; for example Feature Owner, V&V.Lead the technical design reviews (EBER / Design) to confirm quality of system meets the targets and lead approval at Senior levels in AAD.Validate functional and none functional system requirements and targets to ensure that system meets the customer requirements.Validate the quality of the System Engineering artifacts as defined in KWS 12.13 ahead of review and approval at EBER with the senior team WHAT YOU - LL NEED As the Assisted and Automated Driving (AAD) System Lead, you will have good relevant experience of working in a Systems Engineering environment. You will have a strong knowledge of Assisted and Automated Driving Systems. Working knowledge of model based systems engineering. You will have the ability to author and review requirements either through a model or thoughts requirements defined in a structured format such as EARS. ESSENTIAL Hold a formal qualification such as degree within, Systems Engineering, Electronics, Computer Science or another relevant subject.Working knowledge of MathWorks toolchain and the creation of modelling artifacts within the MathWorks tools. Knowledge of customer quality process and metricsThe ability to log data from a vehicle network. DESIRABLE Experience in Model - based Systems Engineering (MBSE)Working experience of Agile methodsExperience in IBM Rational DOORSExperience in applying Systems Engineering and in solving complex technical issues using a structured approach SO WHY US? Bring all this to the home of premium innovation, and you - ll find the opportunities to further your career with a world - class team, a discounted car purchase and lease scheme for you and your family, membership of a competitive pension plan and private medical cover. All this and more makes Jaguar Land Rover the perfect place to continue your journey. Jaguar Land Rover is committed to equal opportunity for all. no -- Principals only. title: Composite Boat Builder
desc: Marine Resources are excited to be representing an award- winning superyacht tender company on the South Coast who are renowned for their impeccably high standards. The opportunity for experienced Composite Boat Builders to join the team has arisen as part of the company’s ongoing development plan. My client design and build a range of award-winning Superyacht tenders to impeccably high standards. The opportunity for an experienced Composite/GRP Boatbuilder to join the team has arisen as part of the company’s ongoing development plan. My client's Composite Boatbuilders are responsible for a broad range of composites related tasks on new build semi-custom and full custom vessels. The role will include everything from mould preparation, to component installation, to final fit out. This is a diverse role that requires a broad understanding of composite construction processes and small craft construction. We are looking for enthusiastic, reliable, and diligent individuals with excellent communication and interpersonal skills. The ideal candidate will have several years of experience in related employment, and the ability to work at a high standard. ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES • Composite/GRP manufacture in hand laid, infusion and prepreg materials • Pattern making for small components, working from 2D and 3D drawings • Construction and installation of internal and external structure • Installation and assembly of custom composite/GRP components into the vessel structure, including sub mouldings, lifting structures and sub-components such as hatches and doors • Equipment installation including deck hardware, lifting components, hatches, doors and windows including opening mechanisms, fabrications etc • Preparation for gel repair/ paint and basic painting processes such as filling, fairing, and priming • Problem solving and fault diagnosis • Lead a project, planning the work on the vessel, checking information and stock, planning and meeting timescales REQUIRED EXPERIENCE & SKILLS • Experienced in new build GRP construction, polyester/vinylester and epoxy • Proof of marine qualifications desirable • Experience in a high-quality new build, custom manufacturer. Superyacht tender experience advantageous • Working to a high standard • Working within set timescales • Ability to be independent as well as work within a team on a vessel project – planning own work and checking stock and information • Ability to follow instruction and work in a safe and productive manner Salary & Benefits - £15-£19 per hour dependent on experience - 20 days paid holiday per, plus bank holidays the working days fall on. Some of these days will be reserved for their 2 weeks Christmas shut down. - Working pattern Monday – Thursday 10 hours each day. - Attractive company pension from 3 months - Company life insurance and critical illness insurance from 6 months If this is something you would be interested then I would love to hear from you! Call Sarah on (phone number removed) or hit apply! Marine Resources Recruitment Ltd acts as an employment agency for permanent and fixed term contract recruitment and as an employment business for the supply of temporary workers. Please note that by applying for this job you accept our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy which can be found on our website. no -- Principals only. title: Global Service Desk Manager
desc: Primary Location : IRELAND -CLARE-SHANNONOrganization : AXA Partners - AP Global OperationsContract Type : RegularShift : Day JobSchedule : Full-time Description POSITION SUMMARY New opportunity for a Service Desk Manager at AXA Partners. This is an important role as the successful person will be part of day-to-day services for most collaborators and the central access point to End user service, AXA Partners IT and applications. The Service Desk Manager will be responsible for the design, implementation and BAU of a variety of and End users services across all AXA Partners countries. The position requires the ability to manage external providers, to think globally with client-oriented vision to transform and adapt organization. This position will report to the Head of End User Services & Workplace Guild and will manage AXA Partners End users service across regions. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Manage contractual relationship with external providerDevelop activity & process to support Agile and DevOps way of workingHelp countries to define Business case, organize governance and use central Service Desk where opportunities existEnsure service improvement and ticket reductionEstablish processes and procedures for the effective management of service-related incidents or issuesDevelop Service Level Agreements (SLAs) to establish problem resolution expectations and timeframesDevelop policies and procedures that outline how problems are identified, documented, assigned and correctedAnalyze performance of Service Desk & Desktop activities and documented resolutions, identify problem areas, and devise and deliver solutions to enhance quality of service and to prevent future problemsProvide internal consultancy advice to other business areas on service-related issues. Conduct research and attend conferences on emerging products, services, protocols and standards in support of service desk technology procurement and development effortsOversee the development, implementation and administration of service desk staff training procedures and policiesManage the processing of incoming tickets to the Service Desk via telephone, e-mail and online to ensure courteous, timely and effective resolution of end user issuesDevelop and enforce request handling and escalation policies and proceduresTrack and analyze trends in Service Desk & Desktop requests and generate statistical reports to drive and support continuous improvementAssess need for any system reconfigurations (minor or significant) based on request trends and make recommendations Qualifications Education, Professional Qualifications and Experience Minimum Education Degree in information technology or a related field. Or any equivalent combination of education, training and experience which produces the required knowledge, skills and abilities Minimum Work Experience and Qualifications Minimum of 10 years’ experience in a similar roleITIL Certification mandatory Technical / Functional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Manager of several teams and management of outsourced servicesExperience in organization transformationCapacity to manage a budget in full autonomyDemonstrated Expert judgment with the ability to quickly identify, analyze, evaluate and resolve problems at the local/regional/international level Good communication skills both written and verbalAbility to manage teams and topics transversally, in a matrix organizationExtensive application support experience in Windows based applicationsExtensive knowledge of computer hardware, including Knowledge and understanding of infrastructure architectureProven experience with motivating and engaging the team or provider to achieve results and their own development Previous experience with leading a successful technical support team to achieving KPI targetsExperience with Performance and People Management & Evaluation SkillsExperience of managing a multi-location and outsourced team in a fast-paced target driven environmentProven ability to Coach/develop individuals and apply Learning Solutions Proven track record of successfully developing and providing SLAs and Service Desk deliverablesFluent English speaker, second language such as French is an advantage Interpersonal Requirements A strong service-oriented (‘can-do’) culture, with a strong focus on the ‘internal customer’ approach, committed to exceeding customer expectations. Ability to be flexible to work with a wide variety of technology and maintain a professional demeanourSelf-motivated, good interpersonal skills with a focus on listening and questioning abilities a prerequisiteAbility to influence and motivate staff members and team as well as peers with regards to IT support solutionsAbility to respond rapidly to escalate IT issues and to communicate effectively in a confident and supporting manner. Good listening and questioning communication skills. Ability to set, measure and achieve SLAsAnalytical and logical ‘mindset’ when dealing with issues and an ability to empathise.Drive and Energy to bring new process improvements and efficiencies within the teamAbility to work effectively in a culturally diverse environment About AXA AXA Group is the world leader in insurance and asset management. We protect and advise our clients at every step in their lives, by offering products and services which satisfy their needs in the areas of insurance, personal protection, saving and asset management. AXA is the leading insurance brand worldwide, with over 100 million clients. We are transforming from payer to partner for our client, with a strong focus on risk prevention. Our mission: Empower people to live a better life. Our values: Customer First, Courage, Integrity and One AXA. AXA Partners is an AXA transversal business unit offering a wide range of solutions in assistance services, travel insurance and credit protection. AXA Partners’ role is also to implement innovative solutions emerging from the AXA Innovation unit.Our mission is to help our Corporate clients to enrich their customers’ experience, with more than 9,000 employees at their service anywhere, anytime. What We Offer By joining AXA Partners, you will work in a responsible company, which offers a real culture of expertise & diversity. Our focus is on accelerating the development of everyone’s skills, whilst offering attractive and competitive compensation and opportunities for professional development and growth. Additionally, at AXA, we work to make a real difference to people - when amazing things happen and when we create opportunities for a better life, the feeling of pride is extraordinary. no -- Principals only. title: Organisation Development Manager
desc: Job Title: Organisation Development ManagerReports to: Chief People OfficerLocation: Atlantic Aviation Group, Shannon Airport, Shannon, Co ClareApply: Email your up - to - date CV together with any supporting qualifications to adavidson@atlanticaviation. ieAtlantic Aviation GroupWith over 55 years of experience, Shannon based Atlantic Aviation Group (AAG) is one of Europe’s leading independent aviation solution providers. The company has a strong reputation of providing customers with a complete range of solutions including; aircraft maintenance & modifications, technical, engineering and design services, logistics and material solutions and international training and consultancy. This reputation is built on a proud history and tradition of superior craftsmanship, technical expertise and continuous training, which is supported by our flexible, open and partnership - based customer relationships. The company provides a range of aviation solutions including; Part 145 Aircraft Maintenance, CAMO & Technical Services, Part 21 Design Services and the EASA Part 147 Atlantic Aviation Institute which provides aviation training to airlines, MRO’s and companies around the world. Atlantic Aviation Group have an exceptional opportunity for a people development orientated individual who is seeking a role in a growing and fast - paced environment. General ResponsibilityThis is a newly created role within our HR Team. The successful candidate will work on a wide range of organisation change, learning & development and strategic HR activities that supports the business growth at this exciting time. You will be expected to lead on Organisation Development Initiatives that transform and develop a company - wide approach and philosophy regarding organisation learning and development. You will work with and collaborate with key stakeholders in the planning and delivery of organisation change, from concept through to effective execution. This is a key role within the HR function and the individual will need to be comfortable partnering with Senior Managers, Line Managers, and other key individuals to positively influence and support delivery of change. You will have a key role in leading the formation, implementation, and application of the Organisations Learning and Development strategy in a busy customer focused environment. The successful candidate will be required to work as part of a team while being self - motivated with the ability to work independently. Essential Job Function Overall responsibility to lead and manage the implementing of the organisation development initiatives. Will take personal responsibility for organisation & management developmentBe responsible for planning, sourcing, facilitating, and evaluating all learning & organisation development activities for AAGPlan and lead change and organisation design interventions from concept to effective executionSupport team initiatives in learning & development, change management, organisation design and business process managementFacilitate initiatives that drive internal talent development and career progressionTo work with the HR team and the line managers within the business to implement and optimise learning and development process and practises. To deliver / facilitate events, e. g., Performance Management training to employees with line management responsibilityAssist members of the HR team in the delivery of training and development initiatives to staffPromote and facilitate a culture of learning and organisation development across the businessAny other relevant duties including project work as assigned by your manager. Candidate Requirements Masters \ Degree in Human Resources or other relevant discipline is required. Proven track record and previous experience in a similar roleTrustworthy and have a high level of integrity and confidentialityExperience in delivering formal and informal training interventions to a multi - cultural workforceExperience in designing, delivering and validating organisation development interventions. Experience in coaching and developing others to fulfil their potentialAbility to work on own initiative on project - based tasksWillingness to learn through coaching and formal training programmesExcellent organisational skills, attention to detail and proven problem - solving skillsFlexible approach, ability to adapt to evolving environmentStrong Computer literacy – Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, HR IT SystemsAbility to work in a fast - paced environment with changing prioritiesWillingness to work and travel across all AAG locations Typical Working Conditions Must satisfy and maintain the required medical standard. Work is performed mainly in Shannon with flexibility required for other AAG sites. PPE is provided by AAG and its use is mandatory in the performance of your work. Must satisfy and maintain airport security requirements. Closing DateIf you feel your skills and experience meet the requirements of this position, we look forward to hearing from you! Closing date for applications: 2nd November 2021Atlantic Aviation Group reserves the right to close the role prior to this date should a suitable applicant be found. As a growing and ambitious organisation, we are always interested in speaking to individuals about their next career move. title: Proposals Engineer (Applications-Electronics)
desc: What you need to know The Great Yarmouth facility is our Subsea Centre of excellence and delivers high specification, high quality products to the oil & gas and renewables industry. We are looking for a self-motivated, dynamic and experienced Proposals Engineer to join our team in Great Yarmouth. We also welcome applications from those candidates who would prefer to work out of one of our other UK Proserv Offices (Aberdeen Westhill, Skene). We would expect regular travel to our Great Yarmouth Facility for client, training and team requirements. Our Proposals Engineers create technical and commercial quotations as per customer enquiries in a timely and accurate manner, ensuring all necessary documentation and company interfaces are maintained to produce attractive proposals resulting in commercially attractive revenue for Proserv. Key Accountabilities (includes, but not limited to the following) * Design control systems comprising electrical, electronic, SCADA/HMI, PLC/RTU, among others. * Provide detailed written quotations for Topside and Subsea Control Systems with emphasis given to the following tasks and in accordance with Company’s quality procedure. * Issue quotations within the specified due date. * Identify the bid requirements and confer with team for additional technical resources required to support the complexity of each bid. * Generate detailed material lists for all quotation line items which are to be supported by sub-supplier quotations where possible. * Provide labour estimates for the Engineering , CAD, and Manufacturing departments. * Liaise with Legal team to minimise company exposure and risk on bids. * Develop detailed proposal schedules, timelines, plans, milestones, and outlines. Manage the tender submission life cycle. Monitor documents to ensure accuracy prior to submittal. * Follow up quotations in conjunction with the Sales department. * Attend bid clarification meetings, both domestically and internationally, as required. * Collaborate with Proserv leadership and Sales teams throughout proposal duration, from opportunity identification and development of proposal strategy to proposal debrief. * Provide required reports to management with status details. * Involvement in continuous improvements to best practices and processes in line with the Commercial team and company requirements. Education Required * Engineering qualification in an electrical/electronic controls or energy subject. * Equivalent experience may be considered in lieu of education requirement. Preferred * Engineering qualification at degree (BEng) level or equivalent Experience Essential * Proven track record within a Control Systems environment. * Understanding of automation equipment SCADA/PLC/RTU programming/design. * Understanding of electrical/electronic equipment and application. * Proven track record in an automation design/build related environment. * Proficient in Microsoft Excel. * Ability to work as part of a team. * Interpersonal skills. no -- Principals only. title: Quality Leader
desc: Quality LeaderAre you an experienced Quality professional looking for a new and exciting opportunity with a leading multinational? eFlexes are recruiting a Quality Leader for our Clare based Multinational Client. As Quality Leader, your role will be one of the most dynamic roles within the business, sitting as part of the Management Team, you will take ownership of quality requirements at every stage of the project life-cycle. Working with teams and customers globally, you will ensure that products are designed, developed and delivered with Quality at the core. This position will primarily support manufacturing at the Clare based site. Responsibilities include:Understanding of product development lifecycles, design change, document change control, and manufacturing/production control methodologiesLeading and implementing change with exceptional analytical and problem-solving capabilityLeading Quality Management Systems operationsManaging site certifications and working with registrar and customer auditorsManaging and working with Root Cause Analysis (RCA)Working with quality tools and continuous improvement methods, including but not limited to RCA, Six Sigma, Lean Manufacturing, A3 ThinkingProspective Candidates should have:A Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Science from an accredited University or CollegeSignificant experience in Quality or related discipline, i. e.: Engineering / Supply ChainKnowledge of ISO 9001 quality management, operations, lean manufacturingHands on experience in Root Cause Analysis, and strong problem-solving skillsAuditing and Supplier quality experienceTeam Leadership, and Change Management experience are essentialExcellent communication and influencing skillsIn return… the successful candidate will gain significant leadership experience with a long-established multinational company offering a contemporary work life balance approach, Private medical care options, life insurance, pension and other benefits. Apply now, email your CV directly to angelina. oneill@eflexes. com or call 086 0205506 to discuss in confidence. no -- Principals only. title: Project Manager – Strategic Business Planning
desc: Project Manager – Strategic Business Planning Taunton/Yeovil (Hybrid home/office working model is an option) £37,189 to £39,647 pro rata per annum Hours: 22.5 hours per week 2 Year Fixed Term Post This is a great opportunity for an experienced project manager to work with our client to manage a broad range of change and improvement plans aligned to their strategy delivering long-term financial sustainability and benefits for all stakeholders. You will be able to use creative and effective agile working approaches to drive projects forward with an emphasis on supporting the services/ teams through changes and achieving the best outcomes. You will be accountable for including but not limited to: * Developing and defining protocols, processes; prepare presentations, plans, RAID logs and change controls to deliver projects across all directorates to achieve measurable, best value improvements aligned to key targets. * Clearly articulate the purpose of projects to stakeholders, enabling participation and engagement * Pro-actively engage with stakeholders, building trust, positive experiences and buy-in throughout the project. * Write compelling business cases using business analytics to support ideas, innovative solutions that will drive modernisation. * Develop and maintain resourced delivery plans that comprehensively cover all aspects of the given projects, identifying and managing all interdependencies. * Deploy technical project management tools and prepare documents to facilitate regular reporting including, flag risks/ issues, manage resources and track outcomes achieved. * Provide peer support, advice, coach, encourage and hold people to account for delivering their responsibilities within all project areas. The successful candidate will have: * Experience in managing complex projects through to delivery across a range of organisations * Proven involvement in service redesign processes * Good understanding of project management methodologies and experience in project planning, including project coordination facilitation implementation, benefits realisation. * Experience in reviewing and interpreting complex financial and analytical information to support the development of strategic plans * Experience of collaboration with a range of stakeholders, using and adapting a range of communication styles to suit the situation including influencing, negotiating, facilitating, and directing What they offer In return they offer a rewarding role in a stimulating and positive working environment, with active support for training and opportunities to develop new skills, while knowing that you are helping to make each day count for individuals and families in Somerset. * If eligible you will be automatically enrolled in the Hospice pension plan * Free car parking. * Confidential and free 24-hour Employee Assistance Programme for you and your family offering: * Counselling * Support * Legal, Financial and Medical Information and Advice * A Vitality & Wellbeing health portal Closing date: 20th March 2022 Interviews: 28th March 2022 no -- Principals only. title: Spa Manager
desc: Job Description Killaloe is a picturesque tourist town twinned with Ballia on the Tipperary side straddling the River Shannon. Killaloe is well-known for its fishing and boating activities. The hotel is approximately 1.2 km from the centre of Killaloe, and overlooks the Kincora Marina which has direct boating access to Lough Derg / The River Shannon. The property comprises of a substantial modern hotel having 32 en suite bedrooms, lounge, function room, kitchen, bar, reception, ancillary areas and a spa that is currently under construction. The hotel has a commanding view over Lough Derg to the rear with ample car-parking and gardens to the front. The property has been refurbished throughout and is finished to a very high standard. Our Hospitality Vision is to deliver a truly authentic hospitality experience. We aim to deliver true, genuine hospitality with warmth, efficiency and caring about all. We strive to create an environment with real honest interactions between our empowered team and our visitors. Each and every one of the Sionna Spa team cares about the time the customer spends with us, ensuring conversations, knowledge and service are all important to delivering a visitor’s experience that is bespoke and special. The main purpose of the role is to assist in the delivery of hotel revenue and profit growth through good planning, efficient production and cost control, particularly in your area(s) of responsibility and within the Spa Department as a whole. For more details on this role please send your CV below or contact BeautifulJobs team on 019036279 Email info@beautifuljobs. ie(Please note it is the responsibility of the client named above to contact applicants with feedback and not the BeautifulJobs team) Primary Duties Oversee the entire Spa operation to ensure quality service and standards while delivering a guest experience that is unique.Ensure compliance with all health & safety requirementsBe passionate about world class hospitality service in a 5* environmentResponsibility for the financial returns of the Spa and driving the business forwardManagement of a team of highly trained Spa therapists and Attendants with a focus on training and development Requirements No experience required The ideal candidate will have 3 years of Spa experience with at least 2 years in a management role. CIBTAC, ITEC or CIDESCO qualifications are desirableIn return, we will give you a competitive salary and benefits package as well as opportunities to learn new skills and grow your career. no -- Principals only. title: Cover Supervisor needed - Basingstoke - ASAP start
desc: Academics are looking for an experienced, resilient Cover Supervisor to work in an SEMH School in Basingstoke. This is to start ASAP, full-time, on-going. The school caters for pupils aged 11 to 16 years old (boys and girls) with social, emotional and mental health needs and other complex needs such as autism. The lessons are usually provided by the teacher. You will be expected to: Manage the class - keep the engaged, on task and manage the behaviour in the classroom Be responsible for the delivery of the cover lesson work as supplied by the class teacher. If work is not set by the teacher, you will be required to plan lessons or activities to keep the pupils engaged Provide feedback on cover work and behaviour of students.You will be required to respond to pupil's general questions but will not be expected to undertake any planning, preparation, delivery or assessment of pupils' progress and/or development. It is important that you ensure the good behaviour of the pupils and make sure the pupils engage in the learning activity. To be considered for Cover Supervisor work, you will have experience of working in schools, in a teaching or supporting role, possess good numeracy/literacy skills and have the confidence and ability to manage challenging behaviour. If you feel you possess the skills to be considered for the role of Cover Supervisor, please apply! no -- Principals only. title: Skilled PCV Technician
desc: If you love being a vehicle technician but you’re thinking “I fancy a change”, “I want more variety” or “I want to work in a team”, then we may just have exactly what you’re looking for! You’ve probably seen some of our 67 vehicles driving around The Wirral, transporting our fantastic customers across Merseyside & Chester. Those customers rely on our services to get them to work, to the high street, to hospitals, to days away and nights out – and as part of our engineering team you’ll be a key part in making sure our vehicles are in tip top condition to do just that. It’s a really important role within our depot, so we’ll make sure you’re as looked after as our vehicles are! You’ll have the responsibility of maintaining and repairing our fleet of 67 buses. Our buses include Dennis, Scania and double deckers! You will be supported by a great team of fellow Electricians, Mechanics, Technicians, Storespeople, Administrators and Engineering Managers who all pull together to do a brilliant job. And it’s not all garage-based work. You could find yourself out and about dealing with vehicle issues on the road, so it won’t always be the same four walls you’re looking at! Aside from the reward of helping to deliver an incredible experience to our customers, there’s plenty more we can offer: * Job security – we’ve been going since 1980, we turn over £1.3bn and we’re not planning on hanging our boots up anytime soon! * Free travel– for you and a household member on Stagecoach Merseyside & South Lancashire buses. That means on your days off (of which there are plenty!) you can be off shopping without worrying about parking the car, or heading off for a day in the city without paying a fortune in fuel! * A great regular income and great benefits – A competitive salary plus a good pension scheme to look after you after you’ve hung up the spanner! * Promotions – perhaps you’re happy sticking as a Technician and that’s fine by us, but if you want to progress we’ll support you every step of the way. You will be given exposure to work which will develop your skills and experience to allow you to progress your career further. Many of our Stagecoach Engineering Managers started off as Technicians – so that could very well be you in the not too distant future! You don’t have to come from a bus background (but we wouldn’t be put off if you did either!), but you will need to have worked in a engineering technician field – truck, haulage, automotive, plant, rail, farm – if it moves, it’s good experience for working on buses ! So, if you fancy working in a great engineering team to make sure Susie gets to her job interview, Abdul gets to the hospital to pick up his wife, and Tom gets home from his night out okay, then please click the Apply Now button. no -- Principals only. Recruiters, please don’t contact this job advertiser. no -- Please, no phone calls about this job! no -- Reposting this message elsewhere is NOT OK.

title: Shift Manager
desc: A well-established manufacturer of premium snack foods is seeking a confident and reliable Production Manager to maximise the efficiency of the production unit. You will use your strong leadership skills to realise the full potential of a production team, improving cost productivity, fulfilling schedules and developing employee relations. THE BUSINESS A vibrant and fast-growing snack foods manufacturer focused on supplying high quality and innovative products to major UK retailers. THE ROLE You will be responsible for running the Late Shift (2.30pm - 11.00pm) Leading and motivating a team of Production professionals. Reporting to the Factory Manager. Ensuring controllable costs are effectively managed, working within agreed budgets and effectively assigning resources appropriately. Ensuring adherence to relevant H&S and Food Safety legislation. Managing existing procedures and developing new processes to ensure food safety, quality, hygiene and production requirements are met. Minimising waste in the production process, implementing Cost Reduction Plans where required to streamline the business. Monitoring performance relative to KPI's and improvement targets. Liaise with other departments to ensure material availability and coordinating activities in order to minimise disruption to production. Ensure all briefs are conducted in a timely manner. Daily review meeting with cross-functional attendance. Maintaining Performance Management Systems for Production Team Leaders. THE IDEAL CANDIDATE We're looking for a candidate that shows enthusiasm, initiative and excellent communication skills. However, the following basic skills would be an advantage - 3 or more years in a food manufacturing environment. Good working knowledge of manufacturing processes, food production and food products. Familiarity with Health & Safety and Food Safety Legislation. Excellent leadership skills and ability to remain calm under pressure. Experience of effectively managing a large group. Teaching and mentoring skills in order to develop Team Leaders and key operating staff. High level of commercial awareness. Knowledge of internal procedures. If this job is of interest and you would like to investigate further, apply TODAY! "Kandhu Recruitment will consider all applications based on each candidate's suitability to the role or similar roles within the Food Sector and if we feel you are a relevant candidate we will process your application by adding you to our secure recruitment database and then contacting you to progress job opportunities further. We do not contact unsuitable applicants." Kandhu GDPR & Privacy Policy Statement Kandhu has fully implemented GDPR & Privacy Policies across its business and a copy of our Privacy Policy can be found by visiting our website. title: Global Product Manager
desc: Global Product Manager Salary: £depending on experience + benefits Location: Prenton, Merseyside Type: Full time / Permanent Remarkable Jobs are delighted to be assisting a Global Life Science organisation, with the recruitment of a 'Global Product Manager'. The ideal candidate for this role will have knowledge of; scientific research products, elemental reference materials and laboratory consumables along with a proven track record as a product manager. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing the overall commercial strategy for their allocated product lines. You will work closely with; marketing, sales and technical centres of excellence to understand the market needs. The Global Product Manager will be responsible for translating market input into customer value propositions and product roadmap. The Global Product Manager will play a pivotal role in driving new product development and R&D direction. You will then work collaboratively with production to bring these products to market, in a highly competitive space. 'Global Product Manager' Key Responsibilities: Own the product portfolio to deliver annual sales, profit and market share growth in line with company objectives. Support strategic planning decisions by analysing data from a number of sources, to provide insight of customer needs and product performance in the market. Gather information and understanding of competitors' strengths, weaknesses and tactics to identify any gaps in the company's service , products and product pricing. A key driver in new product proposals / development and direction of R&D Develop and maintain the relevant technical and regulatory knowledge required, in order to engage with customers at all technical levels directly and remotely. Work collaboratively with the marketing communication team to produce highly engaging marketing collateral, along with writing technical information useful to customers for social and other media channels. Create a compelling vision and inspire others to follow it 'Global Product Manager' Key Skills: Bachelors' degree in Chemistry or a closely related discipline A minimum of 5 years' proven experience in product marketing of scientific research products, reference materials or laboratory consumables Experience or an understanding of ICP, ICP-MS, AA, XRF and IC analytical techniques Existing relevant industry insight / expertise Ability to collate, analyse and interpret data from multiple sources Commercial awareness and exceptional planning abilities Understanding of regulatory issues and concerns in key markets associated with the product rang Mathematical skills for calculating market shares, sales, margins, discount and pricing etc. For immediate consideration, please apply today! no -- Principals only. title: Project Sourcing Specialist
desc: At KONE, our mission is to improve the flow of urban life. As a global leader in the lift and escalator industry, we provide solutions that add value to buildings throughout their life cycle. Through more effective People Flow®, we make people's journeys safe, convenient and reliable, in taller, smarter buildings. We have an exciting job opportunity for a Project Sourcing Specialist to be based in our Clapham, London office. As a Project Sourcing Specialist, you will oversee complex projects, and with large amounts of local and variable material spend, with object to fully understand project delivery cost, and as a result ensuring work is awarded to our key preferred suppliers, based on best price, quality, lead times and service . Key responsibilities: * Management of the planning, procurement, and execution of a project * Sourcing suppliers for regional projects * Stake holder management and continuous proactive supplier relationship and networking building and provide exceptional customer service * Negotiating prices and terms with suppliers in order to meet specified quality, delivery, and cost objectives * Responsible for meeting targets and deliverables * Timely and accurate reporting of sales and customer data * Ensuring the region is in full compliance with KONE business policies, processes, and methods Ideal Skills, Education and Experience: * CIPS level 3 in procurement * Proven track record of successful completion of projects * Construction knowledge is desirable * Direct and indirect sourcing experience is essential * Good experience with contracts and financial negotiation * Adept at managing projects independently as well as working across other business functions * Strong communicator and able to influence at all levels * Fluent English language skills is essential * Analytical and strategic thinking * Strong negotiation skills * Microsoft Office, PowerPoint, and Excel experience * Willingness to travel In return, we offer: * Excellent compensation package which includes salary, bonus, private health insurance, pension * Comprehensive learning and development programs covering a wide range of professional skills * Regular feedback through performance discussions * Opportunities for individual development * Flexibility, trust, and respect If you are someone that works well in a dynamic team, managing projects, and can take the lead in variable projects then we are keen to hear from you. To find out more information, please apply now and we will be in touch. At KONE, we are focused on creating an innovative and collaborative working culture where we value the contribution of everyone. Employee engagement is a key focus area for us, and we encourage participation and the sharing of information and ideas. Sustainability is an integral part of our culture and the daily practice. We follow ethical business practices, and we seek to develop a culture of working together where co-workers trust and respect each other and good performance is recognized. In being a great place to work, we are proud to offer a range of experiences and opportunities that will help you to achieve your career and personal goals and enable you to live a healthy and balanced life. no -- Principals only. title: Learning Behaviour Mentor
desc: Simply Education are working closely with an SEMH School in Scunthorpe, who are seeking to appoint an ambitious and inspirational Learning Behaviour Mentor. This is an exciting full-time role within a school that has an outstanding reputation for its dedication to inclusion. The school is part of a fast-growing group of Independent Schools providing specialist educational services for 11-16 year-old students with social, emotional and mental health (SEMH) issues. Their aim is to build self-belief, create social and personal opportunity, raise standards, develop ambitious personal aspirations and to create safe, trusting environments for everyone in their care – regardless of their background and circumstances. We are looking for someone who can work well within a support team and alongside teaching staff, and has a genuine commitment towards making a positive impact on the lives of children and young people. title: M&E Cad Manager
desc: Position: REVIT / CAD Manager The Role: Reporting directly to the senior management team, the role is pivotal to our design delivery. You will manage and lead the Revit and CAD team within ECS and ensure the delivery compliance of drawing design of Mechanical and Electrical Systems. The role will help inform and then deliver to the client brief, coordinating with project design teams to meet the project design deliverables. You will have the support of the senior management team and the resources of an existing experienced team, with the opportunity to develop junior staff. Principal Duties: * Manage department workload and the members of the Revit and CAD team through the duration of projects. * Develop existing processes and standardisation. * Tutor and mentor junior staff. * Undertake the drawings production and design of key 3D Revit and 2D CAD projects. * Manage input into BIM projects. * Liaise with in-house Mechanical, Electrical and Secretarial staff to enable the detail design coordination process. * Ensure quality is maintained to your own high standards. * Deliver in-house informal training in relation to REVIT MEP. * Opportunity to visit sites as and when required. * Attend to clients and other related professionals when attending meetings at ECS Consultants offices. * Continue to develop your own, as well as junior staff member’s CPD activities. * Be part of the company values. The company Since its establishment in 1998, ECS Consultants Limited has built an unparalleled reputation for quality of service in the provision of innovative, workable, solutions with a strong emphasis on sustainable engineering . These values have been reflected in steady, controlled, growth built largely upon repeat commissions from a loyal client base. Your Talents: Fully competent and experienced within Revit and Autocad. Demonstrate previous experience of managing and developing other individuals. Positive, proactive, self-motivated, flexible and adaptable approach. Excellent computer skills, including experience with Microsoft Excel, Outlook, Powerpoint and Word. Exhibit the ability to develop strong working relationships with internal colleagues (at all levels). Demonstrate communication skills. Excellent attitude to quality and attention to detail. Willing to take on responsibility from the outset. Travel required periodically. Full driving license and access to car required. Be a Team Player Our Clients and Projects: Local Authorities FTSE250 listed property investors National Project Management Companies Local and internationally recognised Architects London based projects and opportunities Offices / Education / Residential / Hotels / Data Centres / Warehousing & Industrial / Healthcare Our Values: Teamwork Commitment Professionalism Quality Place of Work: Cheadle Office with planned site visits to projects. Benefits: * Competitive Salary * Flexible Holiday Allowance, plus Christmas closure and additional day annual leave for birthdays * Work Pension Scheme * Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) * Cycle to Work Scheme * Professional Fees Paid * Free Parking * Social Events * Regular CPD Events * Investors in People Gold no -- Principals only.
